loans.name: Haleema

texts.en:
Haleema is a 47-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She requested a loan for her husband’s fruit selling business. Her husband owns a fruit shop along with his son; both are equally participating in household expenses. To cope with the increasing demand he wants to buy more stock of fruit.

With an increase in the household expenses, she wants to grow the source of income as well. She is the mother of six children. She wants to save the profit amount so that she can arrange marriage of her children. Haleema hopes that this loan will prove productive for the fruit shop and she will save a reasonable amount soon. She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy fresh fruit to sell.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is 23 years old and he works as employee in welding. He lives with his wife and his mother in Balata Camp in Nablus.  Balata Camp is a Palestinian refugee camp established in the northern West Bank in 1950 adjacent to the city of Nablus. It is the largest refugee camp in the West Bank.

He want to make his house’s two rooms better, so Ahmad is asking Ryada for this loan to repair the ceiling of the kitchen room to prevent water from entering and to paint it.  This will help him to take a step forward because he has a shortage of money to buy the things he needs for this. He is very grateful to everyone who helps him.

loans.use: to repair the ceiling of the kitchen and to paint

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en: Marjorie is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and has two children. Marjorie works hard to support her husband in tilling their farm. Marjorie is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay labor costs on the farm. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm, thus augmenting her yield and income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay labor costs on the farm

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe BENKADI sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles monogamiques à  OUAYERMA I un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme  MARIAM fait le commerce de  l’encens dans ce groupe de femme. Elle se tient en deuxième position de la  gauche vers la  droite sur la photo. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt  la matière première à Sikasso pour la fabrication de l’encens qu’elle revendra en détail au marché et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The four members of Benkadi Group are married women who average 35 years of age and 4 children. Most of them live in monogamous families in Ouayerma I, a working class neighborhood in the city of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali.

They are seeking their second loan from Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to meet customer demand. In this group of women, Mrs. Mariam sells frankincense. She's the second woman from the left on the photograph.

She intends to use her loan to buy raw materials to make frankincense. She gets her supplies in Sikasso, and retails frankincense for cash, at the market and at her home, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

She foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 35'000, to be used in part to repay the loan and interests, and in part for her savings.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make frankincense

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Doña Isabel tiene 44 años es de la comunidad de flor de pino,  por la pobreza de sus padres ella no pudo terminar su primaria, ella tiene 4 hijos y los tuvo que criar y sacarlos adelante sola trabajando en siembra y corte de café para así tener ingresos y poder darles el pan de cada día , ya ahora sus hijos están grandes y le ayudan en lo que pueden dice como no tiene luz en su casa se le hace difícil para ella tener que levantarse muy temprano para preparar los alimentos y salir  al campo a trabajar, por eso  es que ella está solicitando este crédito para la compra de un panel solar para mejorar la condiciones de vida de su familia y no estar con el peligro de cualquier accidente  causado por el candil y candela que ellos utilizan; agradecería mucho la aprobación de ese crédito.
texts.en:
Isabel, age 44, is from the Flor de Pino community.  Due to her parents’ poverty, she was not able to complete elementary school.  She has four children.  She had to raise them and get them ahead by herself.  She did this by planting and cutting coffee in order to have income and to be able to give them their daily bread.  Her children are now big, and they help her as much as they can.  

She says that not having electricity at her house makes it difficult for her to have to get up very early in order to prepare the food and leave to work in the field.  That is why she is requesting this loan to buy a solar panel.  She will do this to improve her family’s living conditions and to avoid the danger of an accident caused by the oil lamp and candle that they use.  She would be very grateful to receive this loan.

loans.use: to buy a solar system.

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina is a 56-year-old married woman, living with her husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a small crockery shop, in which he sells glasses, plates, spoons, cauldrons, etc.
 
Her husband has only a single source of income, and he has to be able to afford the expenses of utility bills, the medical expenses of his old parents and household expenses as well. He has sold his present stock and does not have cash in hand to buy new stock to sell from his shop. Therefore, Zarina requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner’s BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can increase his inventory and earnings as well.

Zarina is very thankful to the Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy crockery items for resale.

loans.name: Hernán Isaias

texts.es:
Hernán de 21 años de edad, está estudiando segundo año de bachillerato los fines de semana, ya que por falta de recursos económicos no pudo asistir a clases todos los días, los días de lunes a viernes los dedica a trabajar y los fines a estudiar, es soltero, aun no tiene hijos, con él viven sus padres, sus hermanos. Por el momento nadie depende  de él.

Hernán se dedica a oficios varios, trabaja como jornalero sembrando maíz, frijol, tiene 10 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, de sus padres y abuelo aprendió esta actividad ya que desde pequeño le gustaba salir al campo, fue así que cuando fue creciendo entendió como hacer el trabajo. Por el momento, trabaja de ayudante de albañil y antes de ello trabajo en un taller de estructuras metálicas en la ciudad. Al lugar donde está trabajando actualmente está a 10minutos a pie, el horario de trabajar es de 6: am a 1:pm


  El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar  vara para su techo, 10 cuartones, 2 libras de clavos.  El préstamo ayudara a poder tener un mejor techo ya que cuando llovía se mojaban y era incómodo para su familia. Por otra parte será satisfecha la necesidad de vivir más seguro.

   Su sueño es un día tener su familia, sus hijos poder construir su vivienda, tener su negocio de productos básicos, todo esto lo va lograr con esfuerzo con sacrificio.
texts.en:
Hernán is 21 years old and in his second year of studying for his high school diploma on the weekends. He lacks financial resources, so he is not able to attend classes every day. Hernán spends Monday through Friday working and then studies on the weekends. He is single, has no children, and lives with his parents and siblings. At the moment, he has no dependents.

Hernán has several jobs. He works as a day laborer by planting corn and beans. He has 10 years of experience in this type of work. His parents and grandfather taught him this trade when he was young because he enjoyed going into the fields. When he grew up, he understood how to do the work.

At the moment, he also works as a masonry assistant. Prior to that, Hernán worked at a metal workshop in the city. The place where he currently works can be reached with a 10 minute walk. His work schedule is from 6:00 A.M. to 1:00 P.M.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy rods for his roof, 10 planks, and 2 pounds of nails. The funds will help him have a better roof. When it rains, the house gets drenched and becomes uncomfortable for his family. Another need that will be satisfied is that his home will be more secure.

His dreams one day include having a family of his own, seeing his children build his home, and having a business where he can sell basic products. All of these goals can be achieved through sacrifice.

loans.use: to buy rods for his roof, 10 planks, and 2 pounds of nails.

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Sara es una señora de 38 años de edad, casada, tiene dos hijos de 16 y 13 años de edad respectivamente, vive junto a su familia en Suchitepéquez. 
Ella se dedica a la producción y venta de banano, lo cual lo realiza en la comunidad donde vive; esta actividad la aprendió de su familia, quienes se dedican a lo mismo desde muchos años atrás. Esta labor le generan a ella los ingresos necesarios que le permiten darle lo necesario a sus hijos. Ella comenta que tiene más de 10 años de estar realizando esta actividad, le gusta esta actividad porque es honrado y la ayuda a sentirse útil a su comunidad.
Además Sara se dedica a la producción de café lo que le genera ingresos extras que complementan su presupuesto familiar. 
Ella solicita un préstamo de Q 10,000.00 que utilizará para la compra de insumos para el mantenimiento de sus parcelas de banano.
Sara sueña con incrementar la producción de café y banano para generar más ingresos y con ello mejorar las  condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Sara is a 38-year old woman who is married and has two children, ages 16 and 13. She lives with her family in Suchitepéquez. She makes a living growing and selling bananas in her community. She learned this activity from her family, who had been doing it for many years. Her job gives her enough income to provide her children with what they need. She says she has been in this business for over 10 years and that she enjoys that it is an honest activity and helpful to the community. Sara also produces coffee, which gives her some extra income to complement the family budget. 

She is requesting a loan of Q10,000 to buy supplies to maintain her banana plots. Sara's dream is to increase her coffee and banana production to generate more income and improve the life conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies to maintain her banana plots.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is 53 years old, from Nyahururu. He is married to Alice and they are blessed with three children, aged 18, 15 and 10 years old.

Samwel is a carpenter, a business he has been running for the last 14 years. To enable him buy timber, nails, and other raw raw materials required for making furniture, he has applied for his second loan, in the amount of KES 25,000, from VisionFund Kenya.

Samwel's monthly income right now is KES 30,000 and his plan is to use profits realized from his expanded business to educate his children and to further expand his business. He hopes to be the best carpenter in his area in the future and to educate his children to the highest grade possible.

loans.use: to buy more timber, nails, and other raw materials to use in making furniture for his customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock to sell and gas to boil the corn for his stall.

loans.name: Al-Saqr Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Saqr, and it consists of four ladies who live in Aden, Yemen. Their community is in a rural area surrounded by the field with the clothes markets. and they have many clients, mostly women. The whole group took out a loan of 290,000 YER. 

Hafidha is the coordinator of her group. Hafidha is 35 years old and is married with children. She has operated a business selling fabrics, veils, scarves and various garments for many years. She will use her loan to purchase some clothing to sell to women. 

Hafidha`s most important challenges are to work hard to earn extra income and to better her business structure. She is receiving a loan of 70,000 YER from AMB and, because her loan repayments have all been made punctually, she has been able to grow her business with the reinvestment she makes from each loan. In the future, she would like to save her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase some clothing to sell to women

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad, a 24-year-old married youth father of three from Iraq, is his family's sole provider. Ahmad owns a small shop selling fresh chicken, an enterprise he established in 2010; he now has one employee. He has achieved good experience in this field and is well known in the surrounding area, enjoying an excellent reputation. 

Ahmad is requesting a $3,000 youth loan to pay the annual rent of his shop and to buy a motor generator. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits in order to provide his children with better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his shop and to buy a motor generator.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 25 years old, married to Jane and together they are blessed with two children who are in school.

He has a retail shop in Naivasha which he has been running for seven years. He has applied for his fourth loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable him to buy stock such as buckets, basins, jugs and other items for his business. With the anticipated profit, he plans to pay school fees and also expand his business.

In the near future, he hopes to own a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy buckets, basins, jugs and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, iron, and blocks for building the front wall of his house.

loans.name: Janeth María

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito 3 De Mayo se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Janeth, tiene 51 años de edad, es madre soltera de 3 hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, el menor aun  vive con ella y estudia en universidad. 
Doña Janeth tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad así como también legumbres, carnes y  productos de bazar y papelería,  ella  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su hijo le ayuda en su negocio mucho mas en las noches cuando está desocupado, ella lleva más de 23 años con su negocio el cual le ha permitido sacar adelante a sus hijos sola y darles una buena educación para que se forjen un mejor porvenir.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar víveres, carnes y  artículos de bazar y papelería. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. Sus metas son seguir adelante y tener la mejor tienda de la ciudad.
texts.en:
The "3 De Mayo" meets every fortnight in Jipijapa canton, an area known by the name "Sultan of Coffee" because of the extensive plantations of coffee here with it's incomparable flavor, it's gastronomy and the quality of it's people.

Janeth lives here. She is 51 years old, a single mother of 3 children who are now adults. The youngest still lives with her and goes to university. Janeth has a food store in her house where she sells all sorts of basic necessity items like vegetables, meats, knick-knacks and paper products. She works every day from 6 am until 8 pm and sometimes even later. Her son helps her in the store in the evenings when he is not busy. She has had this business for 23 years which has allowed her to raise her children by herself and provide them with a good education so they can create a good future. 

Janeth will use this loan to stock her store, buying foods, meat, knick-knacks and stationary. She has been a member of this communal bank since it's inception and she likes it for the support the loans provide. Her goals are to continue moving ahead and have the best store in the city.

loans.use: to buy foods, meats, knick-knacks and stationary.

loans.name: Leonor Nancy

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito 3 De Mayo se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Leonor, tiene 59 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 5 hijos mayores de edad  e independientes. Su esposo es profesor de futbol en la liga cantonal.
Doña Leonor es una muy  buena esposa que trata de ayudale a su esposo con la dura carga del hogar,  ella se dedica a la venta productos de la marca leonisa además de productos, Avon, Yanbal  (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), su forma de venta es puerta a puerta ya sea en las mañanas o en las tardes ya que no tiene un horario fijo, ya son más de 12 años que lleva así razón por lo cual ya cuanta con muy buena clientela.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa, perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos y cremas. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 14 años  y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos. Sus sueños tener  un carro para ir a vender.
texts.en:
The "3 de Mayo" loan group meets every fortnight in the Jipijapa canton, an area named after a coffee sultan, and known for the extensive coffee crops which yield excellent beans, for its gastronomical culture and for the warm people living here.

And it is here that 59-year-old Leonor lives. She is married and has five children, now independent adults. Leonor's husband is a football coach in the local league.

Leonor is a good wife and tries to help her husband with the hard work of looking after the home. Leonor works selling Leonisa, Avon and Yanbal goods (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories). She sells door-to-door, either in the morning or afternoon - she has no fixed timetable. Leonor has been doing this work 12 years and so has many good customers.

This loan will be used to buy clothes, perfumes, costume jewellery, cosmetics and creams. Leonor has been with this loan group for 14 years and she likes it because it helps her with loans. Leonor's dream is to own a car with which to go out and make her sales.

loans.use: to buy clothes, perfumes, costume jewellery, cosmetics and creams.

loans.name: Cruz Aurora

texts.es:
Cruz tiene 30 años de edad es soltera, vive con su padre en el Cantón Chimbo Provincia Bolívar.


Se dedica a la venta de ropa por catálogo. Solicita el crédito para la compra de un electrodoméstico. Con el apoyo del crédito podrá comprar sus bienes. Su desafío es la competencia y la falta de trabajo. Su sueño es terminar los estudios. En el tiempo libre  le gusta ver televisión y caminar.
texts.en:
Cruz is 30 years old, single and lives with her father in the Chimbo canton of the Bolívar province.

Cruz makes a living selling items out of catalogues. She is applying for this loan in order to buy an electrical appliance. With the help of this loan she will be able to buy this good. Cruz's challenge at work is the competition and look of work. Her dream is to finish her studies. In her spare time Cruz likes to watch television and go walking.

loans.use: to buy a television.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies such as manure and fertlisers.

loans.name: Naysa

texts.en: Naysa, 54 years old, is happily married to a farmer. The couple have been blessed with five children. Naysa has been engaged in a hog-fattening business for almost seven years. Now, she plans to purchase hog feed and vitamins to make her hogs healthier upon reaching their optimum growth, but she doesn't have enough capital. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of PHP 8,000. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she will be able to improve her business and also her income.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is married and has five children. She lives in Bohol, Philippines.  Myrna farms rice to help her husband in meeting the needs of the family.

Myrna is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor costs. With this loan, she will be able to improve her harvest thus augmenting her yield and income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor costs

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en:
Rodolfo previously accessed a 30,000 PHP loan that he utilized to purchase toys and household products such as pails, basins, and dippers for his rolling store. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children, in their personal, household and business expenditures.

He would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy more toys and household products such as pails, basins, and dippers for his rolling store. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. His profits from his business will definitely help him to cover their daily needs and his children's educational expenses. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Rodolfo dreams of having more rolling stores and hopes that his children will finish their studies. He meets up weekly with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for toys and household products such as pails, basins, and dippers for his rolling store

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
This is Gemma, 52, a resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is a widow and she has children. She and her children manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Gemma operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Gemma hopes to be more successful in her business and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Zoirkhon

texts.ru: Этого продавца зовут Зоирхон, ему 43 года. Он живет в городе Куляб. Зоирхон сильный духом, деятельный и трудолюбивый человек. У него жена, две дочки в возрасте 8 и 11 лет, и 5-летний сын. Его жена не работает, она домохозяйка. Зоирхон единственный кормилец семьи. Он обеспечивает свою семью за счет своего торгового бизнеса, который он начал осуществлять два года назад. Зоирхон доволен своим бизнесом. У него парфюмерный магазин, где он занимается продажей мужских и женских духов, туалетной воды, дезодорантов, шампуней, гелей для душа, мыла и т.д. В этой деятельности Зоирхону помогает его брат и сестра. Чтобы увеличить товарооборот в своем магазине, Зоирхону нужно увеличить ассортимент парфюмерной продукции. С такой целью он обратился за кредитом и надеется на финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
This salesman is named Zoirkhon. He is 43 years old. He lives in the town of Kulyab. Zoirkhon is a strong-willed, energetuc and hardworking person. He has a wife and two daughters, aged 8 and 11, and a five-year-old son. His wife does not have a job; she is a homemaker.

Zoirkhon is the sole breadwinner for the family. He supports the family through his trading business, which he began to implement two years ago. Zoirkhon is pleased with his work. He has a perfume store, where he sells men's and women's scents, eau de toilette, deodorants, shampoos, shower gels, soaps, and the like. In these activities, Zoirkhon is helped by his brother and sister.

In order to increase inventory of his store, Zoirkhon needs to expand the variety of perfume products. With this aim, he applied for a loan and needs financial support.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of perfume products to promote trade

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en: Cherry is a 28-year-old mother who has two school-age children. To have an additional source of income, Cherry engages in selling personal use products within her community. She plans to acquire more stocks of those products to sell but she has insufficient capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy more stock of splash colognes and other personal products to sell. She is hoping that her loan request will be granted in order for her to strengthen the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of splash colognes and other personal products to sell.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 39 years old. She is married to a farmer. She is engaged in buying and selling fish. Marites has been doing her fish-vending business for over three years. She grateful because through her initiative and with the support of her husband, they are able to sustain their basic needs. 

To have continuous growth of her fish-vending business, Marites is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase a quantity of fish. She is hoping that her loan will be granted so that she can improve her business as well gain more income.

loans.use: to purchase a quantity of fish to sell.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 40 years old now.

He provides maize-milling services (posho milling) in Ndunyu Njeru which he has been running for three years, and has applied for his eleventh loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable him to buy a dairy cow. With the anticipated profit, he plans to pay the loan amount and also expand his milling business.

In the near future he hopes to expand his dairy farming to increase his income.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and has five children. Raquel helps her husband in tilling their farm.

Raquel is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and to pay for the labor cost of the farm. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm thus augmenting her harvest and yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for the labor cost of the farm.

loans.name: Raghed

texts.en: Raghed, age 30, and a youth client from Iraq, is a tailor. She is married and has two children. Raghed works to aid her husband in providing an extra income for their family. Raghed has been running her tailoring business in her home since 2010. She has built up good experience in this field and she is well known in her local area. She has an excellent reputation. Raghed is requesting a youth loan in the amount of $1,200 in order to buy a new modern tailoring machine. She is aiming to grow her business and increase her profits, allowing her to be better able to provide her family with better life conditions.

loans.use: to buy a new modern tailoring machine.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 35 years old, married and together with her spouse they've been blessed with two children, ages 14 and 8 years old. Beatrice also supports her parents. 

Beatrice has a green grocery store and a retail shop. She has been in the business for two years now and her monthly income from her business is 23,000 KES. She will be using this loan to improve her grocery business by buying more stock of vegetables and tomatoes for resale. She will use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to buy more grocery items. This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to grow her business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy more stock of vegetables and tomatoes.

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito 3 De Mayo se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Ana, tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 5 hijos mayores de edad,  dos de sus hijos  aun vive con ella. Su esposo es sastre y comerciante.
Doña Ana y su marido desde hace 6 años decidieron arrendar un local en el mercado de la localidad para surtir un pequeño negocio, ellos venden artículos plásticos que con la ayuda de los créditos han logrado surtir aun mas,  allí venden fundas, platos, cucharas, tarinas y muchos productos necesarios para los hogares y negocios de la localidad, trabajan todos los días desde las 06h00 hasta las 18h30 y hasta más tarde dependiendo de cómo este el día y sus ventas. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar tarinas, fundas en varios tamaños, platos y otros productos de plástico. Lleva 4 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le  gusta por la ayuda que siempre le dan con los créditos para aumentar su negocio. Sus sueños son tener un local propio.
texts.en:
The "3 de Mayo" lending group meets every 15 data in the Jipijapa canton.  The canton is known as the Sultan of Coffee because of its widespread coffee plantations that have an incomparable taste, it's food and the warmth of its people.  Ana lives in this place.  She is 50 years old, married and has five adult children, two of whom still live with her.  Her husband is a tailor and businessman.  

Six years ago, Ana and her husband decided to rent a space in their local market to start a small business.  They sell plastic products which with the help of the loans they have been able stock well.  There they sell plastic bags, plates, spoons, containers and many necessary products for houses and businesses in the area.  They work every day from 6am to 6:30pm, sometimes later depending on the day and their sales.  

This loan will be used to purchase containers, different sized plastic bags, plates and other plastic products.  She has been in the lending group for four years and she enjoys it because of the help that they continue to give her with loans to expand her business.  Her dream is to have her own store.

loans.use: purchase containers, plastic bags, plates, and other plastic products.

loans.name: Confiance Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe CONFIANCE sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles monogamiques à  OUAYERMA I un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme DJENEBA en deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo fait le commerce de bazin brodé qu’elle achète à Bamako auprès des couturiers. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt des bazins brodés au grand marché  qu’elle revendra en détail à Sikasso et en famille à une clientèle composée principalement de femmes au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne
texts.en:
The four members of the Confiance group are married women who are on average 37 years old with five children. Most of them live in monogamous families in Ouayerma, one of the popular quarters of Sikasso in the third administrative region of Mali. 
This is their second loan from the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy their clients' needs. Mrs. Djeneba is the second from the left in the photo. She sells embroidered bazin fabrics  that she buys in Bamako from the dressmakers there.
With her loan she plans to buy embroidered bazin fabrics at the big market . She will sell them retail in Sikasso and within her family to her mainly female customers for cash or credit.
She plans to make an average monthly profit of 25 000 francs CFA some of which she will use to repay her loan and the interest, and the remainder of which she will add  to her savings.

loans.use: To buy embroidered bazin fabrics.

loans.name: Dúo San Pedro San Pablo Group

texts.es:
DUO SAN PEDRO SAN PABLO
Este dúo está conformado por María Luisa de 37 años de edad ella es originaria de San Andres itzapa , es  casada y madre de familia, ella tiene su negocio y es la primera vez que solicita un crédito con kiva ya que desea seguir agrandando su negocio, doña María Luisa  es propietaria de una tienda y esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles para la venta.
texts.en:
San Pedro San Pablo Duo:

This duo is made up of  María Luisa, a 37 year old native of San Address Itzapa who is a married mother.  She has a business and this is the first time she has sought a loan from Kiva because she wants to continue growing her business.  María Luisa is the owner of a store and she is seeking this loan to purchase food products to sell.

loans.use: purchase food products to sell.

loans.name: Jehad

texts.en:
Jehad is 26 years old; he lives with his wife in Balata Camp at Nablus. Balata Camp is a Palestinian refugee camp established in the northern West Bank in 1950, adjacent to the city of Nablus. It is the largest refugee camp in the West Bank. 

Jehad asking Ryada for this loan to build a ceiling and install doors and windows, which will help him to take step forward, because he has a shortage of money to buy the materials he needs. Temporarily, they live in a relative’s house until their house is ready. He is very grateful to everyone who helps him.

loans.use: to build ceiling and install doors and windows

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is 30 years old, married, and from Nyandarua. They have one child who is three years old.  Robert is a farmer and has been in it for the past two years. He has applied for his second loan from Vision Fund Kenya, to enable him buy seedlings and fertilizers to use on his farm.  He hopes to expand his business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Jorge  vive en la comunidad de flor de pino, tiene 45 años él tiene su casa donde vive con su esposa y  sus dos hijos, ellos  se dedican a la siembra de granos básicos y  el destace de cerdo  además también trabaja  en una finca cercana   su trabajo ahí es llenar bolsas con tierra para luego hacer viveros esto le permite a él tener otros ingresos ya que la situación económica esta difícil así que él dice siempre está buscando que hacer.  Esta es una comunidad que está aislada  por lo que no hay  red de energía eléctrica  y en su casa como en el resto del caserío de la comunidad lo que hacen es usar candiles y algunos pues están  a oscuras del todo  así que por eso solicita este crédito para poder  apoyar a su esposa que le toca levantarse muy temprano a preparar los alimentos para que ellos se vayan al campo a realizar las labores de la siembra, y así tener una mejor condición de vida él y su familia
texts.en:
Jorge lives in a the Flor de Pino community.  He is 45 years old and has a home where he lives with his wife and their two children.  They work planting basic grains and butchering pigs.  He also works in a nearby farm where he fills bags with dirty to use to make nurseries.  This allows him to have additional sources of income, and because the economic situation is so difficult, he is always looking for something to do.  

This is a community that is isolated as there is no electrical grid, and in his home, like the rest of the region, they use candles and some are completely in the dark.  For this, he is seeking a loan to help his wife who must wake up very early to prepare breakfast so that they can go to the fields to work, as well as improve the living conditions of him and his family.

loans.use: purchase a small solar energy system for his home.

loans.name: Jonal Rith

texts.es:
Jonal de 26 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado de educación básica, actualmente está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, es padre de dos hijos, uno de ellos estudia tercer grado de educación básica, vive solamente el núcleo familiar.

Jonal se dedica desde su infancia a los trabajos del campo, el que ayudaba a su padre a sembrar maíz, frijol, maicillo, además trabaja en cuidar ganado. La distancia donde él trabaja está a 45 minutos la hora de entrada es  de 6 A.M hasta las 5.PM

Necesita el préstamo, ya que desea comprar unas vacas, las cuales piensa engordarlas y reproducirlas, el préstamo le ayudara ya que  no cuenta con esa cantidad, para poder  comprarlas aunque el  ganado  están a precios bajos.

Jonal  sueña con poner una ganadería en su futuro y que sus hijos sean profesionales. Las ganancias las invertirá en la educación y también para seguir comprando ganado.
texts.en:
26-year old Jonal has a grade 6 education. He is married and his wife works as a servant. He has two children, one of whom is in grade 3. There are no other family members living with them.

Ever since he was a child, Jonal has worked the land, helping his father grow corn, beans, sorghum; he also raises livestock. It takes him about 45 minutes to get to work, and he works from 6 am to 5 pm.

Jonal needs a loan as he wishes to buy some cattle to raise and breed. The money will be a great help as he doesn't have enough to buy them even though prices are low. 

His dreams are to have a cattle ranch in the future; he also wants his children to get good jobs. He will invest the money he earns in his children's education and also in buying more livestock.

loans.use: buy cattle

loans.name: Arshad

texts.en:
Arshad, a 33-year-old married client from Iraq, has two children and is the sole provider for his family.

He owns an entertainment center where teenagers gather in their free time to play billiards and spend some fun time together. Arshad established his business in 2011 and has two hired employees. He has an excellent reputation in the neighborhood and has earned the respect of the entire village.

Arshad is applying for a loan of 2,400 USD in order to buy two new pool tables. Through this loan, Arshad aims to grow his business and increase his profits so he may increase his entertainment services in the future and provide a better income for his family.

loans.use: to buy two new pool tables.

loans.name: Mavzura

texts.ru: Мавзуре 35 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Мавзуры - среднее образование. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Мавзура занимается полеводством и животноводством, стартовав 17 лет назад, с 4,000 сом KGS. Опыт у Мавзуры колоссальный в ведении сельского хозяйства. Благодаря упорному труду Мавзуры, на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 8 овец, а также 1,0 ГА арендованной земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает овощи и фрукты для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Мавзура обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом на покупку семян овощей, а также минеральных удобрений и ядохимикатов для обработки земли. Доходы от кредита Мавзура планирует вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство нового помещения для содержания скота.
texts.en:
Mavzura is 35 years old, married, and with her husband is raising three children. Mavzura has a secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, Mavzura raises crops and livestock, having begun 17 years ago with 4,000 som KGS. Mavzura has huge experience in agriculture. Thanks to her hard work, Mavzura currently has: three dairy cows, eight sheep, and also 1.0 hectares of arable land, on which she plants annually vegetables and fruit for on-farm use and sale. Monthly income amounts to 12,000 som (KGS).

With the aim of further developing her farm, Mavzura applied to the bank Bai-Tushum for a loan to purchase vegetable seeds, and also mineral fertilizers and pesticides for preparing the land.

Mavzura plans to invest income from the loan in further propagation of the quantity of domestic livestock, and plans to save money for the construction of a new premises for tending the livestock.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Soutoura Group

texts.fr:
Les six  membres du groupe SOUTOURA sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, et ont en moyenne  4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles nucléaire à  HAMDALLAYE un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt dans ce groupe qui évolue avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso, dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Mme RAMATOU fait le commerce de l’atieké dans ce groupe de femmes. Elle est assise en première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt 2 sacs de 50 kg d’atieké à Sikasso ville. Sa vente se fait au marché, elle vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée des femmes et hommes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 28 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The six members of the Soutoura group are married women who are on average 36 years old with four children. Most of them live in nuclear families in Hamdallaye, one of the popular quarters of Sikasso, in the third administrative region of Mali.
This is the eighth loan for this group that collaborates with the Soro Yrirwaso micro-finance institution, hoping to satisfy their clientele.
Among this group of women, Mrs. Ramatou sells attieké (a sort of couscous). She is sitting first on the left in the photo.
With her loan she plans to buy two sacks of 50 kilograms of attieké in Sikasso. She sells her product at the market for cash or credit to her male and female  customers.
She hopes to make an average monthly profit of 28 000 francs CFA, some of which she will use to pay the loan and the interests and the remainder of which she will save.

loans.use: to buy attieké (a sort of coucous)

loans.name: Sila

texts.en:
Sila is 26 years old, married to Ann, and they are blessed with three children between two and six years old.  He runs a general retail shop in Kamelil location in Nandi county and is served. He has been in this business for the last three years.  From this business he has a monthly profit of KES 10,000.  He has borrowed a loan of KES 45,000, which he will use to purchase wheat flour, sugar, rice, bar soap, washing powder, and cooking fat, among other items for resale in his shop.
 

He will use the anticipated profits to pay his first born child’s school fees, as well as expanding his business. His dream is to give the best to his family as the bread winner, as well as expand his business to a point that he will be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, sugar, rice, bar soap, washing powder, and cooking fat, among other items for resale in his shop.

loans.name: Genisa

texts.en:
Genisa is married and has three children. She is from Trinidad, Bohol. Genisa has been engaged in a rice farming business with her husband for several years now.

Genisa is requesting a loan to pay for fertilizer, pesticides and farm labor. With this loan, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm, thus augmenting her yield and income. 

Genisa also wants to save money for the future schooling of her children.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, pesticides and farm labor.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan de 33 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado, actualmente está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a la venta de agua en la ciudad, viven con sus tres hijos, dos de ellos estudian uno tercer y otro segundo grado, el otro aún es muy pequeño para ir a la escuela, nadie más vive con ellos.

Juan toda su vida ha trabajado en la agricultura, siembra de maíz y hortalizas, aprendió porque la ayudaba cuando estaba pequeño a su padre, su trabajo le queda cerca, se tarda 10 minutos en llegar, está trabajando desde las 6.AM  hasta las 11.AM.

Juan necesita el crédito para comprar los insumos para sembrar 2187.5 metros cuadrados de frijoles y 437.5 de pepino, espera sacar buena producción para generar más ganancias para el sustento de la familia y que sus hijos terminen el año escolar y que sigan estudiando.
texts.en:
33-year old Juan has a grade 3 education. He is married and his wife sells water in the town. They have three children, two of whom attend school (one is in grade 3, and the other in grade 2), and the third is still too young to go to school. No one else lives with the family.

Throughout his life Juan has worked on the land growing corn and vegetables. He used to help his father when he was a small boy and this is how he learned about farming. It takes him about 10 minutes to get to work as it is nearby. He works from 6 am to 11 am.

Juan needs a loan to buy farming supplies. He wishes to plant 2187.5 square metres with beans, and 437.5 with cucumbers. He expects to get a good harvest from his fields and generate more income for his family. Juan hopes his children will finish the school year and then continue with their studies.

loans.use: buy supplies and plant beans

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
This is Pacita, 59, resident of Payatas, Philippines. Single, she manages her house while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Pacita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP-5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Pacita dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes to have a better living.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Rasif

texts.en:
Rasif has a phone store. He is engaged, and wants to get married this year. Now he lives with his parents at Yaglivend village of Fuzuli. They are IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from Fuzuli city. 

Rasif wants to get married, and for this reason he needs increase new business. So, a while ago Rasif opened a store. In this store he sells phones. 

Today, Rasif needs more stands for his store. Therefore, he has applied to Komak Company for a loan in the amount of 1,350 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). 

He says he is thankful for this support from the Kiva organization and lenders.

loans.use: to buy more stands for his store.

loans.name: Martha Isabel

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Nuevos Horizontes se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Martha, tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo 21 años el cual aun vive en su casa y  estudia en universidad. Su esposo trabaja en el municipio local.
Doña Martha para salir adelante y ganar algo por su cuenta para ayudar con los gastos del hogar desde hace mas de 15 años surtió una pequeña  tienda de víveres en su casa, allí además de vender víveres, carnes, y legumbres también vende productos de  Avon (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), este negocio lo empezó  con el primer crédito que recibió del banco y  luego con la ayuda de los créditos lo ha ido aumentando hasta tener su tienda bien surtida como está actualmente, trabaja todos los días en ocasiones con la ayuda de su hijo pero no es por mucho tiempo pues él tiene sus ocupaciones.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar víveres y productos Avon para satisfacer a sus clientes. Está en el Grupo De Crédito  desde hace más de 15 años y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ella empezó  su negocio con el cual se gana la vida. Sus sueños  son seguir mejorando día a día.
texts.en:
The Nuevos Horizontes lending group meets every 15 days in the Jipijapa canton.  The canton is known as the Sultan of Coffee because of its extensive coffee plantations that have an incomparable taste, as well as for its food and the warm people.  Martha lives in this place.  She is 41 years old, married and has a 21 year old son who lives in their home and goes to college.  Her husband works in the municipality.  To get ahead and earn money to help with the household expenses, she opened a small grocery store in her home about 15 years ago.  There, along with convenience store items, meats and  vegetables, she also sells Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, fragrances and accessories for women).  She began this business with the first loan she received from the bank.  Later, with the help of loan she has been able to expand it until she had a well-stocked store like it is now.  She works every day, sometimes with the help of her son, although he does not always help since he has his own commitments.  

This loan will be used to stock her store.  She will purchase groceries and Avon products to satisfy her customers.  She has been in the lending group for more than 15 years, and she enjoys it because thanks to the loans, she has been able to start a business that allows her to earn a living.  Her dream is to continue to improve day by day.

loans.use: purchase food and Avon products.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is a 37-year-old female, married with two children, aged 12 and 9 years old, whom she supports. She sells shoes. Her business is located at Mpeketoni. She has been in this business for five years and she earns a monthly income of KES12,000.

This is her fifth loan of KES 60,000. She was introduced to Visionfund Kenya  by the Visionfund officer.  She’s planning to use the loan to purchase more stock for her business. She will use the profit to do commercial farming. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to build rental houses at her plot and educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her business

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is 41 years old and is living with her husband and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband provides the services to change the seat covers of vehicles.  He purchases ready-made seat covers and stitches as well.  His shop is situated in the vehicles' workshop market. He has to be picked by a customer and then must convince them to change the seat covers of their vehicle.

He does not take too much of the customer's time and quickly changes the seat covers. Earlier he was providing services only for motorbikes seats, but now he wants to provide services for the various cars as well. For this purpose he wants to buy various colors and types of rexine (an artificial leather) so that he could show his arts for sewing car seats also.

Therefore, Salma requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy various types of rexine.

Salma gives thanks to Kiva and their field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy raw material for sewing seat covers for vehicles.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is 34 years old, married to John and together they are blessed with four children who are in school.

She has a business selling vegetables and fruits in Naivasha which she has been running for ten years and has applied for a first loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable her to buy a stock of tomatoes and mangoes to sell. With the anticipated profit, she plans to invest more in her business.

In the near future, she hopes to be among the top vegetable dealers in Naivasha.

loans.use: To buy a stock of tomatoes and mangoes to sell.

loans.name: Francisca Kerly

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Nuevos Horizontes se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Francisca, tiene 52 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos, cuatro de ellos mayores de edad, el menor tiene 11 años y  estudia en escuela. El marido es albañil. 
Doña Francisca desde hace varios años aprendió corte y confección en un centro artesanal de la ciudad, con la finalidad de obtener sus propios ingresos ya que con lo que gana su marido no les alcanza decidió instalar en su casa un pequeño taller de costura, allí ella se dedica a confeccionar ropa para damas y niños, la época mas buena para su trabajo es en entrada a clases ya que tiene que elaborar muchos uniformes, aunque casi nunca le falta trabajo por la calidad de su trabajo, son mas de 30 años que lleva realizando esta labor razón por lo cual sus clientes la prefieren.
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas y otros materiales para la costura. Lleva tres años en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Crédito Nuevos Horizontes Group meets twice a month in Jipijapa canton. The canton is known as the Sultana of Coffee because of its extensive coffee plantations, its incomparable coffee, its food, and its friendly people.

52-year old Sra. Francisca lives there with her partner and their five children, four of whom are now adults, and the fifth is 11 years old and attends school. Her husband works in construction.

Several years ago Francisca learned about sewing and dressmaking in a craft centre in the town so she could earn her own living as the money her husband earned was not enough. She decided to open a small sewing workshop in her house where she makes clothing for women and children. The best time of year for her business is at the beginning of the school year when she has to make many uniforms. However, she is rarely short of work because of the quality of what she does. She's been sewing for more than 30 years and has a loyal clientele.

This new loan will be used to buy fabric and other items for her sewing business. Francisca has been with the group for three years, and she appreciates the help it provides with loans. Her dream is to provide the best she can for her children.

loans.use: buy fabric and other items for her sewing business

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy previously accessed a PHP 30,000 loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in her personal, household, and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another loan, in the amount of PHP 12,000, to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell should result in greater profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and contribute to her children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Nancy hopes that her business will grow bigger and she dreams that her family will live in abundance. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and she also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Priscila

texts.en:
Priscilah is 29 years old and is married to Mudagala who produces additional income; they don't have children. She runs an M-PESA shop and she has been in business for three years. Right now her monthly income from the business is KES 50,000.

She is borrowing KES 100,000 which she intends to use to expand her business by adding more float to her business. She plans to expand her business and to diversify into farming.

This is her second loan; she successfully paid back her previous loan. Her hopes and dreams are to penetrate more into business and to ensure her family is having a comfortable life.

loans.use: To expand the business.

loans.name: Juana Elvira

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Nuevos Horizontes se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Juana, tiene 54 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo el cual ya es mayor de edad y vive con ella.
Doña Juana para salir adelante ella y su hijo realizo el primero crédito y con esto surtió una pequeña  tienda de víveres en su casa, con el paso del tiempo la fue mejorando y después empezó a vender artículos de bazar y papelería con lo cual su cliente y ganancias mejoraron,  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su hijo le ayuda cuando él está desocupado, pero es ella la que siempre esta brindando el mejor servicio a sus clientes ya que es así como su clientela es fiel y mejora mas con el paso de los días.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar y otros víveres que no tiene para satisfacer a sus clientes. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace más de 15 años y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ella empezó  su negocio con el cual se gana la vida. Sus sueños  son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The Nuevos Horizontes (New Horizons) group meets every fifteen days in the Jipijapa canton, which is named for the sultan of coffee and is known for its large coffee crops, which have an incomparable taste, for its food, and for the warmth of its people. 

This is where Juana lives. She is 54 years old and the single mother of one son, who is an adult and lives with her. In order to move forward, Juana and her son took out their first loan, with which they stocked a small grocery store in their home. As time passed, the store improved and, later, they began to sell household items and paper goods. This increased the number of customers and their income. 

She works every day from 6:00 am until 8:00 pm, and sometimes later. Her son helps when he is not busy, but it is she who is always providing excellent service to her customers. This is why her customers are loyal and increasing day by day. 

She will use this loan to stock her business by purchasing rice, sugar, and other goods that she is lacking so that she can satisfy her customers. She has been a member of this group for more than 15 years and she likes it because, thanks to the lenders, she started her business, with which she earns a living. Her dream is to move forward.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, and other goods.

loans.name: Argelio Urrutia

texts.es:
Argelio de 29 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato vive con sus padres, tres sobrinos y una hermana, él trabaja como quesero, procesando leche en la ciudad, sale a las 5.A.M en motocicleta  hacia el trabajo, luego sale en carro a recoger la leche a los alrededores del municipio  para regresar a procesarla.

Con el préstamo quiere cancelar la deuda que adquirió al comprar una motocicleta, dice que paga muchos 
Intereses y le exige el pago total. Con el préstamo le sale más barato y eso ya se convierte en una ayuda económica. 
Argelio desea en un futuro es construir una casa en la propiedad de sus padres, para luego casarse y tener una familia, pagar el préstamo a tiempo y tener acceso siempre y así comenzar a construir  la casa.
texts.en:
Argelio is 29 years old. He has a high school diploma and lives with his parents, three nieces and nephews, and his sister. He works as a cheesemaker, processing milk in the city. He leaves at 5:00 am on his motorcycle to go to work. Later, he travels by car to collect milk from the surrounding areas and takes it back to be processed. 

With this loan, he would like to pay the debt that he acquired when he purchased his motorcycle. He says that he pays a lot of money in interest and he would like to pay the full amount. With the loan, the payment will be cheaper and it will be a financial help.

Argelio would like to build a house on his parents' property, get married, and start a family. He would also like to pay back the loan on time, have access, and begin to build a home.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Raed

texts.en:
Raed is a hard-working client from Iraq. He is 41 years old, married and has two children. He is the only provider of the family. Raed owns a hardware store where he sells basic electrical supplies such as bulbs and duct tape. He has been in this field since 2007 and has been gradually expanding his experience. 

Raed has an excellent reputation and has earned the respect of his neighborhood. Raed is requesting a loan of $2,400, which he will use to buy a motor generator and to install a rolling shutter. He is aiming to expand his business and increase his profits so that he may provide his children with a bright future by educating them and giving them the best of everything.

loans.use: to buy a motor generator and install a rolling shutter

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther was born in Murang'a and moved to Nairobi a few years ago in search of a better lifestyle. She established a hotel business which has been core for the upkeep of both her and her three children. 

She saw a Fresh Life toilet in the past and got interested by the impact it had on sanitation and spotted a business opportunity. She also has a desire to help sort out the sanitation issue faced by traders in the area where her business is established. She seeks a loan to help her purchase two Fresh Life Toilets. These facilities will be an add-on to her family's source of income and go a long way in solving the sanitation problem around her business premises.

loans.use: To purchase and run two Fresh Life Toilets.

loans.name: Tasleem

texts.en:
Tasleem is a 36-year-old widow lady and the mother of three children. Her elder son is very young; he wants to drive an auto rickshaw because there is no other person at home who can earn money. 

Tasleem has been saving for many days to buy a new auto rickshaw for her son but mostly her savings had to be spent on an eye operation. Now she wants to buy a new auto rickshaw for one of her sons. 

Therefore, Tasleem has requested a loan for her son so he can buy a new rickshaw with the contribution of savings. She hopes that her son will drive the auto rickshaw with full devotion and earn a sufficient income. She is very happy after taking this loan; she thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a new auto rickshaw for her son.

loans.name: Lamine

texts.fr:
Mr LAMINE est né vers1963 à IFOLA cercle de Sikasso ( 3ième région administrative de la république du MALI). Il vit à  IFOLA, un village situé à environ 20 km de la ville de Sikasso.
Il mène des activités d’achat et de vente de céréales il y'a plus de trente ans. Son expérience dans ce domaine, lui a valu une bonne réputation.
Il reçoit des commandes de divers clients. Ainsi pour avoir les ressources nécessaires afin de satisfaire ses clients; Lamine décida de collaborer avec l’Institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso, il ya également 7 ans, les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.  
Ce prêt lui permettra de faire l’achat et la revente d’environ 30 sacs de 50 kg de céréales. Il s’approvisionne sur place à Ifola, Farakala, Zaférébougou. 
 Les céréales achetées sont stockées dans son magasin à Ifola pendant une bonne période. Il les revend à Ifola ainsi qu’à Sikasso au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 150 000 francs CFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer le prêt et son intérêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
Il compte devenir un grossiste afin d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Mr. LAMINE was born around 1963 in IFOLA, in the Sikasso circle (3rd administrative region of the Republic of MALI). He lives in IFOLA, which is a village located about 20 km from the city of Sikasso.

He has been engaged in the purchase and sale of cereals for over 30 years. His extensive experience in this activity has earned him a good reputation. 
He takes orders from a variety of clients, and in order to have the necessary resources to meet customer demand, Lamine decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution seven years ago. All past loans were correctly repaid. 

This new loan will allow him to buy and sell approximately 30 sacks of cereals of 50 kg each. He buys his stock locally in Ifola, Farakala, and Zaférébougou.

The cereals purchased will be kept in storage for some time at his place of business in Ifola. He will sell the merchandise in Ifola and Sikasso, for cash or credit, to a clientele consisting of both men and women.  

He expects to earn an average monthly profit of 150,000 FCFA, which will allow him to repay the loan and interest. Any remainder will be reinvested in his activity. 

His goal is to become a wholesaler to bolster his sales and better meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es: Jennifer con apenas 20 años, es una joven muy trabajadora  y dedicada, es soltera no tiene hijos y acaba de terminar sus estudios de secundaria, tanto ella como  su familia trabajan en el campo, son ganaderos y agricultores. El plan de inversión de Jennifer es comprar terneros para el desarrollo y engorde, luego venderlos a una subasta ganadera. Ella desde que cumplió su mayoría de edad solicito su primer crédito y es lo que le ha permitido ayudarse con los estudios, ahora piensa asistir a la universidad, y es su actividad productiva la que le permitirá pagarse los estudios; Sus padres le ayudarán un poco más para transporte y otros gastos para asistir a clases.  Esos son los planes a futuro de esta joven emprendedora que tiene muchos deseos de superarse. Junto  a ella están en el grupo 4 socias más que también van a invertir en actividades agropecuarias.
texts.en:
Jennifer, who is just 20 years old, is a hardworking and dedicated young, single lady with no children. She just finished her high school studies, and she and her family work in the field as ranchers and farmers. The loan is to buy Jennifer calves for fattening and development to then sell at a livestock auction. Jennifer requested her first loan, and this is what allowed her to help with her studies. Now, she plans on attending college, and this is a productive activity that will allow her to pay for college. Her parents will help a little more with transportation and other expenses to attend classes. Those are the future plans of this young entrepreneur who is eager to overcome.

There are also 4 other members of this group, who will also invest in agricultural activities.

loans.use: En la compra de terneros, y sus alimentos y las vitaminas necesarias para el desarrollo.

loans.name: Tania Justina

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito 3 De Mayo se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Tania, tiene 49 años de edad, recién hace pocos días su marido falleció por lo cual se siente muy triste, sus dos  hijos de 27 y 15 años son su fuerza y razón de seguir adelante, además de un nieto de 5 años que vive con ella, su hijo menor estudia en colegio  y su nieto en escuela. 
Doña Tania siempre le ha gustado trabajar para salir adelante, ella se dedica al comercio igual como lo hacía su marido, vende zapatos de todo tipo y tiene  un pequeño puesto el mismo que instala en una de las calles de la ciudad donde muchos comerciantes ofrecen sus productos,  trabaja allí todos los días desde las 8h00  hasta las 18h00,  vende solo al contado y a veces a crédito pero solo a clientes que son muy conocidos y confiables. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil y a Cuenca lugar donde consigue más barato. Ella tiene más de 24 años con este negocio el cual lo tenía con su fallecido esposo.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar zapatos de todo tipo. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan para salir adelante. Sus sueños son tener un local propio en el centro  de la ciudad.
texts.en:
3 de Mayo Communal Bank meets every two weeks in Jipijapa Canton, known as The Sultan of Coffee because of its extensive and incomparably flavored coffee crops and for its cuisine and the warmth of its people.

This is where Tania lives.  She's 49 years old and very sad, because just a few days ago her husband died.  Her two children, 27 and 15, are her strength and her reason for living.  She also has a grandchild, 5, who lives with her.  Her younger son is in high school and her grandson in elementary school.

Tania has always enjoyed working to get ahead.  She makes a living in commerce just as her husband did.  She sells all types of shoes and has a small stall set up in one of the city streets where a lot of vendors sell their products.  She works there every day from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m., selling only in cash and sometimes on credit, but only to very well-known and trustworthy customers.  Tania buys her merchandise in Guayaquil and Cuenca, where it's cheaper.  She has had the business for more than 24 years, having had it with her husband who died.

Tania's going to use this loan to buy all types of shoes.

She has been with the community bank since the beginning and she likes it because she can get ahead.  Tania's dream is to have her own space in the center of the city.

loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Rosa Narcisa

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Nuevos Horizontes se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 39 años de edad, está separada, pero de esa relación tiene 4 hijos de 22, 18, 15 y 2 años, todos vive con ella y la de 15 años estudia en colegio. 
Doña Rosa es una mujer muy luchadora que le ha gustado siempre trabajar para salir adelante ella sola y sus hijos, tiene un negocio de compra y venta de embutidos, ella con la ayuda de su hijo mayor todos los días salen en su carro a comprar los embutidos en una distribuidora mayorista para luego salir a recorrer por toda la ciudad y campos aledaños ofreciendo sus productos ya sea en tiendas o de casa en casa, ella ya tiene muchos clientes que ha ganada en estos 6 años que lleva en este negocio ofreciendo un buen producto y la mejor atención.
Este crédito es para comprar embutidos en muchas variedades para satisfacer a sus clientes. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace de 7 años y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ella empezó  su negocio con el cual se gana la vida. Sus sueños  son tener una propia distribuidora de estos productos.
texts.en:
The Nuevos Horizontes (New Horizons) credit group meets every 15 days in the Jipijapa canton. This area is named for the sultan of coffee and known for the large coffee crops, which are unrivaled in taste, for the food, and for the warmth of its people.

This is where Rosa lives. She is 39 years old, separated, and has 4 children, ages 22, 18, 15, and 2. They all live with her and the 15-year-old attends high school. Rosa is a hardworking woman who has always enjoyed working to move herself and her children forward. She has a business where she purchases and sells lunch meat. Every day, with the help of her oldest son, she leaves in her car to purchase the meats from a bulk distributor and then sells the products to stores or homes in the city and in the countryside. She has earned many customers in the past 6 years that she has had this business because she offers good products and the best service.

She will use this loan to purchase a variety of meats to satisfy her customers. She has been a member of this group for 7 years and likes it because, thanks to the lenders, she started her business, with which she earns a living. Her dream is to be a distributor of these products.

loans.use: to purchase lunch meat.

loans.name: Fatimah

texts.en:
Fatimah is a 50-year-old woman and is married to Zaenal, a 60-year-old man. They are blessed with 10 children, two of them already got married, and the rest of them are employed and also still studying at school. 

Fatimah has been running her food stall business for these past five years. She initiated the business using her own capital of an amount of IDR 1,000,000. At the beginning she sold mostly cakes and sometimes rice and side dishes. As time went by, she decided to focus on selling food - chicken rice, fish rice, egg rice, and any other type of food depending on customers' requests, as well as beverages. 

In order to re-stock all the ingredients to cook and because of the rising prices of all of it due to the current bad weather, Fatimah requested a loan from TLM for an amount of IDR 7,000,000. She will spend the loan on rice, chicken, fish, eggs, spices, vegetables, cooking oil, kerosene, beverages, etc.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients she needs to cook on her food stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cement for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fruit and vegetables, since what she produces is not enough.

loans.name: Catalino

texts.es:
Catalino es un señor muy trabajador de 60 años de edad, solo estudio segundo grado de educación básica,  él es casado su esposa se dedica a la venta de pan, los gastos del hogar son cubiertos por los dos; son padres de 5 hijos de los cuales solo dos están con ellos, la señorita se dedica a trabajar y el otro joven a estudiar bachillerato contador.  


Él es agricultor y también se dedica al cuido de ganado, desde su niñez aprendió el trabajo,  ya que su papá le enseño este trabajo y así decidió trabajar la tierra y lo obtenido de ella es para el sustento del hogar, anteriormente se dedicaba a la crianza de aves de corral,  la tenía en la casa de habitación, actividad que realizaba junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos pero por la falta de tiempo de todos ellos cuando sus hijos empezaron a estudiar y trabajar  él y su esposa ya no tenían el tiempo suficiente para dedicárselo a las aves,  tuvieron que dejar el negocio de aves y dedicarse a otra actividad.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para pago de mano de obra para empezar a trabajar la tierra,  para la temporada agrícola ya que él cultiva varias metros cuadrados de terreno y tiene que tener el suelo preparado con anticipación por la falta de mano de obra cuando inicia la temporada;  su necesidad principal será que cuando inicie la temporada de siembra ya tendrá todo listo para cultivar. 

El sueño de él es mejorar su economía y la calidad de vida de su familia, quisiera que sus hijos obtuvieran una carrera universitaria y así tener una mayor oportunidad dentro de la sociedad actual. El préstamo será de gran utilidad ya que con el empezara el trabajo para cultivar. Lo obtenido del negocio le servirá, para continuar proporcionándole el estudio a su hijo y generara más economía a su familia.
texts.en:
Catalino is a very hardworking, 60-year-old man, who only finished second grade of basic education. He is married, and his wife sells bread. The household expenses are covered by them both; they are the parents of 5 children of which two live with them, the young woman working and the young man studying for his Bachelor's.

He is an agriculturalist and also takes care of cattle, which he learned from his childhood, as his father taught him the work and so he decided to work the land, and what he gets from it is to sustain the household. Before, he raised poultry, which they had in a room in the house, an activity he did together with his wife and two children, but for the lack of their time when the children began studying and working he and his wife did not have enough time to raise the chickens, so they had to abandon the poultry business and pursue another activity.

The loan he is asking is to pay for labor to begin agricultural work for the growing season, now that he tills various cubic meters of land and needs to have the soil prepared in anticipation of the lack of labor when the season begins; his primary concern will be that when the sowing season starts he already has everything ready to cultivate.
