His dream is to improve his finances and the quality of life of his family. He hopes that his children obtain and academic career and thus have better opportunities in society. The loan will be of great use since with it he would begin the work of cultivation. Everything obtained from the business will help him to continue splitting it between his son's studies and the household economy of his family.

loans.use: to pay for labor to begin agricultural work

loans.name: Riffat

texts.en: Riffat is 36 years old. Her husband has a job in a nearby factory for low wages. She is the mother of three children who are at home, and living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She sews ladies bags to feed her family. She has two sewing machines to sew the bags, which are operated by her daughters. Her son deals with all the affairs of the outsiders. He takes the orders from them, and they sew the bags on order.  She wants to sell her sewed bags directly in the market, so she can get maximum reward for their efforts. But she does not have initial capital to buy the raw materials for sewing ladies bags. Riffat requested a loan to the Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so she can buy raw materials such as rexine, zippers, buckles, etc. for making bags. She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy rexine, thread, and buckles for sewing ladies bags.

loans.name: Nver

texts.en: Nver is 53 years old and lives with his family in the village of Sarigyugh. He graduated from the Yerevan State Agricultural Institute, where he qualified to be a cultivator. He now works for his municipality and is married and the father of two sons. His older son is a student at the Air-Military Institute and his second son serves in the army. Nver and his wife work in farming and agriculture. In his farm he has three cows, two piglets, five beehives and fifty chickens. From this plot of land, he gathers hay which partly serves as fodder for his cattle. The main products that his family produces to sell are milk and eggs. He is requesting a loan for 330,000 Armenian drams to buy six piglets and a supply of animal fodder.

loans.use: to buy six piglets and animal fodder.

loans.name: Rosibel Del Carmen

texts.es:
Rosibel de 41 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, es casada su esposo es agricultor y le ayuda en su negocio de venta de verduras, tiene 4 hijos de los que estudian dos, su mamá vive con ella. 
Rosibel vende frutas y verduras en el mercado de la ciudad. Tiene 10 años de trabajar y dedicarse a esa actividad, viaja en pick up por que salen de su casa muy temprano que este a unos 20 minutos.

Rosibel invertirá el crédito, para surtir más su negocio, comprara más verduras y frutas, ella pretende en un futuro hacer más grande su negocio, para trabajar para que su familia tenga un trabajo honrado, del cual puedan percibir ingresos y que sus hijos tengan una buena educación.
texts.en:
Rosibel is 41 years old and only went to school until 6th grade.  She is married and her husband is a farmer and helps her with her business selling vegetables.  She has 4 children, 2 of which are in school.  Her mother also lives with her.

Rosibel sells fruit and vegetables in the town market.  She has had this business for 10 years and travels 20 minutes to the market in her pickup truck early each morning.

With this loan, Rosibel will stock her business, buy vegetables and fruit, and eventually expand her business.  Her goals include working so that her family has a source of honorable work that they receive income through.  In addition, she wants her children to have a good education.

loans.use: buy more fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida is 48 year old lady, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of 1 daughter and 3 sons. Her husband has been running a barber shop for 30 years. Khalida has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. Her husband wants to buy some accessories and furniture (i.e shaving creams, blades, after shave lotions, table, mirror and chairs etc.) for his business.

With the help of this loan, Khalida's husband will be able to purchase these accessories and furniture that will be good initiative for her husband's business. It will be helpful to earn a profitable amount so that Khalida can enable herself to make savings for the future needs of her family.

Khalida is very thankful to KIVA and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy some accessories and furniture for her husband's barber shop.

loans.name: Nahd

texts.en:
Nahd is a 27-year-old woman. She lives in Taiz, Yemen. She is a happy woman who treats everyone well because of her opportunities to get ahead. She is an employee in hospital, getting a low salary. She is married and has two children. She loves her career because she feels able to offer great services for patients. She intends to buy home improvements for her house, but she does not have enough money to buy what she needs.

She applied for a loan of YER 35,000 from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB) to buy a washing machine to use for her house. She hopes to establish a retail shop in order to increase her income and offer good financial resources for her family.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine to use for her house.

loans.name: Habib Begum

texts.en:
Habib Begum is a house wife of 44 years of age. She looks after her family, including three children. She is a very hardworking and punctual lady. Her son is the sole earner for the family. He works in laundry related services. His practice is to gather clothing from door to door for dry cleaning services.
He buys necessary raw materials such as laundry soaps, iron, detergents, surfs etc.from the market. He works hard and honestly for a better earning to support her family; he is providing better services. 

Habib Begum wants to take a loan so that her son will be able to get more raw items and can iron a maximum amount of clothing on time. In this way Habib Begum’s son is able to provide better financial support to the family to maintain their living standard.

Habib Begum is very thankful to kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy iron, detergent, bleach for services.

loans.name: Rovshan

texts.en:
Rovshan is a farmer. He is married and has two children. One of his children is 25 years old and already married. The other is studying at third course of University. His spouse is a housewife. They are an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from Fuzuli city and at present they are living at Mahmudlu-2 village of Fuzuli region. 

Rovshan has cows. Today he wants to repair the roof of the cow stall. Therefore Rovshan needs a loan in amount of 1900 AZN(Azerbaijan New Manat). This is his second loan. He previously he took a loan from Kiva and successfully repaid it. He says great thanks to Kiva organization and the lenders.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Lenis Maryelis

texts.es:
Lenis de 30 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado de educación básica, es divorciada, trabaja vendiendo productos de belleza a través de revista. Tiene dos hijos viven con ella aún son estudiantes y también viven sus abuelos con ella. 
Lenis vende cosméticos desde hace cinco años, se dedicaba a la venta de productos para consumo, boquitas y bebidas, panes y pupusas.

El crédito lo utilizara para comprar mercadería y surtirá el cafetín ya que actualmente lo administra su abuela, cuando ella anda trabajando, la jornada de trabajo es de tres días a la semana.

Lenis desea hacer cada vez más grande el negocio, porque es un negocio que le da  buenos ingresos y lo tiene cerca de su casa y de ahí poder sacar ingresos necesarios para el mantenimiento y estudio de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Lenis is 30 years old and only went to school up to the 9th grade.  She is divorced and works selling beauty products via catalog.  She has two children that live with her and are still in school.  In addition, her grandparents live with her.

Lenis has been selling cosmetics for 5 years and also sells consumable goods, including snacks, drinks, bread, and pupusas.

This loan will be used to buy merchandise and stock her cafe.  Her grandmother currently runs it and spends 3 days of the week working there.

Lenis is always looking for ways to expand her business, since it gives her good income and is close to her house.  From it, she is able to obtain income that she needs to take care of and provide for the education of her children.

loans.use: buy merchandise and stock her cafe.

loans.name: Alexandra Zaida

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Nuevos Horizontes se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Alexandra, tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos  hijos de 16 y 14 años que estudian en colegio. Su esposo es albañil.
Doña Alexandra con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y electrodomésticos por catálogos, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella enseña su revista a sus clientes y ellos  le realizan sus pedidos que ella a los pocos días les entrega,  ella compra al contado y deja a crédito  a sus clientes ya sea en pagos semanales o quincenales, es por eso que requiere de los créditos ya que tiene varios pedidos por entregar y con el dinero del crédito va a comprar estos productos y así quedar bien con sus clientes. Tiene más de 10  años con este negocio el cual en temporadas que su marido no tiene trabajo les ha permitido salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa y electrodomésticos. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace  11 años y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ella financia su negocio. Sus sueños es darles lo mejor  sus hijos.
texts.en:
The "Nuevos Horizontes" communal bank meets every fortnight in Jipijapa Canton. The canton is known as the "Sultan of Coffee" due to the extensive plantings of coffee with it's incomparable flavor, it's gastronomy and the quality of it's people.

Alexandra lives here. She is 37 years old, married and has two children from this union. They are 14 and 16 years old and both attend secondary school. Her husband is a bricklayer. With the intention of making some money for herself and to help her husband with the household expenses she sells clothing of all types and household appliances from catalogs. Her method of selling is going door-to-door. She shows the catalog to her clients, they decide what they want and within a few days she delivers the goods. 

Alexandra buys with cash and gives credit to her customers on a weekly or bi-weekly basis. For this reason she needs the loan as she has a number of requests to fulfill and with the money from the loan she'll buy these products and keep her clients happy. She has been doing this work for more than 10 years and when her husband doesn't have work this keeps her family afloat. She will use this loan to buy clothing and appliances. Alexandra has been a member of this communal bank for 11 years and she likes it for the loans which allow her to finance her business. Her dream is to give her children the best.

loans.use: to buy clothing and electrical appliances.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les huit  membres du groupe DANAYA sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans, et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles nucléaire à HAMDALLAYE un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur dix-septième prêt dans ce groupe qui évolue avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso, dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Mme SALI qui fait le commerce de bois de chauffe,  est debout en deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt un chargement de camion 10 tonnes  en bois de chauffe à Fachoribougou, un village situé à environ 15 km de la ville de Sikasso . Sa vente se fait au marché  et à domicile, au comptant  et à crédit à une clientèle composée des femmes et hommes. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The eight members of the Danaya group are married women. On the average, they are 43 years old, with four children. They mainly live in nuclear families in Hamdallaye, a working-class neighborhood in the town of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali.
They have been collaborating with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to   meet customer demand and are now on their 17th loan. Mrs. Sali, who sells firewood, is the second one standing from the right to the left.She plans to use her loan to buy a 10-ton [22,046 lbs] truckload of firewood in Fachoribougou, a village located about 15 km from the town of Sikasso.
She plans to earn an average monthly income of 40,000 West African francs, a part of which will be used to pay off her loan with interest, and the rest for her savings.

loans.use: to buy firewood.

loans.name: Gagik

texts.en:
Gagik is 36 years old and lives with his family in Dilijan city. He is a father of two children. Since 2010 he has worked as a welder for a construction company. At the same time, he has run a farm with his wife. They have four cows and two calves and his wife sells milk, cheese and macun (an Armenian national dairy-product) she makes herself. Profit from farming is the main source of income that meets their basic needs. For many years Gagik wanted to buy a truck which would make his farming easier (to transport hay for his farm cattle), but never had enough money for that purchase. 
He asks a loan of 1.000.000 Armenian drams in order to buy a truck.

loans.use: to buy a truck to make his farming easier (transporting hay for his farm cattle)

loans.name: Maria Modesta

texts.es:
La señora Modesta es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora vive en  una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto con ella viven sus 3 nietos. Su negocio es una  pulpería desde hace 5 años.
Doña Modesta es muy visitada ya que se encuentra en un punto estratégico y de fácil acceso a su a comunidad. Necesita el  préstamo para la compra de más producto como ser: arroz, manteca, pan, refrescos, churros, queso, mantequilla, embutidos, huevos, café, frijoles, azúcar, etc.
Doña Modesta necesita el préstamo para surtir más su negocio. Espera que el préstamo la ayude mucho ya que contara con los productos necesarios y suficientes para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y cubrir la demanda que estos le hacen a diario y gracias a esto ganar más ingresos que beneficien el estilo de vida de la familia en el hogar. 
Doña Modesta espera aumentar su negocio y que esta se convierta en el más grande y conocido de su comunidad y así  seguir apoyando a sus nietos en sus estudios para que tengan mayores oportunidades en la vida.


Choluteca, Honduras –Enero 2014
texts.en:
Modesto is a very responsible and hardworking person who lives with her three grandchildren in a community in southern Honduras. She has had her business, a grocery store, for five years. Modesta gets a lot of customers because she's in a strategic location that's easily accessible to the community. She needs a loan to purchase more products such as: rice, lard, bread, soft drinks, churros, cheese, butter, sausages, eggs, coffee, beans, sugar, etc. Modesta needs the loan to stock her business better. Her hope is that the loan would help her a lot since it would give her sufficient amounts of the products necessary to satisfy her customers' needs and meet daily demand. This would then increase her income and benefit her family's quality of life at home. Modesta hopes to grow her business and make it the biggest and most well-known in the community, so she can keep supporting her grandchildren's education so that they can have more opportunities in life.


Choluteca, Honduras –January 2014

loans.use: To purchase rice, lard, bread, soft drinks, churros, cheese, butter, sausages, eggs, coffee, beans, sugar, etc. for her business

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Samvel is from Sardarapat village in the Armavir region. He lives with his wife, mother and three school-age sons. He works as a farmer, raising livestock and growing tomatos and watermelons. His sons help him by taking the harvest to market and selling it. Because agriculture is the only source of family income, Samvel would like to enlarge his farm and is requesting a loan to buy four pigs, turkeys, forage to feed his livestock and fertilizer for his land. 
He has already taken out a loan from a local financial institution, but unfortunately wasn't able to repay it. However, thanks to his hard work during recent years, Samvel and his family were able to run their agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that they will be able to cover monthly payments. So, he has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international which provides a second-chance loan to people who have a bad credit history and no access to credit. The loan is very important for this hard working farmer if he is to increase his income from agriculture and provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy four pigs, turkeys, forage for his livestock and fertilizer for his land

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a responsible mother of two sons and two daughters. She is 37 years old and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing tailoring services for 10 years, and he is solely responsible for feeding the entire family.
Shazia's husband needs some items for business such as cloth, thread and needles. But due to insufficient financial resources her husband is unable to purchase these items. Therefore, Shazia has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will help her husband purchase these items for business use so that he can earn a maximum profit. That amount will be deposited as savings for the future needs of the family.
Shazia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy some items for her husband's business such as cloth, thread and needles.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es: La señora Leonarda  tiene 38 años de edad  hasta la edad de 16 años vivió con sus padres en una comunidad llamada Bocaisito  en esta comunidad estudio su primaria con el apoyo de sus padres, tiempo después  conoció al que hoy es su esposo y padre de sus hijos y  se fue a vivir con él a otra comunidad, dos de sus hijos estudian y los otros ya son independientes. Ella se dedica  al comercio venta de ropa  la que vende en comunidades cercanas  además también en tiempo de cosecha  trabaja en los cortes de café esto le permite tener ingresos  adicionales además de aprovechar y vender la ropa  entre sus compañeros .Su marido también es comerciante  y así juntos los dos  sacan adelante a su familia. En la comunidad  no tienen energía eléctrica es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para comprar  un sistema solar  para poder realizar con su familia otras actividades por la noche.
texts.en: Leonarda is 38 years old.  She lived with her parents in the community of Bocaisito until she was 16.  She completed her primary education in that community with her parents' support and a short time thereafter she met the man who today is her husband and the father of her children and she went to live with him in another community.  Two of her children are in school and the others are already on their own.  She has a business selling clothing, which she sells in neighboring communities, and she also works in the coffee fields during harvest season.  This provides her with additional income and also allows her to sell clothing to her colleagues.  Her husband is also a businessman and together the two of them get their family ahead.  They do not have electricity in their community, which is why they are asking for a loan to buy a solar energy system so they can do things with their family at night.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy system to install in their home

loans.name: İntizar

texts.en:
İntizar is married and has a child. She has a small store, where she sells food products daily. İntizar lives with her husband, their son, and his bride. She has a lovely grandchild. Her son is a taxi driver. They live at Djuvarli village of Fuzuli region, but over the 21 years they have been IDPs (Internally Displaced Persons). 

Today İntizar wants to increase her business and therefore she has applied to Komak company for a loan in amount of 2,200 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to buy a fridge. She says she is thankful to Kiva organization for aid. In the future İntizar wants to increase the area of store.

loans.use: to buy a fridge

loans.name: Mesrop

texts.en:
Mesrop is 38 years old and lives in Dilijan city. Mesrop is married and has two children. His son is in military service with the army and his daughter is in school. For many years, Mesrop has supported his family by doing different repairing and construction work. He works very hard with no time off but nevertheless earns a very low salary. This is why his house is still only half built. His house is two-storied, but the second story is not finished so, for now, his family lives on the ground floor. 
Mesrop asks a loan of 500.000 Armenian drams to start building of the second floor of his house.

loans.use: to start constructing of the second floor of his house

loans.name: Mercedes Magdalena

texts.es:
EL Grupo de Crédito Mujeres Unidas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Mercedes, tiene 31 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 12 y 8 años que estudian en colegio y escuela. El marido es comerciante. 
Doña Mercedes para ayudarle a su marido con los gastos que genera el hogar desde hace 10 años surtió una pequeña  tienda de víveres en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de productos como granos, carnes, lácteos, legumbres, además de varios artículos de bazar y útiles escolares,  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, sus hijos le ayudan en su negocio el mismo que les ha ayudado mucho para salir adelante además porque se gana lo suyo sin descuidara a sus hijos que requieren de muchos cuidados.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar y otros víveres que no tiene para satisfacer a sus clientes. Está en el Grupo De Crédito  8 años y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños  son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The “Women's United Credit Group” meets each 15 days in Jipijapa Canton, know as the “Sultan of Coffee” due to its extensive production of a coffee of incomparable flavor, and for its gastronomy and the warmth of its people. 

Here resides Mercedes, who is 31 years old and lives in a free union from which there are 2 children, ages 12 and 8, who study in a private and a public school. Her husband is a merchant. Mercedes wishes to help her husband with the household expenses. For the last 10 years, she has operated a small grocery store from her home. Here she sells all types of products, including grains, meat, milk products, and vegetables, plus various general articles and school supplies. Mercedes works every day from 6:00 am until 8:00 pm, and at times even later. Her children help in the business which they have helped advance. In this manner, she earns her own money without neglecting the children, who require much care.

This loan will be used to restock her store. She will purchase rice, sugar, and other groceries she lacks, in order to satisfy her customers. Mercedes has been a member of the credit group for 8 years and she likes it because the loans are a great help. Her dreams are to continue to forge ahead.

loans.use: buy rice, sugar, and other groceries for her store.

loans.name: Mkrtich

texts.en:
Mkrtich is 37 years old and he lives in Dilijan city. He has no higher education and for many years he used to do different construction work at different companies. Now he works at a private company as a bricklayer. 

Mkrtich is married and he has two children, who are school-aged.  Mkrtich’s wife is unemployed and she takes care of their children. Lately Mkrtich, after many years of saving some money, managed to repair his house, but it would be great if he managed to furnish it also, for which he unfortunately has no money anymore.

Mkrtich asks a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams in order to buy a sofa for his living room and also kitchen furniture.

loans.use: to buy a sofa for his living room and also kitchen furniture

loans.name: Felix

texts.en: Felix is 34 years old and lives in the community of Logan town. Felix is a 12th grade graduate and married to a local businesswoman. They have three children between the ages of 6 months and 7 years and two attend school. Felix has a reputation as a hard-working-man. The name of his general store business is Felix business center. Felix has a popular business and demand for his goods in the communities is very high. He sells his drinks and other items in his shop and has a high turnover of stock. Felix is asking for a loan to buy more drinks such as soda, stout, beer, gin, Vimto (fruit beverage), etc.  He sells every day without encountering any major problems. After selling for his father, eight years ago he was able to start his own business. He plans to educate his children and build a house for his children.

loans.use: to buy more drinks such as soda, stout, beer, gin, Vimto (fruit beverage) etc.

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.es:
Ermelinda, es ama de casa, tiene 27 años de edad, no tuvo oportunidad de estudiar, es casada, su esposo reside en Estados Unidos de forma legal y viaja a El Salvador cada año,tiene un niño de 5 años de edad y esta esperando otro, ella es la menor de cinco hermanos, depende de ella solo su hijo. Actualmente va empezar una venta de verduras, pues vio que en su comunidad eso hace falta y tomó la iniciativa de hacerlo ella; pondrá la venta en su casa y considera que eso va mejorar su condición de vida, pues es un ingreso extra y le ayudará a sentirse mejor con esta actividad económica.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar tomates, cebollas, chiles, papas, pues ella descubrió que tiene potencial para negociar y que con la ayuda del préstamo, emprenderá su negocio y obtendrá mejores ingresos, desea tener un negocio amplio, y crecer mucho en el, también desea que su hijo estudie hasta lograr ser un profesional; con este esfuerzo sabe que puede lograrlo.
texts.en:
Ermelinda, a housewife, is 27 years old.  She did not have the opportunity to go to school.  He husband resides legally in the United States, and he travels to El Salvador each year.  She has a five year old child, and she is expecting another child.  She is the youngest of five sibling, and her son is her only dependent.

She is now going to start selling vegetables.  She saw that this was needed in her community, and she took the initiative to do so.  She will set up the sales at her house.  She believes that this will improve her living conditions.  It is an extra income, and this business activity will help her to feel better.

The loan that she is requesting is to buy tomatoes, onions, chili peppers, and potatoes.  She discovered that she has business potential.  With the help of the loan she will establish her business and get better income.  She wishes to have an ample business and to grow a lot in the business.  She wishes that her son will go to school until he manages to become a professional.  With this effort she knows that she will be able to manage it.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions, chili peppers, and potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Myrlinda

texts.en:
Myrlinda is 53-years-old and lives in Lumbia District, Pagadian City. She is widowed with four children.

Myrlinda has a shop that sells canned goods, groceries and viands. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan to buy inventories for her general store and eatery.

Myrlinda has been a member of PMPC for almost one year. In the future, Myrlinda hopes to make her little grocery store into a bigger convenience store.

loans.use: to buy additional inventories like basic commodities for her sari-sari store business and additional kilos of meat for her eatery

loans.name: Hrayr

texts.en:
Hrayr, 37 years old, lives in the village of Gandzaqar in Tavush region. He is married and he has two children. His wife works at the bank as a cashier. Hrayr has a small workshop in the city of Ijevan where he repairs shoes, but with greater pleasure and care he is engaged in bee keeping. In this very serious occupation that needs patience and special skills, Hrayr’s mother-in-law helps him very much. As a result of their great efforts and hard work, they manage to have honey of very good quality, which they sell to their regular customers each spring and autumn. 

Hrayr is asking for a loan of 1,200,000 Armenian drams in order to buy twenty bee families, several beehives, waxed papers and some special medicine for the bees.

loans.use: to buy twenty bee families, several beehives, waxed papers and some special medicine for the bees

loans.name: María Jorge

texts.es:
María de 63 años de edad,casada y madre de tres hijos, es una mujer  muy luchadora, que por la difícil situación económica que afectaba a sus padres en su niñez no pudo formarse academicamente, esto no fue una limitante para sacar adelante a su familia, con el apoyo de su esposo, un hombre que se dedica a trabajar fuertemente en en la agricultura. Con mucho esfuerzo lograron reunir dinero para comprar dos terneras las que después de un largo tiempo engordaron y vendieron, para poder ayudarle a uno de sus hijos que decidió irse a los estados unidos  buscando mejorar su condicion de vida.  Con la ayuda de su hijo ella logro comprar una vaquilla, la que le ayudo a tener tres por el momento.

Ella tiene 9 años de dedicarse a la crianza de ganado,  ella  después de engordar las vacaquillas las vende y compra otras dos o tres vaquillas para engordarlas y posteriormente venderlas. Doña Maria es muy inteligente, ya que con esta actividad logra obtener ingresos que le ayudan mucho a cubrir algunas necesidades del hogar.

El préstamo lo necesita para  poder consolidar una pequeña deuda que por el momento no puede cubrir, hace un año  ella adquirió un dinero que en ese entonces le ayudaría para poder comprarle medicamentos a las vaquillas que estaban enfermas y ella no podía cubrir los costos, por lo que se vio obligada a buscar dinero prestado, el que espera poder pagar con el crédito. Ya que por el momento esta esperando vender sus vacas para poder comprar tres vaquillas.

En un futuro Doña Maria espera poder comprar mas vaquillas para dejarle a sus hijos una pequeña herencia  de la que ellos puedan disponer, y de ser posible  que sigan incrementando el número de animales para que puedan tener una fuente de ingreso fuerte y segura.
texts.en:
María is 63 years old. She is married and the mother of three children. She is a determined woman. Because of the difficult economic situation that affected her parents in her childhood, she was not able to educate herself academically. This was not a limiting factor for her family to get ahead due to the help of her husband, a man who makes a living working hard in agriculture. With a lot of effort they succeeded in raising money to buy two calves that after a long time fattened. They were sold to help one of their children that decided to go to the United States looking for better living conditions. With the help of their son they were able to buy a heifer, which helped them to have three at the time. 

María has nine years of experience raising livestock. After fattening the heifers, she sells them and buys another two or three to fatten and afterward sell. María is very smart, seeing as with this occupation she has been able to bring in income that helps her family greatly to cover some necessities for the home.

She needs this loan in order to consolidate a small debt that for the time being she cannot cover. A year ago, María acquired some money that helped her be able to buy medicines for the heifers that were sick. She could not cover the costs, so she found herself obligated to find a loan, which she hopes to be able to pay with this credit. Right now she is waiting to sell her cows so that she may buy three heifers.

In the future María hopes to be able to buy more heifers in order to give her children a small inheritance that they can have available and to make it possible to continue increasing the number of animals so that they can have a strong and secure source of income.

loans.use: to consolidate a debt.

loans.name: Ana Iris

texts.es:
Ana tiene 26 años, es ama de casa, no tiene estudios académicos;  tiene dos hermanos, ella es la tercera de los tres hijos de su madre, Ana; tiene un hijo de once años, estudia cuarto grado de educación básica, es  madre soltera, su pareja emigró a los Estados Unidos, Ana y su hijo viven en casa de su madre, pero es ella quien sosteniene economicamente la casa. 

Desde hace un año, tiene un molino, también vende tamales, algunos mariscos como cangrejo y pescado desde hace cuatro años, esto es algo que aprendió de su madre y decidió dedicarse a lo mismo, pues tenia mucha dificultad económica. Para ir a vender la mercdería se traslada a una distancia de 2 kilómetros, se transporta en bus con su mama y su hijo.

Con el préstamo, comprará frutas y verduras entre ellos están los  tomates, cebollas, chiles, papas, manzanas, guineos, plátanos y zanahorias. Ella sabe que se superará, a través de su negocio aumentará las ventas, mejorará su calidad de vida y obtendrá ingresos extras, para ayudar más a quienes dependen de ella en lo básico. Pues ella quiere ver a su hijo desarrollado como todo un profesional éxito.
texts.en:
Ana, age 26, is a housewife.  She does not have an education.  She has two siblings, and she is the youngest of the three children.  Ana has an 11 year old son, who is in the fourth grade.  She is a single mother; her life partner immigrated to the United States.  Ana and her son live in her mother’s house.  However, Ana is the one who financially supports the household.

She has had a mill for one year.  She has also been selling tamales and some seafood like crab and fish for four years.  This is something that she learned from her mother, and she decided to do the same thing.  She had a lot of financial difficulty.  In order to go and sell her merchandise she travels two kilometers.  She goes by bus with her mother and her son.

She will use the loan to buy fruits and vegetables like tomatoes, onions, chili peppers, potatoes, apples, bananas, and carrots.  She knows that she will succeed through her business.  She will increase her sales and improve her quality of life.  She will get extra income to better help those who are dependent upon her for the basics.  She wants to see her son develop as a complete and successful professional.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables like tomatoes, onions, green peppers, potatoes, apples, bananas, and carrots.

loans.name: Shubana

texts.en: Shubana is a 37-year-old married lady who has run a small general store in her community for many years.  She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. To make her store fully stocked she requested a loan for PKR 40,000 which she will use to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. This way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Mónica Victoria

texts.es:
EL Grupo de Crédito Mujeres Unidas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Mónica, tiene 43 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos de 26, 24, 23, 15  y 7 años, los dos menores aun viven con ellos y estudian en colegio y escuela. El marido es comerciante. 
Doña Mónica junto a su esposo se dedican a la venta de varios artículos para el hogar pero más que todo de cocina, entre lo que venden están vajillas, ollas, cucharas, cuchillos, sillas plásticas entre otros productos, ellos venden recorriendo en su carro  por ciertas partes de la ciudad y campos aledaños, son más de 22 años realizando esta labor con la cual salen adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar ollas, platos, cucharas, licuadoras y varios productos que ellos venden. Este es su quinto ciclo en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños son tener un local en la ciudad.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres Unidas" communal bank meets every fortnight in Jipijapa Canton. This canton is known as the "Sultan of Coffee" because of it's extensive coffee plantings, it's gastronomy and the quality of it's people.

Mónica lives here. She is 43 years old and lives in a common-law relationship from which she has 5 children aged 7, 15, 23, 24 and 26 years old. The two youngest still live with her and go to secondary and primary school. Her husband is a businessman. Mónica together with her husband, sell a variety of items for the household. More than anything else they sell kitchen goods like dishes, pots, spoons, knives, plastic chairs, etc. They sell traveling by car to certain areas of the city and the neighboring countryside. They have been doing this for more than 22 years in order to get ahead. 

This loan will be used to buy pots, plates, spoons, blenders and various other products they sell. This is her 5th cycle with the communal bank and she likes it as the loans are quick and very useful. She dream is to have a store in the city.

loans.use: to buy pots, plates, spoons, blenders, etc.

loans.name: Lawson

texts.en:
Lawson, 43 years old, lives in the town of New-kru with his wife and two children, aged 5 and 12, who attend school and live at home. Lawson is a high school graduate who describes himself as hardworking.  

Over the past year, Lawson has been producing and selling well-designed furniture items such as beds, chairs, doors, etc. He runs his business for 9 hours from Monday to Saturday. Lawson's main problem is little capital. He is asking for a loan to buy more wood and other items for his business. Lawson intends to increase his business and improve his children's level of education.

loans.use: to buy more wood and other items for his business.

loans.name: Mehran

texts.en: Mehran is a 41-year-old married woman who has had a business selling milk for many years. She has two cows and one buffalo for milk. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. She earns a good amount of income to contribute to the family income.  It is her fourth year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business with its support. Now she requested a loan of Rs 45,000 to purchase one more cow. She hopes to get an increase in the production capacity of the milk which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 43-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she started a milk-selling business. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her area. At present she has two buffaloes providing milk. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. 

Currently she is requesting a loan of Rs. 40,000 to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her milk sales and ultimately generate more income. She is in her 7th loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Meena

texts.en: Meena has successfully built her small general store with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. Her husband also assists her by purchasing a stock of goods from the market as he has made many contacts over the years. She is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. Previously, with the help of Kiva loan, she purchased the required products for her store. Now, she wants to grow her business, so she is requesting a loan of PKR 45,000 to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet the growing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of further expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia, 42 years old, is a responsible mother of a daughter. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Nadia has been running a beauty salon for 3 years and contributes her earnings with her husband's to manage the household. 

Nadia has to purchase some cosmetics and other products, such as creams, hair brushes, nail polish remover, face washes, etc. for her business use. Due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these items.

Nadia has therefore requested a loan from KIVA's field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will help her to purchase the relevant items for her business that will be good for her daily sales and profit. She can also use the profit as savings for her family's future needs. Nadia is very thankful to KIVA and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy different types of cosmetics and other accessories for her business

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen is a 36-year-old married woman who has run a business selling milk with her husband for many years. She has four cows and one buffalo, which she uses for milk.  She sells to the people of her locality. She also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of profit. Nasreen has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently, she is in her ninth loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 50,000. This will allow her to purchase one more buffalo. Nasreen is hopeful that this loan will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Murad

texts.en:
Murad lives in Artamet village with his wife. Their only son is a migrant worker in neighboring country and tries to help his family financially. Murad and his wife are involved in agriculture. Particularly, they are involved in cattle breeding and some land cultivation. They have an orchard where apricot and peach trees are grown. Murad sells the gathered harvest locally and does his best to provide appropriate living conditions for his wife. 

By applying for this loan, Murad asks financial support to be able to purchase 3 oxen and forage, to feed the livestock. This will enable him to solve current financial problems and will greatly assist him in continuing to run his farm. Murad took a loan from a local financial institution in the past but unfortunately wasn't able to pay it back. However, thanks to his hard work during recent times, Murad has been able to run his agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that he will be able to cover the monthly payments. As a result, Murad has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. 

Murad hopes that this loan will be a big support for him, and that he will be able to sustain his family's living.

loans.use: to pay for 3 oxen and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Hina's Group

texts.en:
Hina, 47 years old, is a responsible mother of 2 sons and a daughter. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Hina has been running a beauty salon for 4 years and contributes her earnings with her husband's to manage the household. 

Hina has to purchase some cosmetics and other products, such as creams, hair brushes, nail polish remover, face washes, etc. for her business use. Due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these items. 

Hina has therefore requested a loan from KIVA's field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will help her to purchase the relevant items for her business that will be good for her daily sales and profit. She can also use the profit as savings for her family's future needs. Hina is very thankful to KIVA and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different types of cosmetics and other accessories for her business.

loans.name: José Eusebio

texts.es:
José de 54 años de edad, tiene tres hijos de los cuales están estudiando, él vive con su mamá y sus tres hijos.


José tiene 25 años de deciarse a jornalero y a la agricultura, su trabajo de toda la vida ha sido ese desde que estaba pequeño su padre se lo enseño ese oficio.

El cliente utilizara el crédito para recolectar la cosecha, ya que su cultivo le falta sacarlo en grano para la comercialización o consumo, además piensa invertir en la compra de una vaca para  engordar, satisface una necesidad pues podrá sacar el cultivo a tiempo  y podrá tener su vaca  para la leche o luego venderla y que le genere más ingresos.

José sueña en sacar su cosecha y que su vaca tenga un buen desarrollo, en un futuro pueda generar más ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
José is 54 years old, has 3 children that are in studying in school, and lives with his mom and his children.

José has been working as a laborer and farmer for 25 years.  He has worked in this field ever since he was young and his father taught it to him.

José will use this loan to gather his harvest, since he still needs to collect his grains so they can be sold.  In addition, he wants to buy a cow that he can fatten.  This will fulfill his needs by allowing him to collect his harvest on time and also be able to obtain a cow so as to have milk and eventually sell it and obtain additional income.

José hopes to collect his harvest and to have a cow that will grow well.  Eventually, he hopes to obtain additional income for his family.

loans.use: gather his harvest and buy a cow.

loans.name: Shabana's Group

texts.en:
Shabana is a 32-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She has two sons and two daughters. She lives with her family and her husband is responsible for her entire family's household. Shabana has been providing a service of cap-making for 15 years. 

Shabana has applied for a Kiva group loan with other two members from Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan because she needs to purchase some clothes in bulk to make fauji caps. This loan will enable her to purchase the clothes for sewing caps and also provide her assistance in making savings for her household. This will also help her to generate profit margins and to increase sales. Shabana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

Note: Shabana has raised her hand in the photo.

loans.use: to buy clothes in bulk to make fauji caps to sell.

loans.name: José Mario

texts.es:
José de 26 años de edad,  es un agricultor que después de terminar los estudios básicos decidió tener una familia y tuvo que dedicarse a trabajar tienen tres hijos, los cuales no tienen la edad suficiente para comenzar a estudiar. 
José antes se dedicaba a cultivar solo maíz y no era muy rentable trabajando como jornalero, aprendió a cultivar pipián y este tipo de cultivo si vio que es un poco mejor porque le genera más ingresos.
Necesita el dinero para rentar de la tierra y compra de insumos para el cultivo de pipián, él ha visto que estos ingresos han ayudado a mejorar la calidad de vida de él y toda su familia.

José sueña con llegar a tener una casa digna para su familia y que sus hijos estudien, pero que sobre todo aprendan a trabajar y sean responsables.
texts.en: Jose, 26 years old, is a farmer, who after finishing his basic schooling decided to have a family and had to start working. He has three children who are not old enough to go to school. Before, Jose worked farming only corn, but it was not profitable. Working as a laborer he learned how to grow pipian (a type of squash), and he saw that this type of product is a little better because he can earn more with it. He needs the money to rent the land and buy supplies to grow this squash. He has seen that this income has helped him to improve the quality of life for him and his whole family. Jose dreams of owning a house worthy of his family, and of having his children study, but above all, them learning to work and be responsible.

loans.use: To rent land and buy supplies to grow pipian (a type of squash)

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida is a 54-year-old, married woman doing a business of selling milk for many years. She has two cows in milk. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to help her lead her decent life. 

It is her tenth year with Kashf Foundation. Zubaida is happily running her business through the support of it. Now, she requests a loan of PKR 50,000 to purchase one more cow. She hopes to get an increase in the production capacity of milk which, ultimately, helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Elizabeth Beatriz

texts.es:
EL Grupo de Crédito Mujeres Unidas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Elizabeth tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 20, 18 y 9 años, los dos menores  estudian en colegio y en escuela y son los que aun viven en su casa. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Elizabeth para ayudarle a  su marido a sacar adelante a la familia se dedica a la venta de comida, ella  desde hace ya 8 años  puso un  pequeño comedor en su casa, el mismo que poco a poco ha mejorado con la ayuda de los créditos, allí todos los días por la tardes prepara variedad platos pero su especialidad son las deliciosas fritadas acompañada de plátano asado o patacones lo cual es muy apetecido por sus clientes, sus hijos le ayuda cuando ellos están desocupado de sus tareas, así es como ellos salen adelante trabajando duro para darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Está en el Grupo de Crédito desde hace  8 años y le gusta porque con los créditos saca adelante su negocio. Sus sueños son darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Mujeres Unidas" (United Women) meets every 2 weeks in the Jipijapa cantón, which is known as the sultan of coffee.  It is also known for its extensive cultivation of coffee (which has a taste that doesn't compare to any other coffee), it's cuisine, and for the warmth of its people.

This is where Elizabeth lives.  She is 36 years old, is married, and has 3 children (ages 20, 18, and 9).  Her two youngest children study in high school and secondary school and still live in her house.  Her husband works in transportation.  

Elizabeth works selling food to help her husband support their family.  She started a small restaurant in her house 8 years ago and she has been improving it little by little with the help of these loans.  Every day in the afternoon, she makes a variety of dishes but her specialty is making fritadas along with grilled plantains (known as patacones).  This dish is very popular among her customers.  Her children help her when they aren't busy with their homework/chores.  In this way, they can get ahead by working hard to give the best they can offer to their children.

She will use this loan to buy rice, meat, fish, and other goods for her food preparation.  She has been a part of her communal bank for 8 years and she likes it because the loans help her to progress her business.  Her dream is to give her children a good education.

loans.use: buy rice, meat, fish, and other goods.

loans.name: Naveeda

texts.en:
Naveeda is a borrower of Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan. She is a 36-year-old lady, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She has 3 children and her husband runs a retail hozary shop in the local market. This is the income source to meet the expanses of entire family. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan to buy different items to resell. This loan will help her husband to increase the inventory and also help to increase sales and profits. They will be able to save for future needs.

Naveeda is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy different items related to her husband's business.

loans.name: Abha

texts.en:
Abha is 32 years old, and she lives in Sana`a, Yemen. She is a hardworking person who has gone through many adversities in her life. She has always had great strength that has allowed her to get ahead. She is a seamstress who trained with a small association. Her business provides her with a source of household income and support. Because her work is good quality, she would like to increase her profits. She requests a loan of 200,000 YER to purchase fabrics and sewing items  to develop her business.

 Her dream is to be able to improve her household financial situation.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and sewing items to develop her business.

loans.name: Magsud

texts.en:
Maqsud, 34 years old, has been married for 11 years and has a son, aged 9, who attends second class. Maqsud’s wife is a seller in the local market. His family members are IDPs (Internally Displaced Persons) from Khojali, who now live in the Baku region. 

Maqsud has a “chayxana” (tea house), where he serves “samovar tea” to customers. Maqsud needs a loan of 1,800 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to repair the chayxana's kitchen. Maqsud is thankful to the Kiva organization for help. In the future, he wants to increase the area of his chayxana and his monthly income.

loans.use: to repair the kitchen of his "chayxana” (tea house)

loans.name: Odeh

texts.en:
Odeh is 41 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a village at Nablus. He is an experienced drilling worker.

Odeh asks Ryada for this loan to buy flagstones to pave his house.  This will help him to take a step forward because he doesn't have the money to buy the things he needs.  His family is living temporarily in a relative’s house until the house is ready. 

He is very grateful to everyone who helps him.

loans.use: to buy flagstones to pave his house.  This  will help him to take a step forward because he doesn't have the money to buy the things he needs.

loans.name: Teresa Leonor

texts.es:
EL Grupo de Crédito Mujeres Unidas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Teresa, tiene 67 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos mayores de edad, dos  de ellos aun vive con ella. Su esposo es maestro en construcción.
Doña Teresa tiene un restaurante en su casa, allí todos los días preparan deliciosos almuerzos los cuales son muy apetecidos por sus clientes que día a día llegan hasta su establecimiento, ella prepara sus platos de la forma más saludable posible razón por lo cual la prefieren sus clientes, ya son 8 años que lleva con este negocio el cual lo empezó  con uno de los créditos que recibió del banco, por lo cual ella está muy agradecida ya que es así como han salido adelante ya que el trabajo de su esposo no es seguro, ella trabaja con la ayuda de una nuera a quien le paga por su labor con lo cual también la ayuda para sus gastos.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Está en el Grupo de Crédito desde hace  10 años y le gusta porque gracias a uno de los créditos empezó su negocio. Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en: The Credit Group "Mujeres Unidas" (United Women) meets every two weeks in the Jipijapa canton. This canton is known as the "Sultana del café" (Coffee's Sultan's wife), because of its extensive cultivation of coffee with a distinctive taste, its gastronomy and the warmth of its people. Teresa, 67 years old, lives here. She is married and has four adult children, two of them still live with her. Her husband is a general contractor. Teresa has a restaurant in her house. Every day delicious lunches are prepared here, which are craved by her customers who come daily to her restaurant. She prepares very healthy dishes, a possible reason of her customers' preference. She started this business 8 years ago, thanks to a loan she got from the credit group, for which she is very grateful. This is how they have managed financially since her husband's job is not steady. She works with the help of her daughter-in-law, whom Teresa employs and also helps with her expenses. She will use this loan to buy rice, meat, fish and other food supplies to prepare food. She has belonged to the Credit Group for 10 years, and she likes it because, thanks to one of those credits she started her business. Her goals are to continue with her business.

loans.use: To buy rice, meat, fish and other food suplies.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 50-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi Pakistan. She has 3 daughters and 2 sons. Her husband has sold clothing in the local market for 4 years. Parveen requests a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan to purchase different types of bulk clothing.

This loan will help her husband to meet the need to purchase clothes and also generate effective sales growth and maximize profit.  They will therefore be able to save money. That will help her family in future.

Parveen is very thankful to KIVA and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy different types of bulk clothing for reselling purposes.

loans.name: Santan Group

texts.en:
Roselia is the featured borrower of the Santan group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, because they have always been close friends since they left their home towns in the Philippines to work in Lebanon. Most of the groups members work as housekeepers to support their beloved families properly.

Roselia is a 47-year-old married mother of four children. She sells clothes, which is a good income business, and she works hard to develop it as much as she can to make sure that the clothes fit her customers' needs and satisfy their desires. Roselia's loan will be invested in increasing her business merchandise with special winter and newly-released spring collections, which she will get at special competitive prices that will help her in increasing her business capital and attracting more customers.

In the photo, Roselia is the second from the left, wearing a light blue scarf. From left to right, the group members in the photo are Floresca, Roselia, Tessa, Cely and Rosita.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with special winter and spring collections

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is a 39-year-old mother of 3 sons and 3 daughters. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband provides a transport service driving a rickshaw. He is responsible for feeding the entire family.

Shahida also adds to the family income by providing a tailoring service.

She has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan because she wants to purchase  products such as clothes, thread, and needles her tailoring service. This loan will help her purchase relevant items and save money to fulfill the needs of her family.

Shahida is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy products for her tailoring business such as clothes, thread, and needles.

loans.name: Sameer

texts.en:
Sameer is 37 years old.  He  teaches at his town school and lives with his wife in Balata Camp at Nablus.  Balata Camp is a Palestinian refugee camp which was established in the northern West Bank in 1950, adjacent to the city of Nablus. It is the largest refugee camp in the West Bank.

Sameer wants to improve his home and asks Ryada for this loan to paint the house and repair the bathroom.  This will help him to take a step forward because he does not have the money.  These home repairs will improve his living conditions. 

He is very grateful to everyone who helps him.

loans.use: to paint his house and repair the bathroom. This will help him to take a step forward because he does not have the money. These home repairs will improve his living conditions.

loans.name: Nver

texts.en:
Nver lives in Dilijan city. He is the only one who makes money in the household. He is married and he has two children. For many years Nver earned his family's living by doing a worker’s job. 

The city where Nver lives is very nice, famous, and a perfect rest zone for tourists and Armenian people as well. Dilijan considers it to have the purest salubrious nature  and the most bracing air in the whole region, since here forests are virginal and anyone who comes here just admires it and falls in love with this place. That is why this city has a lot of comfortable and high quality rest houses. 

At one of these sanatoriums Nver works now. He works here as a sanitary engineer, but as he says work in rest houses is seasonal and in autumn and winter, tourists are very few, so his family income becomes low as well. Nver owns a nice cute farm, where he breeds two cows and a calf, and he manages to sell a lot of milk right from his house. 

Now Nver has a good, profitable idea and he needs some help to realize it; he has a big garage near his house and on the bottom of it he wants to build a small guestroom which he plans to rent to tourists during summer.  He asks for a loan in an amount of 1,000,000 Armenian drams in order to manage to start building his small guestroom.

loans.use: to  start building his small guestroom

loans.name: Joram

texts.en:
Joram is a married male, age 44 and living in Kagadi, Uganda.  He operates a liquor store selling local brew to earn a daily income, in addition to  farming and a piggery. 

His dreams are to complete construction of a permanent house, and educate his children. 

He is challenged by the poor road network and low capital. 

Joram is requesting a loan to buy local brew to sell.

loans.use: to buy local brew to sell.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel, a married father of two, is a farmer in rural western Uganda. He grows maize beans as well as bananas, which he uses for his family, and then sells the rest of the produce. He purchases from other agricultualists to supplement his, and later sells in bulk to big consumers in the city and in schools. 

He is challenged by limited capital, though, but hopes that with financial support from Ugafode this will soon be history. 

He is hard-working.

loans.use: To buy produce

loans.name: Specioza

texts.en:
Specioza owns a boutique in Kagadi, Uganda selling second-hand clothes. She is 44 years old, and has been in this business for 14 years. She also owns a retail shop, enabling her to make ends meet. 

She dreams of buying land and educating her five children in the future. 

Specioza has asked for a loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a Ugandan married male, aged 39 years, living in Kagadi, Uganda. He owns a retail shop selling motorcycle spare parts where he generates income, having started from a hardware shop that is now being managed by his wife. 

He describes himself as a hardworking man though he faces challenges of competition from similar businesses. His dream of building a permanent home in the future is almost achieved as he hasstarted building. Joseph intends to use the loan to buy motorcycle spare parts to sell.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Hadji

texts.en: Hadji was born in Fuzuli city in 1971.  At 21 years old, his motherland was occupied by Armenians, and Hadji’s family is IDP (Internally Displaced Person). Hadji is married, and a father of a child. They live in Bala Bahmanli village of the Fuzuli region. His child is 16, he goes to tenth class of school, and is  preparing for university. His wife is a housewife, and Hadji is a taxi driver. Hadji is a hard-working man and loves his job. Now he needs a loan in the amount of 1350 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). Hadji has applied to the Komak company. With this loan he wants to buy winter wheels and anti-crash chain. Hadji is thankful to Kiva and lenders for help. In the future he wants to repair car saloons.

loans.use: to buy winter wheels, and anti-crash chain.

loans.name: Majmla

texts.en:
Majmla is a 44-year-old married woman who has children. She lives in Hodeidah, Yemen. 

She completed her secondary school education then, due to family issues, she pledged to move ahead in life and improve her quality of life. To be able to generate the earnings that she needs, she decided to sell incense, perfumes, and other items in order to able to make a profit. She is always thinking about being able to increase her customers, and for a long time has been offering them friendly service so that they will buy from her again. 

She has requested a loan of 40,000 Yemeni rials from AMB to expand her business by buying incense, perfumes, and other products which will increase her profit.

loans.use: to buy incense, perfumes, and other products which will increase her profit.

loans.name: Benon

texts.en:
Benon a 30-year-old married man with three children.  He lives in a trading center in a rural area in Western Uganda. 

He is driven by his desire to educate his children. Benon started an agricultural produce business with little capital.  He is optimistic and hopes to earn a profit since the demand for maize and beans is high. He earns a profit because he is able to buy cheaply and sell at a higher price. 

He is challenged by limited income and therefore  cannot adequately meet his customer's demands. He hopes that a loan from Ugafode will help to solve this challenge. 

Benon thanks Ugafode  and the Kiva lenders for providing financial support.

loans.use: to buy stock items to  resell.

loans.name: Bahadur

texts.en:
Bahadur is a married taxi driver with three children. His oldest son is married, a second son attends college, and his daughter is at the University. Bahadur’s wife is a nurse. They live in the Baku region. 

He has had a taxi for many years and transports passengers in the Baku region. He has applied to the Komak company for an  800 AZN loan to repair his car's motor. 

Bahadur thanks the Kiva organization and lenders.

loans.use: to repair his car's motor.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a married Ugandan male, aged 40, living in Kagadi, Uganda with six children. He operates a retail shop business where he sells general merchandise, and he also earns from agriculture; specifically sugar cane growing. He plans to construct a permanent residential house and educate his children, though he is challenged by competition and seasonal changes. Stephen will use the loan to buy sodas, beers, soap, and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy sodas, beers, soap, and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Wadha

texts.en:
Wadha is a 24-year-old hardworking woman who lives in Taiz, Yemen. 

She is a nurse at a clinic and earns a low salary.  She works hard to offer a good life to her family. Most of the money she makes is spent on  family expenses. She intends to buy home appliances but needs additional money. She requests a loan of 200,000 YER to buy home appliances. 

She hopes to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy home appliances.

loans.name: Timothy's Group

texts.en:
Timothy is a member of this group in Webuye District.  He is pictured here in a group of seven One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 65 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Timothy has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised.  He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of  seeds for maize and ¼ acre of seeds for sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.
							
Timothy is 21 years old and has been a farmer for five years.  Timothy works as a farmer to provide for his one child.  The community and other farmers know Timothy as hardworking and an experienced farmer.  Other than farming, he is also involved in his community's activities such as the men's group and savings group.  Timothy described his harvest last year as good, but hopes he can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in his group.	

Timothy joined One Acre Fund in 2010, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader.  Timothy joined One Acre Fund so that he could get the best seed prices, get new farming methods, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds.  Because he is an active community member who wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers.  Timothy has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative.  Working with One Acre Fund has improved Timothy's life because he has more profits from harvest, has more farm training and was able to save money.  In the future, Timothy hopes that his profits from 2014 can be used to invest in a business.

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya.  The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers.  Timothy and his group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.	

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds for maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Carmensa

texts.es: Doña Carmensa es originaria de Managua, casada y madre de seis hijos, cuatro de ellos ya independientes. De 48 años de edad. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de tortillas y frijoles. Inicio su negocio con un préstamo de mil córdobas y poco a poco fue comprando insumos para sus productos, hoy en día cuenta con un negocio prospero y una clientela amplia. Solicita el crédito para la compra de: Maíz, Frijoles y algunos artículos para mejorar su vivienda. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá comprar mayores insumos para los productos que comercializa. Su plan futuro es mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Carmensa hails from Managua. She is married and is mother to six children, four of whom are already independent. She is 48 years old.

She is a merchant and makes her living selling tortillas and beans. She started her business with a loan of 1000 córdobas, and little by little she bought the ingredients for her products. Today she has a thriving business and a large clientele.

She is applying for the loan to buy corn, beans, and some items to improve her housing. She anticipates that the loan will be of great help to her because she will be able to buy more ingredients for the products she sells.

Her future plan is to improve the infrastructure of her house.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, and some items to improve her housing.

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en:
Jane is a member of this group in Webuye District.  She is pictured here in a group of six One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 63 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Jane has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative, and is standing on the right with her hand raised.  She and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation.

Jane is 52 years old and has been a farmer for 32 years.  Jane works as a farmer to provide for her 10 children.  The community and other farmers know Jane as friendly, hardworking, reliable, trustworthy and an experienced farmer.  Other than farming, she is also involved in her community's activities such as the women's group, savings group, prayer group and burial committee.  Jane described her harvest last year as excellent, but hopes she can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in her group.

Jane first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2011, and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 long rains season.  Jane joined the One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, get new farming methods, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds, earn enough to feed family and send children to school.  She also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she is an active community member who wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers.  

Jane plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send children to school, repair the home, save for the future, buy a cow and invest in a business.  She notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  Jane’s own life was improved because she has more profits from the harvest, has more farm training, has more farm group support, was able to save money and feed the family. 

One Acre Fund focuses on working with small-holder farmers across Kenya.  The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings on to the farmers.  Jane and her group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.	

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To allow farmers the opportunity to buy cost efficient maize, millet, and sorghum seeds.

loans.name: Nalulwe's Group

texts.en:
Nalulwe is a member of this group in Webuye District.  He is pictured here in a group of 5 One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 41 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Nalulwe has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised.  He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving seeds for ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.
							
Nalulwe is married and has ten children.  He is 53 years old and is known as friendly, reliable and trustworthy.  He is active in his community in groups such as the men's group, savings group, and prayer group.  Nalulwe has been a farmer for 35 years.  Nalulwe described his harvest as excellent last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.

Nalulwe joined One Acre Fund in 2010, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader.  Nalulwe joined One Acre Fund so that he could get new farming methods, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds, and earn enough to feed his family.  Because he is an active community member, he wants to spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers.  Nalulwe has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative.  Working with One Acre Fund has improved Nalulwe's life because he has more profits from the harvest, has more farm training, and was able to feed the family.  In the future, Nalulwe hopes that his profits from 2014 can be used to send his children to school and save for the future.  

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya.  The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers.  Nalulwe and his group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.							

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to increase better harvests of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Janepher's Group

texts.en:
Janepher is a member of this group in Webuye District.  She is pictured here in a group of 5 One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 64 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Janepher has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with her hand raised.  She and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation.							

Janepher is 43 years old, married, and has nine children.  She is known as friendly, trustworthy, and an experienced farmer.  She is active in her community's groups such as the women's group and the savings group.  Janepher has been a farmer for 20 years.  She described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. 
 							
Janepher first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2009 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  She joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, get new farming methods, and earn enough to feed family.
