She also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she is an active community member who wants to spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers and help more farmers.  Janepher plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and buy a cow.  She notes that working with One Acre Fund has led to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  Janepher’s own life has improved because she was able to save money and feed her family. 
 							
Janepher and her group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase cost efficient hybrid seeds for maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.es: Juan  tiene 37 años es de la comunidad de  de santa Maria , comenta que el creció solo con su madre a la cual le agradece mucho todo el sacrificio que ella hizo en ponerlo a estudiar   ya que `pues logro estudiar hasta 2do año de la universidad , después ya tuvo  que salirse  y no termino con su carrera universitaria porque no tenía mucho tiempo ya que se metió en lleno a laborar en actividades del campo como es la siembra de café , estuvo trabajando en una cooperativa de café   donde su trabajo era  capacitar a los miembros que se integraban  en la cooperativa . Dice que él se siente muy feliz porque tiene su pequeña finca de café  la que le da buena cosecha con la que le a permitido darles una condición de vida digna a su esposa y sus tres hijos, como en su casa no tiene energía eléctrica y para poder iluminarse lo que hacen  es comprar candelas o lámparas con baterías pero esto no les permite hacer otras actividades es por eso que esta con el trámite del crédito para comprar un sistema solar  para su casa.
texts.en:
Juan is 37 years old, and lives in the community of Santa Maria.  He says that he was raised only by his mother, to whom he is very grateful for all of the sacrifices she made for him to go to school.  He was able to study until his second year of college, when he had to  and was unable to graduate because he no longer had enough time since her had started working in the fields planting coffee.  He worked in a coffee coop where his job was to train new members.  

He is very happy because he has a small coffee plantation that produces a good harvest that has allowed him to provide his wife and three children with a good life.  Given that they do not have electricity in their home, in order to illuminate the house, they must purchase candles or battery operated lamps.  However, this does not allow them to do other activities, which is why he will use this loan to purchase a solar energy system for his home.

loans.use: purchase a solar energy system for his home.

loans.name: Kabayan Group

texts.en:
Leticia is the featured borrower of the Kabayan group. She got along with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua. They have always been friends since they came from their home town in The Philippines to work as housekeepers to provide their beloved families with the necessary standards of living.

Leticia is a 53-year-old widowed mother of four children, she is the second lady from the right with grey top. Her acquired loan will be sent to The Philippines to pay for her beloved children's necessary school fees since she's the family's sole breadwinner.

As for the other group members, Nelly the first from the left, is a widowed mother of two children, Daisy is the first from the right, Gemma is the lady in the center with a pink top, and Juanita is the second from the left.

loans.use: to pay for her children's educational fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bricks, cement, iron, sand, and quarried stone.

loans.name: Gregoria Gloria

texts.es:
EL Grupo de Crédito Mujeres Unidas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Gregoria, tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen seis hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive en su casa. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Gregoria es una mujer muy luchadora que le gusta trabajar para ayudarle a su marido a salir adelante, ella realiza el crédito una parte para ella y otra para su esposo, mientras ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo su marido vende ropa y productos naturales, ambos tienen sus clientes a quienes siempre visitan ya sea para cobrar u ofrecer nueva mercadería. El trabaja todos los días y ella tres veces por semana,  también venden en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes si necesitan alguna prenda o algún producto natural.  Son más de 14 años dedicados a estos negocios con los cuales han sacado adelante a su familia.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa y productos naturales de varias clases. Está en el Grupo De Crédito 14 años  y le gusta porque con uno de los créditos empezaron su negocio. Sus sueños es tener un local en el centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres Unidas" ("United Women") communal bank gathers together every 15 days in the Jipijapa canton, which is known as the "sultana of coffee". It is known for its vast coffee crops of incomparable flavor, for its gastronomy and for the friendliness of its people.
There lives Gregoria. She's 50 years old and married, and from this relationship they have six adult children, one of whom still lives at home. Her husband is a vendor.
Gregoria is a very tenacious woman who enjoys working in order to help her husband get ahead. She's getting the loan partly for herself and partly for her husband. While she sells various types of clothing, her husband sells natural products. They both have their customers whom they constantly visit, either to collect payments or to offer new merchandise. He works on a daily basis and she works three days a week. They also sell from their home, where their customers come if they need a piece of garment or some natural product. They have been in these businesses for over 14 years and because of them they have gotten their family ahead.
This loan will be used to purchase clothing and natural products of various kinds. She has been with ther communal bank for 14 years and she likes it because they started their business with one of the loans. Her dream is to own a store in the town centre.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and natural products.

loans.name: Namisi's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of 8 group leader farmers in Webuye District with Namisi selected as the Kiva representative.  Namisi has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with his hand raised.  Farming inputs will be delivered to him and the 91 other individual farmers represented in this group.  The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum.  The individual farmers are not pictured here, but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.

Namisi is 46 years old and has been a farmer for 20 years.  Namisi works as a farmer to provide for his 4 children.  The community and other farmers know Namisi as friendly, hardworking, reliable, trustworthy and an experienced farmer.  Other than farming, he is also involved in his community such as the men's group, savings group, prayer group and burial committee.  Namisi described his harvest last year as good, but hopes he can have an even better one with the support of the One Acre Fund and the other farmers in his group.	

Namisi first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2008 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  Namisi joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, get new farming methods, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds, earn enough to feed family and send children to school.  He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he is an active community member, who wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers.  Namisi plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send children to school, repair the home, save for the future, buy a cow and invest in a business.  He notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  Namisi’s own life was improved because he has greater profits from the harvest, has more farm training, has more farm group support, was able to save money, and to feed the family.  

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya.  The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers.  Namisi and his group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.							

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To provide Kenyan farmers with increased access to hybrid seed and fertilizer for harvesting maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Francisco Jacob

texts.es:
El joven Francisco Jacob es originario del municipio de El Sauce un poblado ubicado al occidente del municipio de León.
Este joven tiene 22 años y a pesar de ser muy joven es bien responsable sobre todo en su trabajo y obligado con su mamá.
Se desempeña como operario de limpieza en una Institución de la localidad donde su trabajo principal es recolectar la basura de las calles para mantener limpia la ciudad.
Francisco Jacob en este momento necesita un crédito para pagar consultas médicas y realización de exámenes de su mamá, ya que con su bajo salario solamente alcanza para la comida, porque es el quien tiene a su cargo a su madre.
Está muy agradecido con Kiva y Ceprodel por apoyarle con los créditos ya que son de gran ayuda que benefician a las personas de escasos recursos que muchas veces necesitan para resolver problemas de salud y económicos.
Espera que le sigan apoyando para tener sana a su madre.
texts.en:
Francisco Jacob is a young man who is originally from El Sauce, a village located in the western part of the municipality of León. Despite being a young man who is only 22 years of age, Francisco is very responsible in his work and his obligations to his mother. He works as a janitor for a municipal institution. His main job is collecting the trash on the streets so that the city remains clean.

At the moment, Francisco Jacob needs a loan so that he can pay for visits to the doctor and examinations for his mother. His meager salary only covers food, but he is responsible for looking after his mother. He is extremely grateful to Kiva and CEPRODEL for assisting people with limited resources because often times they need to resolve both health and financial problems.

He hopes to have the continued support so that his mother can remain healthy.

loans.use: to pay for his mother's medical expenses.

loans.name: Rejia I

texts.en:
Rejia is a rural housewife. She is from the small town of Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.  She is married to Ramjan, aged 28 years. Rejia completed her school up to grade 5, whereas her husband received education up to grade 8. They live in a kachha house (mud, straw and bamboo-made) with one daughter and one son, who are below the school-going age.   

Rejia’s husband is a cycle-van puller by profession. He carries goods and people and earns money to maintain the needs of his family. He gives hard labour to take care of his family, but is unable to give them comfort.

Rejia now wants to extend her helping hands to her husband. They have a small piece of land, very adjacent to their house. They have decided to start cultivation of potatoes there. They have chosen this business because potato is a very essential vegetable, used in almost every dish in her locality, and so Rejia thinks this will be a lucrative business. 

Rejia has taken a loan from BJS to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers to start cultivation as early as possible. Her husband will assist her greatly in her daily activities related to farming, and she is very hopeful to earn a profit from this new business. This will help her to reach her goals of giving a decent lifestyle to her family, educate her children to be established in life, and lastly, purchase a scooter for their own use.

Rejia and her husband are very much thankful to the lenders (BJS and Kiva) for giving them a loan.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for cultivation of potatoes.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed, 42-years-old, is married and has children aged 19 and 13 years.  In 1997, Mohamed established his local foodstuff business since he needed a source of income to provide for his family's livelihood. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,000,000 every month from this business. 
Mohamed requires a loan of SLL 4,000,000 to buy bags of local foodstuff for his business. Mohamed used proceeds from his last loan to pay school fees for his children and provided livelihood for his family. He was able to start his build project as planned and hope that this loan will help him to continue.
He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more local foodstuff for his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothes for her bread business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more onions, rice, palm oil, vita, pepper, salt etc to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more wax cotton to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy medical drugs and baby food for resale.

loans.name: Khorn

texts.en:
From Bakan district of Pursat province, Khorn is 57 years old and an experienced farmer who has been in the agricultural business for more than 30 years. She is married and a loving mother of four children, one of whom helps the family earn income by working as a paid laborer in the neighbor country of Cambodia. Khorn is able to grow rice twice a year and earns well for her family because of a good location and water irrigation supply.

Khorn is asking for this loan to build a household latrine to improve the sanitation practices for the sake of her children. She will use the loan to pay for construction materials and pay for labor costs. With help from the water loan program and a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited, Khorn is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions to safeguard the health of her family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a household latrine to improve the family's sanitation practices.

loans.name: Babylin

texts.en:
Babylin is 33 years old and lives in Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has four children. Together with her husband, Babylin is engaged in a fishing activity. They sell their catch at the market and to their neighborhood. The family earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month, doing this work.

She has requested a loan, which she will use to purchase nylon line, fishing hooks and nets, for their fishing activity. Babylin has been a member of PMPC for seven years, already. In the future, Babylin hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase nylon line, fishing hooks and nets

loans.name: Anjali I

texts.en:
Anjali is from a small village, Raipara, in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is only 27 years old and studied up to grade 9. She is married to Sailen, 30 years old, and engaged in a business of selling bamboo. He studied up to grade 5. Together, they are raising only one son, who is below school-going age. They live in their own kachha house (bamboo, mud and straw-made).

Anjali's husband works hard to run the family well, but his income is too small to maintain all the necessities of their family. Anjali is involved in animal husbandry to provide primary income for her family. She started the business one year ago in order to make money to support the family. Today, she has one dairy cow and sells the milk to her neighbors and earns some money, which is not sufficient to overcome the financial hurdles of the family. Her husband also helps her in her business. 

In order to grow her business, Anjali has decided to purchase one more cow. She heard about BJS and that they give loans to rural women to start new businesses. She has taken a loan from them to purchase another cow. She hopes that this will help her to sell more milk so she can generate more profit, with which she will be able to fulfill her dreams, such as educate her son properly, give financial assistance to her family, and to purchase a Maruti car for their own use.

She thanks her lenders (BJS and Kiva) for the loan.

loans.use: to purchase one more dairy cow for her milk supply business.

loans.name: Olga Diane

texts.fr: Diane est une jeune dame célibataire âgée de 31 ans mère de famille. Elle a un bar  qu'elle gère dans un quartier de la capitale depuis un an. c'est grâce à cette activité qu'elle subvient aux besoins de sa famille. grâce à son savoir vivre, elle a développer une clientèle qui s'accroit au fil du temps et là, elle ne parvient plus à la satisfaire à cause gde la petitesse de son capital, d'où la nécessité de ce crédit dans son activité car il lui permettra non seulement d'augmenter ses casiers de boissons mais aussi sa marge bénéficiaire. bénéfice qui sera en partie réinvesti dans son activité pour l'agrandir et le reste l'aidera pour sa famille.
texts.en: Diane is a young woman, unmarried, 31 years old, and the mother of a family. She has a bar she has been running for a year in a district in the capital. Thanks to this business, she is meeting the needs of the family. Thanks to her know-how, she has developed a customer base that is growing over the course of time, though she can no longer manage to satisfy them due to her meager capital. This explains the need for a loan for her business, since it will enable her not only to increase her cases of drinks but also her profits, which will in part be reinvested in her business to expand it. The rest will help her to support her family.

loans.use: to increase the quantity of goods (cases of drinks) for her bar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build his family a brick house

loans.name: Rimer

texts.es: El señor Rimes tiene 26 años, a su corta edad ya construyó su propia casa en un terreno que le heredaron los padres, pero Rimer desde muy joven se fue a Brasil a trabajar en una empresa de costura donde logro aprender a confeccionar colchones, y es así que actualmente cuenta con una pequeña fábrica donde los confecciona para venderlos en el mercado interno de Cochabamba,  con los ahorros de su trabajo en Brasil logro comprar las máquinas de coser. Vive en la comunidad de Tamborada junto a la casa de su madre. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de materia prima para confeccionar colchones, así lograra incrementar sus ventas y mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en: Señor Rimes is 26-years old.  At his young age, he has already built his own home on some land that he was given by his parents.  When he was very young, Rimer went to Brazil to work for a sewing company, where he learned how to make mattresses.  And that is how he came to have a small mattress-making factory.  He sells the mattresses in Cochabamba's domestic market.  With his savings from his work in Brazil, Rimer was able to buy the sewing machines.  He lives in the Tamborada community, near his mother's house.  The loan Rimer is requesting is for the purchase of raw materials for making mattresses.  He will then be able to increase his sales and improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for making mattresses.

loans.name: Wilson Gonzalo

texts.es:
Wilson tiene 52 años de edad es divorsiado tiene dos hijas vive con sus familia en el Cantón Chimbo Provincia de Bolivar.


Se dedica a la compra de cerdos para engordarles y luego vender. Solicita el crédito para comprar de balanceado para los animales. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo que le hace falta.
El sueño es mejorar en los negocios.
Los desafíos que se enfrenta es la competencia.
En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar y pasar tiempo con sus hija.
texts.en:
Wilson is 52 years old and divorced. He has two daughters and lives with his family in the Chimbo canton of the province of Bolivar.

He buys pigs for fattening and then selling. He's requesting the loan in order to purchase balanced feed for the animals. With the help of the loan he'll be able to buy what he currently needs.
His dream is to make progress in his business.
The challenge he faces is the competition.
In his spare time he enjoys playing and spending time with his daughters.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed for pigs.

loans.name: Luis Raul

texts.es: El señor Luis es una persona trabajadora, de 40 años de edad, está casado, alcanzo a estudiar una carrera técnica, cuenta con dos dependientes económicos a cargo los cuales son sus pequeños hijos y actualmente vive junto a su familia en casa de su hermano en calidad de cuidador. El señor trabaja diariamente prestando servicios de transporte urbano de peatones como taxista con su propio vehículo desde hace 15 años, tal actividad es su fuente principal para generar ingresos para el sustento de su familia. Como quiere mejorar sus condiciones de vida solicita un crédito para realizar la reparación de su vehículo que es su herramienta de trabajo, de esta manera lograra proporcionar un servicio mas eficiente y generara mayores ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Señor Luis is a hard-working person.  He is 40-years old and married.  He went to technical school.  He has two financial dependents that he takes care of, his young children.  Señor Luis currently lives with his family in his brother's house as a caretaker.   Señor Luis works everyday offering urban transportation services to pedestrians.  He has worked as a taxi driver with his own vehicle for 15 years.  This work is his main source of income with which to support his family.  As he wants to improve his standard of living, Señor Luis is requesting a loan.  He will use the loan to make repairs to his vehicle, which is his "tool of the trade."  He will then be able to provide more efficient service, generate a greater income and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to make repairs to his taxi, his sole source of income

loans.name: Blanca Victoria

texts.es:
Blanca tiene 30 años de edad es soltera , vive con los padres en el Cantón Chimbo Provincia de Bolivar.

Se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, trigo. Solicita el crédito para comprar semilla gruesa, abonos, insecticidas, herbicidas.
Con la ayuda del crédito podrá invertir en los trabajos del campo. El sueño es comprarse una casa .
Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las enfermedades y el mal clima.
En el tiempo libre le gusta caminar.
texts.en:
Blanca is 30-years old.  She is single and lives with her parents in Chimbo Canton, de Bolivar Province.
Blanca makes her living in agriculture; she grows corn and wheat.  She is requesting the loan to purchase seeds in bulk, compost, insecticides and herbicides. 
With the help of the loan, Blanca will be able to invest in her work in the fields.  Her dream is to buy herself a house. 
The challenges she faces are disease and bad weather. 
In her free time, Blanca likes to go for walks.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural fertilizers.

loans.name: Mavluydakhon

texts.ru: Мавлудахон 45 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Мавлудахон - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Мавлудахон занимается животноводством, стартовав 16 лет назад, с покупки скота на 3,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Мавлудахон, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Мавлудахон обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку бычков для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Мавлудахон планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Mavluydakhon is 45, married, and has three children. She has a high school education and earns the main income for her family through animal husbandry. She started 16 years ago when she bought cattle for 3,000 som (KGS). Mavluydakhon now has 2 dairy cows on her farm, thanks to her hard work, and her monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). In order to continue to develop her farm she asked Bai-Tushum and partners for a loan to buy steers. She plans to use her profits to invest in additional livestock.

loans.use: to buy steers

loans.name: Saraswati

texts.en:
Saraswati is a 45-year-old married woman who, together with her husband, is raising two children (sons). Both Saraswati and her husband are illiterate and can only sign their names. Her husband, Ganesh, aged 55 years, is engaged in cultivation of different kinds of vegetables. Their sons are also engaged in agribusiness with their father. They live in their own house in the small town, Dhupguri, in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Saraswati's husband works hard on their farmland. Their two sons also assist him. Saraswati, though a housewife, helps them after managing her household work. They grow different vegetables in different seasons and sell them in the local market to earn their livelihood. Unfortunately, they are unable to meet the family expenses of four members with this small income.  

They need to expand the business, but they don't have the capital. So, Saraswati applied for a loan from BJS to purchase seeds for beans, fertilizers, pesticides, etc. They will cultivate beans on their farmland, as beans are in great demand in the present market. She hopes this business will give her extra profit to reach her goal of providing a better lifestyle to her family.

She desires to upgrade their house to a pacca (concrete) one, and she plans to use the rest of the profit to reinvest in her business.

She is grateful to her lenders (BJS and Kiva) for the loan.

loans.use: to purchase bean seeds and fertilizers to cultivate beans on their own farmland.

loans.name: Awudu

texts.en:
Awudu is a Ghanaian artisan who creates hand-carved African wood masks and decor. He would like to stock up on the raw materials he uses for his masks, vases and decor items.

Awudu has been selling through NOVICA since 2010. This is his story:

"When I was a boy, I'd follow friends home after school. Their parents had a carving workshop. They noticed my interest and let me try sandpapering the carved items, then I began learning how to design and finish a piece. I had to drop out of school due to financial difficulties and I started working on my own. I was determined to make it and was able to put my siblings through school. Now my dream is to further my education and expand my workshop to be able to train more people."

"I am very grateful to you who are helping to fund this loan. I know it will help me to produce more designs. Thank you!"

Use the link below to view Awudu's hand-carved African masks and decor on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/7784

loans.use: to stock up on the raw materials he uses for his masks, vases and decor items

loans.name: Asunta

texts.en:
Asunta is a Peruvian artisan who specializes in the traditional reverse-painted glass. She would like to invest in the purchase of wood, paint and lacquer for production.

Asunta has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is her story:

"At first my husband's family taught me, then we united our skills and labor. I realized that the more I practiced, the more this craft won me over, offering me tremendous gratification. Now I consider it a way of life. This whole process demands incredible patience and attention to detail. My designs are inspired by nature, and by traditional scenes from my town and region. I feel very proud of the works that I create."

"I would like to thank you for the opportunity of this microcredit. It makes it easier on me to purchase my prime materials and so keep active in my craft."

Use the link below to view Asunta's traditional Andean reverse-painted glass on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/1028

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of wood, paint and lacquer for production

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is a 39-year-old married woman from Panglao, Bohol. She has three children ages 19, 14, and 10 years old respectively. She engages in a food selling business. She sells ice candy. In addition to that, she also goes fishing. She sells fish. But due to lack of capital, she is requesting a loan to buy fishing net, a scale and a pump boat (an outrigger canoe powered by a small gasoline or diesel engine) machine.This is very essential to improve her catch and would create higher income, thus providing her family with nutritious food and a quality education for her children.

Merlinda hopes to expand both her businesses for a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, a scale, and a pump boat machine.

loans.name: Marivil

texts.en:
Marivil is a 44-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Panglao, Bohol. The youngest is 5 years old while the oldest is 17. She goes fishing. She catches and sells fish. To augment her income, she also engages in a food selling business. She sells snack foods in her neighborhood. 

She is requesting a loan to buy fishing net, styrofoam (for fish storage) and ice (to preserve the fish). This will help her in her day-to-day life activities. The income will go toward food and to pay for school expenses.

Marivil hopes to expand her business and make it a success for the welfare of her children.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, styrofoam (for fish storage) and ice (to preserve the fish).

loans.name: Emilio

texts.en:
Emilio is a Peruvian artisan who specializes in dried mate gourd art. He would like to invest in the purchase of gourds and tools for production.

Emilio has been selling through NOVICA since 2006. This is his story:

"I was born in Huancayo, Peru. This art is in my blood. It's something that is born from generation to generation, carried by a magical world toward natural materials. Through my own initiative and desire to learn, my eyes saw and my hands created. This is how I began in this wonderful world, trying to create and create.

"I am so happy and grateful to be considered for this microcredit. With it, I'll be able to purchase the materials and tools I need to craft the items for this year's sales, so thank you very much."

Use the link below to view Emilio's mate gourd décor on the NOVICA site:

http://www.novica.com/kiva/6001

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of gourds and tools for production of his art.

loans.name: Emma

texts.es:
Emma es profesora en área urbana, tiene un hijo, actualmente viven en la casa de sus padres, en donde tienen una habitación con piso de tierra en la ciudad de El Alto. Tienen una casita  propia la cual está refaccionando,y justamente el crédito que solicita lo requiere para compra de cemento y estuco para continuar la refacción.

El sueño de Emma es contar con un domicilio en condiciones de buena habitabilidad para confort de su familia. En la foto aparece con su esposo, quien trabaja como conductor de un taxi.

Es la primera  vez que solicita crédito  en IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA
texts.en:
Emma is a teacher in an urban area. She has a son, with whom she is currently living in her parents' house. There, mother and son have a room with a floor made of earth in the city of El Alto. Emma has her own little house, which is currently being done up. She is applying for a this loan in order to buy cement and plaster in order to continue with the building work.

Emma's dream is to have a good house for her family to live comfortably. With her in the photo is her husband, who works as a taxi cab driver.

This is the first time that Emma has applied for a loan with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy cement and plaster in order to continue doing up her house and to be able to move in to it.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy compost and chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy paper, pens, and other office supplies.

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
La socia Hermelinda continua dedicándose al negocio de elaboración de pan, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen Asunta de Oropesa” de la Asociación Arariwa.
La socia elabora los panes para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como harina, azúcar entre otros.
La señora Hermelinda agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en: Hermelinda continues working at her breadmaking business, she has worked in this business for a long time and she does well because of the effort she puts into it each day, she belongs to the "Virgen Asunta de Oropesa" communal bank, part of the Asociacion Arariwa. She makes bread to sell to clients that request it, she is an entrepreneurial and hardworking woman, who helps her family get ahead.  She needs a loan to buy ingredients such as flour, sugar, butter and other things. Hermelinda is grateful for the loan and commits to making her payments in accordance with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy ingredientes such as flour, sugar, butter and other things.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy primary materials that will allow him to make cleaning items such as brooms and mops.

loans.name: Daice Mireya

texts.es:
EL Banco comunal De Colorado se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la  señora Daice, tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos mayores de edad, dos de sus hijos aun viven en su casa  y estudian en universidad. Su esposo es chofer, tiene un bus.
Doña Deice es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y zapatos por catalogo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando necesitan de alguna prenda. Trabaja todos los días más que todo en las mañanas, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Tiene 15  años que se dedica a esta actividad  que empezó con el primer crédito que recibió de la institución por lo cual está muy agradecida. 
Este crédito es para comprar ropa y zapatos ya que tiene varios encargos. Esta desde el inicio del banco comunal y le gusta porque el primer crédito empezó su negocio. Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The De Colorado communal bank meets every fifteen days in Colorado del Cantón Montecristi,known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its artistry, which is known on both the national and international levels. This is the home of the famous straw hats.

This is where Daice lives. Daice is 50, married, and has three grown children. Two of her children still live in her home and are in university. Her husband is a driver and has a bus.

Daice is a housewife who sells all kinds of clothing and shoes from a catalog to make her own income. She sells door-to-door and she also sells from her home, where her clients come when they need garments. She works every day, mostly in the mornings. She gives her products on credit and charges every 15 days. She has been doing this work for 15 years, and it started from her first loan from this institution; she is very grateful for this.

She will use this loan for the purchase of clothing and shoes for which she has several orders. She has been in the De Colorado communal bank from the beginning, and she likes it because she started her business with the first loan. Her dream is for her children to be professionals.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita, age 55, is happy tending her little store.  She is married with seven kids, and her husband is a sales agent. The store is her means of earning a living to to help support her family.  Fortunately, her store is located in a populous neighborhood and so she makes promising daily sales.  

Teresita keeps on running the store well even though there is increased competition from other stores.   Teresita believes that with PMPC's support, as one family they will sustain themselves and beat the competition.  

Teresita has reached her first year being a member of Paglaum MPC.  She has applied for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy additional inventories like basic commodities for her sari-sari store business. Expanding her inventory will mean additional income. She has confidence that she can maintain the label of member in good standing. She is a hardworking mother and wishes to sustain the store and from there be able to afford a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy additional inventories like basic commodities for her sari-sari store business

loans.name: Thoern

texts.en:
Thoern (pictured here), age 39, lives in a village about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh City. He has one son and two daughters. All of his children attend school. 
 Thoern’s son is third year student in university in Phnom Penh, majoring in computer science. Studying this major really needs a computer. So, he applied for a loan in order to buy a computer for his son. 
Thoern is a construction worker. His wife sells bananas and flowers by buying bananas and flowers from her fellow villagers and transporting them to sell in Phnom Penh market. 
He will also use a part of the loan to connect his house to a private utility service because he does not have enough water for use.

loans.use: To buy a computer for his son and connect his house to a private utility service.

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara has always been passionate about the publishing industry. She has been in the industry for 30 years, and it is the only industry in which she has ever pursued a career. Two years ago, Tamara realized that the world was becoming increasingly digital, and she established Minnesota Publishing as a way to address traditional publishing and digital media needs.

“Now simple print publishing is no longer the only answer. Publishing will always exist, but it needs to grow and change and integrate digital media in the mix as well.”

In addition to publishing, Tamara helps her clients develop digital marketing strategies, define social media marketing goals, and identify advertising opportunities. As a small business owner herself, Tamara feels greatly fulfilled that she is able to disseminate information to the small business owners who turn to her for digital media and publishing expertise. 

“Meeting small business owners and helping them with their marketing plans and seeing their businesses grow has been my greatest success and opportunity that I’ve had while running Minnesota Publishing. It’s a great feeling!”
 
Now this thoughtful entrepreneur needs your help. Tamara would like to venture into two new zones of work, new monthly magazines and digital products like blogs and an e-directory.

loans.use: to build an online blog and e-directoy

loans.name: Glenys

texts.en:
After losing her job working for a large company, Glenys realized that owning her own business would allow her the financial stability she was looking for to help support her family and the flexibility to spend as much time as possible with her young son.

Realizing that there was a strong demand for tax preparation services in her neighborhood in the Bronx, Glenys established B&G Enterprises, where she provides accounting and tax services. Glenys, a Dominican Republic native, enjoys the role her business plays in the community. She provides bilingual services to her Spanish-speaking clients, many of whom are immigrants who need help understanding and navigating the U.S. financial system.

Glenys has done some advertising in the community, but like many tax preparers, most of her clients come via referrals. With your contribution to her loan goal, you can help Glenys boost her marketing and advertising efforts and experiment with another method of customer acquisition. She will also use the loan to purchase equipment to help her prepare for the busy season starting this month. 

Help this entrepreneur build her business and support her family.

loans.use: to invest in marketing and advertising.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more grocery items for her variety store, which has been running for eight years now. Her loan helped not just in her business but also in the education of her child. She works hard to provide for her family's everyday needs. She also has a barber shop for additional income.
 
She would like to apply for another 19,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her child’s educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Erlinda dreams of being more successful in business and hopes to have a grand vacation. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is 52 years of age and has been blessed with six adult-age children. She and her husband aim to improve their living situation to be able to give their children a better life. Aside from farming, she is engaged in buying and selling vegetables within her local community. Susan plans to have continue to improve her business; she is seeking a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more stocks of ginger, potatoes, cucumbers, beans, cabbages and sweet potatoes to sell. She is hoping that someday she can improve her buy and sell of fruits and vegetables business so she can gain a greater income someday.

loans.use: to buy more ginger, potatoes, cucumbers, beans, cabbages and sweet potatoes to sell

loans.name: Manolo

texts.en: Manolo and his partner Lucho are Peruvian artisans who specialize in leather work. They would like to invest in the purchase of the raw materials they use such as leather, wood and glass, as well as the components needed for the production of mirrors. Manolo, shown on the right in the photo (with his partner Lucho on the left), has been selling through NOVICA since 2005. This is his story: "We both come from families with backgrounds in art. Our work is an artistic creation. We've worked together since 1994, and find it a source of great personal satisfaction. We both strive to transmit beauty and culture. We break all preconceived ideas by combining a distinctive Peruvian look with the art of dedicated masters, all beautifully crafted by hand. "Thanks to your microcredit we are able to renew our designs to keep on top of trends while never letting go of our handcrafted techniques and essence." Use the link below to view Manolo and Lucho's leather work on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/5069

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of the raw materials such as leather, wood and glass, as well as the components needed for the production of mirrors

loans.name: Edinson Urbano

texts.es:
El es edinson urbano tiene 35 años, vive en unión libre actualmente, tiene 2 hijos uno de 8 años y la bebe que 
esta pronta a cumplir un año.
Termino los estudios de bachiller en la nocturna y siguió estudiando los fines de semana Mantenimiento electrónico de computadores y redes llegando a graduase en el año 2006 con un gran sacrificio para cumplir con las obligaciones en el hogar,estudio y trabajo. 
Actualmente se encuentra laborando en la parte de sistemas llevando la experiencia en lo que había aprendido.
Ahora se ve en la capacidad de seguir estudiando en el área de Administración Empresarial para colocar en practica y poder seguir ascendiendo con el fin de seguir brindándole la educación y conocimientos a los hijos, es por eso que se entero del convenio con kiva y le pareció una muy buena ayuda para el nivel económico que el tiene en estos momentos, ya que seria una ayuda económica en el pago del semestre. 
El quiere llegar a tener la empresa o negocio, ya que siempre lo ha soñado para que la esposa labore en el y pueda seguir viendo de los 2 hijos. 

Gracias
texts.en:
Edinson Urbano is 35 years old, married, and has two children.  One is eight years old and the baby is about to turn one.  He finished high school at night and continued studying maintenance of computers and systems on the weekends.  He graduated in 2006 and it was a big sacrifice to meet his obligations at home, study, and work.  He is currently working in systems, using what he had learned.  

Now he sees the opportunity to continue studying in the area of Business Administration to put into practice and be able to continue moving up with the goal of continuing to provide education and knowledge to his children.  This is why he has entered into an agreement with Kiva, and it seems like a good help for the financial situation he has right now.  It would be a financial help to pay for a semester of school.    He wants to have a business or store, since he has always dreamed of having someplace where his wife could work with him and continue seeing his two children.  Thank you.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of school.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chili peppers and seeds in large volumes.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel es cliente de cubo financiero y esta es su historia.

Soy casada tengo dos hijos. Soy una persona perseverante y constante. Tengo un negocio exitoso de papelería y regalos desde hace 8 años que no tiene competencia en mi colonia. Mi negocio es excelente y ventas son muy buenas. El local donde me encuentro es muy pequeño y parte de mi mercancía se queda guardada, quiero el préstamo para ampliar mi negocio y poder exhibir toda mi mercancía.

Mis logros son que con mi negocio he podido conseguir muchas cosas para mi familia, pero ahora mi reto es ampliarlo y ofrecer más variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Isabel is a customer of a financial hub, and this is her story:

I am married with two children. I am a persevering and tenacious person. I have a successful business selling stationary and gifts as of 8 years now that has no competition in my neighborhood. My business is excellent and sales are very good. The store where I work from is very small and part of my merchandise is kept hidden. I want the loan in order to expand my business and be able to show all of my merchandise. 

My accomplishments are that with my business I have been able to get many things for my family, but my challenge now is to expand it and offer more variety in products.

loans.use: to expand her stationary shop.

loans.name: José Manuel

texts.es:
José de 22 años de edad, sus padres con mucho esfuerzo lograron que pudiese cursar un noveno grado, posteriormente empezó el bachillerato; pero debido a la condición económica de sus padres no pudo seguir estudiando, su compañera de vida se dedica al comercio de pescado y a los oficios domésticos de sus hogar. Ella es la única que vive y depende de él.

José se dedica a trabajar con su suegro en un taller de estructura metálicas, esto lo hace todo el día desde hace 3 años, empezó como ayudante y sin ninguna paga solo con la idea de aprender a realizar muy bien este oficio hoy en día ya aprendió bastante y su jefe tiene mucha confianza en él, también por las noches se dedica a la pesca ya que cerca de su casa se encuentra la laguna en la que la mayoría de los habitantes es la fuente de ingreso mayor; luego al regreso su compañera de vida vende los pescado que él a podido obtener en el trascurso de la noche, a esta actividad se a dedicado desde que era muy pequeño su padre quien también era pescador le enseño


Los fondos del crédito serán utilizados, para  arreglar su pequeña casa, ya que le modificara el techo, también comprara unos aperos pesqueros para tener mayor cantidad de pesca y tener mayores ingresos para él y su familia.

Su deseo, es tener su vivienda propia para que él y su esposa y sus futuros hijos puedan tener un lugar digno para vivir y el préstamo le ayudara en el remodelamiento de donde esta residiendo actualmente y al comprar los aperos pesqueros mejorara los ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
José is 22 years old.  His parents made an effort to allow him to attend school through ninth grade.  He started high school, but due to the financial situation of his family, he was not able to continue studying.  His life partner works in fishing and takes care of their home.  She is the only one who lives with him and depends on him.

José works with his father-in-law at a metal structure workshop.  He has been doing this all day for three years.  He started as an assistant without pay in order to learn, and today he does this job very well since he has learned a lot and his boss has a lot of confidence in him.  At night, he also works as a fisherman since there is a lake close to his house.  That is the main income for the majority of the people nearby.  When he returns home, his life partner sells the fish that he was able to catch during the night.  She has done this since she was very young, since her father was also a fisherman and taught her.

He is requesting this loan to repair their small house, since it needs roof repair, and also to purchase some fishing tools so that he can catch a larger quantity of fish and have better profits for him and his family.  His dream is to have his own home so that he and his wife and their future children can have a dignified place to live.  This loan will help them repair where they are living currently and to purchase fishing tools to improve the family income.

loans.use: to make repairs to his home and to purchase fishing tools to have a larger quantity of fish.

loans.name: Dana Disney

texts.es:
Ella es dana disney, tiene actualmente 27 años actualmente vive en unión libre, tiene 2 hijos un niño de 8 años y una niña de 1 año.
El nivel de estudio es de Bachiller; realizo un semestre de Servicio al cliente, está trabajando independiente con las ventas de productos de belleza,calzado y productos de aseo para el hogar Ofreciendo a los familiares, amigos y vecinos todos los días generando un ingreso para la familia. 
Ella quiere iniciar los estudios en Mercadeo y Ventas por que se ve en la capacidad de adquirir más 
conocimientos y mejorar el nivel de estudio y así lograr el sueño de crear el propio negocio.
Ella va a realizar un esfuerzo para iniciar esta etapa de estudio debido a que necesita el convenio con kiva ya que la bebe esta muy pequeña y el dinero que se ahorra con el subsidio de kiva le puede servir para brindarle mas cosas ala hija, a demás la hija es bebe y necesita mucho de la mamá por tal motivo se ve en la capacidad de superarse para ayudarlos en el bienestar y poder obtener un titulo técnico. 
Ella espera que con la carrera de Mercadeo y ventas aprenda nuevos principios y métodos para fortalecer los conocimientos y así lograr comercializar un producto en mercado o crear la propia empresa. 

Ella agradece la oportunidad brindada
texts.en:
This is Dana Disney. She is currently 27 years old and lives with her partner and their two children, an 8-year old boy and a 1-year old girl. She graduated from high-school and then studied Client Services for a semester. She is working independently and selling beauty products, shoes and household items. She offers her products to family members, friends and neighbors every day and has been able to obtain income for the family. She would like to start studies in Marketing and Sales, so that she can learn more, improve her training level and reach her goal of starting her own business. 

She is ready to work hard to start this new phase, but also needs the support from Kiva. Her daughter is very young and the money she would earn thanks to Kiva would go to cover the little girl's expenses. Moreover, her daughter is still a baby and needs a lot from her mother. She is motivated to improve and obtain a professional title, so that she can contribute to their well-being. She expects that the studies in Marketing and Sales will teach her new principles and methods to consolidate her knowledge. This way she would be able to distribute her products in the market or to create her own business. 

She is grateful to Kiva for the opportunity.

loans.use: to pay a semester tuition.

loans.name: Coumba's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Saré Yéroyel est né depuis l'inauguration du BV en 2003, ce groupe est à son 21ème cycle dans le programme des Bancs Villageois. Il compte en son sein des femmes très solidaires entre elles et jouissent d’une grande expérience dans le petit commerce qui constitue leur activité principale. 

Madame Coumba  (debout à droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette. Elle est âgée de 47 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. C’est une femme d’une détermination sans faille dans ses activités génératrices de revenus. Elle est vendeuse de pâte d’arachide qu’elle achète au grand marché hebdomadaire pour la revente dans les autres marchés suivants les jours indiqués.

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter au moins 05 seaux de 20 kg à 8 000 F CFA moyennant un transport de 2 000F CFA pour la revente aux détails avec une marge bénéficiaire minimale de 5 000 F CFA par seau.

Les bénéfices lui permettront d’assurer les besoins familiaux (habillement, santé, scolarité, nourriture, d’une part et d’autre part de mieux épargner.
texts.en:
The group Saré Yéroyel was created since the 'banc villageois' was inaugurated in 2003. The group is on its 21st loan cycle in the 'banc villageois' program. Within the group are women who have a lot of solidarity between themselves and who enjoy much experience in small-scale commerce, which constitutes their main work. 

Ms. Coumba (standing at the right with a hand raised) is the featured borrower. She is 47 years old, married, and the mother of four. She is unquestionably determination for her revenue-generating business. She sells peanut butter which she purchases at the big weekly market in order to sell retail at other markets on subsequent days. 

Her new loan will enable her to purchase at least five 20-kg bucket of peanut butter at 8,000 francs CFA on average by means of transportation at 2,000 francs, so as to resell the goods retail for a profit of at least 5,000 francs per bucket. 

The profits will in part enable her to meet family needs for sure (clothing, healthcare, schooling costs, food), as well as to save more money.

loans.use: to purchase buckets of peanut butter to resell for a profit of at least 5,000 francs per bucket.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao and her husband are vegetable farmers and her husband is also a fisherman when he has time. 
Mao lives in a village approximately seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has four sons, who all in school. 
She hopes to continue her farming business, that’s why she decided to apply for a loan to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm. She also will use a rest of the loan to build a restroom for her family to use.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to maintain her farm and build a restroom for her family to use.

loans.name: Patric

texts.en: Patric is an 18 year old high school graduate from a family of sugarcane farmers in Bago City. Being the eldest among three siblings, he helps his mother plant sugarcane and rice in the farm. His mother’s income is Php 2,500 ($57) per month during harvest season but averages only Php 1,500 ($34) per month on a yearly basis  . An industrious yet shy person, Patric took courage to apply in BagoSphere because his mother can hardly provide food and clothes for them.  Patric passed BagoSphere’s test and interview in the initial assessment. Since he is now qualified for the training, he needs funds for his tuition fee. Patric wants to be a call center agent for him to earn money to help his mom and build their own house.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get him a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Chonchola

texts.en:
Chonchola is a rural married woman who was educated up to grade 8. Her husband Tapan is 35 years old and is a farmer by profession.  They have a daughter who reads in grade 10. They live in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri in their own house.

Chonchola's husband is engaged in an agricultural business and has been doing farming for more than five years. He grows vegetables on his land and sells them in the local market.  His farming is the main source of income for the family.  Chonchola helps her husband in farming and is a hardworking and ambitious lady. She also runs an animal husbandry business to help her husband run the family well.  Yet, they are unable to give sufficient financial sustenance to her family.

Now they have decided to start a new business selling milk and milk products. They applied for a loan from BJS to purchase a milchi cow, which will boost milk production so that she will produce milk products like butter, paneer, curd etc. to sell to her neighbors, which will improve their income. This will help them to educate their son with ease and the income will improve their living standards. She dreams of upgrading their house to a concrete -made house with the profit from her new business.

She thanks Kiva and BJS heartily.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Namita

texts.en:
Namita is 28 years old, married and together with her husband, is raising one daughter.  She is illiterate and can only sign her name. She is married to Tapan who is a green grocer by profession. Their only daughter is a student in grade 3. They are from a remote village in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. They live in their own kachha house (mud, bamboo and straw made).

Her husband has an agricultural business.  He grows green vegetables like chili, beans, and other seasonal vegetables on their own land and sells the products in the market.  As an additional source of income for her family, Namita practices livestock breeding. She started this business five years ago, as they were unable to run the family with her husband's small income. Every day she gets up at the crack of dawn, gets her daughter ready for school, does all household jobs and then looks after her cattle and works in her animal husbandry business. She has a great dedication to her work with which she will be able to improve her family's wellbeing and provide a better future to her daughter.

Now she is asking for a loan from BJS to purchase another cow with the aim of starting a business selling milk products.  She hopes she will earn more profit from this new business, as the products (butter. Paneer, curd, cheese) are in great demand in the present market. Namita plans to invest the earnings from the loan for the future acquisition of cattle.  She also intends to save money for her daughter's future and purchase a scooter for their own use.

She is grateful to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow to start a milk supply and dairy products business.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman from a small village in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is only 24 years old and illiterate but can sign her name. Due to the poor economic condition of her parents, she could not get an elementary education. She is married to Kartick who is 29 years old and engaged in a firewood business. They have a school-going daughter who reads in grade 3.  They live in their own house.

Asha is a housewife. In order to help her husband, she works a lot with her husband after doing her household work. She collects firewood from her village and the neighboring villages from the wholesalers and sells it to her neighbors.  This is the only source of income for her family but the income from this business is too low to cover all the expenses, specially the educational expenses of their daughter.

They thought of expanding the existing business by purchasing more firewood from the wholesale market, but they don't have the capital. For that reason, she applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase firewood. They hope to earn an additional profit because firewood is widely used as fuel in rural areas. Asha hopes to keep her business active to more customers, which will increase her sales and provide extra profit to cover her family expenses. She also intends to upgrade their kachha house (made of straw and mud) to a concrete-made house (brick-built).

She and her husband are thankful for BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more firewood to sell

loans.name: Smail

texts.en: Smail known under the name of "Pastor Smail." He is the minister of a local church in a small community named "Fond Blanc" about 2 hours from Port-au-Prince, the capital of Haiti. He is also the school principal of a school within the community. In this community there is no access to electricity so the people use "lamp tèt gridap, candles, etc," which are not good for their health. Pastor Smail realizes that the Eneji Pwop products are not only better for the people's health, but also save the people money. So he wants to help his community by selling the Eneji Pwop products (Lanp Eneji Pwop, Powapak, Sunking Pro & Recho Gaz blan), but he also will improve his economic situation.

loans.use: To sell solar systems to his teachers and the community he lives in (Fond Blanc)

loans.name: 3.03.805.09.thiệu Lý Group

texts.en:
Luận is applying for a loan to purchase calves to raise and sell in the future.  She works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle.  Luận is 55 years old and she is married with 2 children.  She is the group leader of the 3.03.805.09.Thiệu Lý solidarity group, which consists of 4 members.  She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, Luận joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business.  She has successfully repaid 3 loans from the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Luận has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.  The main hardship that Luận faces in her business is the lack of capital.  With her business profit, Luận hopes for her business to do well and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase calves to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Leidy

texts.es:
Ella es leidy, una joven de tan solo 16 años  de edad, estaba  buscando una institución que le pudiera prestar los servicios de educación, porque ella está estudiando  en un colegio el cual no tiene ningún tipo de convenio con instituciones  para salir del bachillerato  con un programa técnico, con el cual  pueda desempeñarse  para enfrentar las dificultades  económicas y así  poder conseguir trabajo que  facilite el sistema económico con el que va a pagar una  carrera profesional, ella se presentó a una institución,  pero esa institución no tenía  los horarios académicos para que ella estudiara en el colegio  y en la otra institución, ella estaba buscando una institución  que le brindara el programa académico AUX CONTABLE porque  en el colegio la mama le había enseñado una parte de esa labor que se desempeña  en una empresa, a ella le gustaba porque  le iba muy bien  en  los números y la contabilidad y se decidió por  ese programa.
Todos los días a la salida del colegio y rumbo a la casa pasaba  por la institución de campo alto, ella fue con la prima a consultar el programa  que ella quería estudiar, Leidy dijo que estaba cursando el grado décimo en el colegio y le ofrecieron un descuento  y se lo iban a sostener todos los semestres del técnico, ella le llamo mucho la atención porque la madre  era la que la apoyaba en esa meta, ella  no es hija única,  tiene dos hermanos  más y no tenía un presupuesto tan alto  para poder estudiar, puesto que la mama es la que tiene que pagar arriendo y el estudio todos ellos. 
Ella quería cumplir la meta para que  cuando terminara el bachillerato pudiera trabajar de día y estudiar de noche para  ayudarle a la mama económicamente, leidy le comento a la mama y se decidieron por matricularse en la institución, se destacaba por llevar un buen rendimiento académico  y por no  faltar ninguna clase,  ella quiere continuar para terminar y graduarse, pero  el descuento que tenia había caducado en Campo Alto  y el subsidio  que ella tenía por estar terminando el bachillerato se acabó  y  la cuotas subieron, así que  la mama le dijo que no contaba económicamente  para  pagarle esas cuotas tan altas ella se acercó a Campo Alto y ellos le ofrecieron un descuento con kiva, la mama dijo que si aceptan  el descuento  y a si poder terminar el técnico y poder cumplir los sueños para triunfar en la vida.
texts.en:
This is Leidy.  She is a young woman, just 16-years old.  She was looking for an educational institution to attend, as she was going to a high school that doesn't have any agreements with any higher education institutions that would allow her to finish high school with a technical degree.  A technical degree would prepare her to face financial difficulties and find employment that would allow her to pay for studying a profession.  She went to one institution, but that one didn't have an academic schedule that would allow her attend high school and the institution.  She was looking for an institution that would offer the "AUX CONTABLE" (accounting assistant) academic program.  In high school, Leidy's mother had taught her some accounting work, which she herself did for a company.  Leidy liked it because she was good at numbers and accounting, and she decided on that program. 
Every day heading home from school, Leidy would go by the "Campo Alto" Institution.  She went with a cousin to ask about the program that she wanted to study.  Leidy told Campo Alto that she was in 10th grade.  They offered her a discount and support for all her semesters of technical study.  That really caught Leidy's attention because her mother was the one supporting her with her goal, and Leidy is not an only child.  Leidy has two siblings, and the family didn't have enough in their budget for her to able to continue her studies.  Her mother was the one paying the rent and all of their schooling. 
Leidy wanted to meet her goal that after finishing high school, she would work by day and study at night, so as to help her mother financially.  Leidy told her mother about the offer, and they decided that she should register with the institution.  She had good academic performance at Campo Alto and never missed a class.  She wants to continue her studies and to graduate, but the discount that she had with Campo Alto expired, the subsidy she had for finishing high school ended and her school fees went up.  Leidy's mother told her that she didn't have the money to pay such high fees.  Leidy went to Campo Alto and they offered her a discount through Kiva.  Her mother said that they would accept the discount so Leidy could finish her course work, meet her goals and triumph in life.

loans.use: to pay for a semester's tuition.

loans.name: Vianey

texts.en: Vianey and Lauro are happily married and live in Totolapan, Morelos with their three teenage children. Vianey supports Lauro in the field harvesting different kinds of crops all year round. They have worked hard and always saved to have a house they could be proud of. They have been investing in this house the last 25 years growing it little by little. They now want to build a complete bathroom and an additional bedroom so her daughter can have her own room. Being a teenager is not easy and sleeping with her brothers is starting to make things hard on her. Vianey and Lauro have been saving to do this new construction to their house. They now need a loan to finish paying for the materials and complete the home improvement. Since they have no formal jobs and no way to prove their income, they do not have access to credit from other institutions. Vianey is really looking forward to giver her daughter her own space and her family a proper bathroom. She will receive supervision visits from certified technicians to make sure the construction meets all the quality and safety standards. Vianey and Lauro know that this can only be achieved trough hard work and sacrifice.

loans.use: to build a bathroom and a bedroom

loans.name: Amanda

texts.es:
Ella se llama Amanda y el hermoso hijo Brian; ellos tenían un hogar muy bonito que formaron con Diego, un hombre que llego a las vidas de estas dos personas hacia unos años atrás.
Todo funcionaba de maravilla hasta un día este hombre empezó a cambiar y comportarse de manera completamente diferente que la relación que tenia con Amanda se fue deteriorando, esta mujer que lo único que hacía era trabajar y mantener  la casa perfecta, al cabo de 8 años el sufrió un accidente de tránsito el cual lo dejo en silla de ruedas.  
 Para ellos esto fue un golpe muy doloroso pero a pesar de todo seguían al lado de este hombre que no hacia otra cosa que tratarlos mal.  
Un día Amanda recibió una llamada en la que le decían que la madre estaba muy grave en el hospital,  ella en el inmenso amor por la madre corrió para ayudarla, pero el esposo no la apoyo de la manera que ella esperaba,  por el contrario se encontró con un ser totalmente diferente, grosero, arrogante, violento, humillante; el cual no hacía sino hacerla ver como una persona que no servía para nada, a si que en este momento ella decide estudiar una carrera que le sirva para tener una proyección laboral y se decide por estudiar auxiliar contable, pero para ella se entero de kiva y decidió tener la oportunidad de pertenecer a este convenio, ya que a si quedaría pagando una mensualidad un poco más económica  y podría tener una estabilidad laboral mucho mejor. 
Ella decidió vivir con la madre, y dejar a un lado a este hombre que no solo le hacía daño a ella sino a el hijo, que lleno de amor a logrado superar todos estos traumas que este hombre dejo en estas dos personas llenas de vida y ganas de seguir adelante.  
Hoy están viviendo con los padres de Amanda,  tranquilos con mucho amor para brindarle a todo aquel que  se cruza en el camino. Ella quiere ser una gran contadora y el hermoso hijo por ahora un excelente bachiller.
texts.en: Her name is Amanda and her beautiful son, Brian. They had a beautiful home formed with Diego, a man who arrived in their lives some years before. Everything was wonderful until this man started to change and behave in a completely different way. The relationship with Amanda started to deteriorate; with this woman who all she did was work and keep a perfect home. After 8 years he had a car accident that left him in a wheelchair. For them it was a hard blow; nevertheless they stayed with a man who kept treating them very badly. One day Amanda got a call where she found out her mother was very sick in the hospital. She went to help her, but her husband did not support her in the way she was expecting. On the contrary, she found a completely different man: rude, arrogant, violent, humiliating, who treated her as an unworthy person. She decided to study a profession that would allow her to have a job and decided to be an accounting assistant. She found out about Kiva and decided to have the opportunity to belong to this agreement so that she would be paying less in her monthly tuition and could have more stability in her work. She decided to live with her mother and leave the man, who was hurting both her and her son, who thanks to be so loved has been able to overcome the trauma that this man left in these two lively and enterprising people. Today they are living with Amanda's parents, peacefully and full of love to share with the people they meet. She wants to be a good accountant and her beautiful son, for now, an excellent high school student.

loans.use: To pay a semester's tuition

loans.name: Ana Lilia

texts.en: Ana Lilia lives in Totolapan, Morales with her husband Edgar and their young son Axel. Although young, Ana Lilia knows that hard work is the only way to thrive. That is why as soon as she found out she was pregnant, she got a second job selling catalog shoes to her friends and neighbors in addition to her job as a maid in a private home. Edgar is also a true believer in hard work as he does double shifts as a farmer in a nearby field. They are ready and happy to make sacrifices to give to Axel a life with opportunities. Ana Lilia and Edgar have built their house little by little with the savings they have. They live in a one bedroom house with a kitchen and a living room. The thing that they want most is to have a bathroom in their house so they can live more comfortably. For the last three months they have been saving to finish building an additional room to their home as well as a complete bathroom. Ana Lilia needs this loan to finish paying for the construction materials. A new room and a bathroom will complete what they call their dream house. The family will receive supervision visits from certified technicians to monitor the quality and progress of the construction. The new construction will give this family the home they have been dreaming of for so long. Ana Lilia and Edgar are aware that dedication and hard work are what makes dreams come true.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a bathroom and an additional room

loans.name: Group (C)

texts.en:
Hari Maya belongs to Group (C) and is the featured profile member for the group. She and her son are pictured raising their hands.  The concerned and inspired mothers of six school-going kids joined hands and formed the group. They live in a village that is about 40 km from the main capital town of Manipur, which is also one of the northeastern states in India.
 
Hari Maya says that government sector schools in the town are defunct due to the negligence of the school teachers and although she has to pay double the fees, she sends her son to a good private school. She used to pay all the annual fees at the end of the year before the annual exam started and she was able to do that because the head of the school took their case under consideration and was very concerned about her son. Her son is bright and ambitious in achieving his goal. She raises cattle to generate an income and supports her husband who is also a farmer.  When sales went down and the family was short of money, she gave the school their cattle or their farm products in exchange for school fees or annual examination fees.

With the KIva education loan, she pays her son's admission fees, and buys sets of school uniforms, textbooks & stationary and tuition fees for a complete 12 months. She says, “Thank you so much Kiva and WSDS”. She says, “Now I don’t have to go to the head of the school and seek permission to let my son sit for the exam”  and she can let her son continue his schooling without worrying for the whole year. She will repay the loan on time and work together with her husband to generate a better income for the family to supplement their needs.

The other group members are also paying admission fees, school uniforms, text books & stationary and tuition fees for the year. They all are thankful and grateful for Kiva.

loans.use: To pay for study materials and other educational expenses for her son

loans.name: Ertilus

texts.en: Ertilus is the father of three children. He lives in a town called Mole Saint-Nicolas in the northwestern part of Haiti. He owns an auto parts shop in town, and he works for the Catholic church there as a driver. He wants to grow his business by selling Eneji Pwop products, specifically Powapak, Lanp Eneji Pwop and Sunking Pro. He also wants to help the community of Mole Saint-Nicolas since they have limited access to electricity. He is very excited that he can help Mole Saint-Nicolas that way.

loans.use: To buy a solar system from "Eneji Pwop" to resell in his auto parts shop.

loans.name: Andres

texts.en: Andres lives with his wife Roberta in Totolapan, Morelos. Andres has been working in the field growing all kind of crops like corn, tomato and cucumber. Andres and Roberta gave their old house to one of their kids and his family, so they are now building something smaller for the two of them. They have been building this house little by little. Today, they live in a one bedroom house with a living room and what will be a kitchen. Andres makes around $700 USD a month through informal jobs, so accessing credit is impossible for them. For the last three months they have been saving to finish building a proper roof and walls for the kitchen that will protect the stove that they bought after saving for quite some time. Andres needs this loan to finish paying for the construction materials. A proper roof and walls for the kitchen will protect their investment in the stove and will give the family a clean place where they can cook and eat. A new room will also give them a little more space to live in. Andres and Roberta will receive supervision visits from certified technicians to monitor the quality and progress of the construction. Anders wishes to give Roberta a small but complete house where they can grow old together.

loans.use: to buy materials to finish building a kitchen
