loans.name: David

texts.en: David and his wife Petra are excited to welcome their newborn son, Israel, to the family. Their older daughter, Jessica, is also excited because she knows that now that the family has grown, she and her brother will get a new room where they can sleep. David and Petra have lived in this one bedroom house since they got married. They have saved and made some additions and improvements, but they know that now more than ever they need more space to accommodate their growing family. David and Petra have been saving for the last three months to build a new bedroom, as well as expand the kitchen and finish the front porch. Together, the couple makes around $800 USD a month. Because David is a gardener and works in an informal job, he does not have access to credit from other organizations. David is requesting this loan to finish paying for the materials he needs for the home improvements. These improvements are a way for David and Petra to have a better chance at improving their quality of life. They will receive supervision visits from certified technicians to monitor the quality and progress of the construction. They will soon give their growing family the space they need.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a new room and finish the front porch

loans.name: Luz Olivia

texts.en: Luz Olivia and her husband Salvador live in Totolapan with their two young children. Luz Olivia makes a living through direct catalog cosmetics and Salvador works as a construction aide in nearby sites. Luz Olivia and her family live in a two room house, where one room is used as a bedroom and the other as the kitchen and living room. The family is growing fast, and they started to save so they could finish their bathroom and build an additional room for the kids. Erick is still a baby, but Edgar, the oldest, is very excited to have his own room and his own bed. Luz and Salvador make around $650 USD a month through informal jobs, so accessing credit is impossible for them. For the last three months Luz has been saving to build a proper bathroom and give her children more space. Luz needs this loan to finish paying for the construction materials. The family will receive supervision visits from certified technicians to monitor the quality and progress of the construction, and the new construction will give the whole family a more comfortable life. Luz and Salvador work hard to give their children the opportunity they didn't have to study, at least through middle school, and have a better life.

loans.use: to pay for materials to build a bathroom and a bedroom

loans.name: Abduvohid

texts.ru:
Абдувохид является сварщиком, проживающим в Б.Гафуровском районе города Худжанд. Он 43-летний женатый мужчина, имеет двух взрослых сыновей в возрасте 18 и 22 лет. Его жена домохозяйка, а сыновья работают вместе с Абдувохидом. 
Два года назад Абдувохид начал свою деятельность по производству железных дверей и решеток. Он сам изготавливает продукции, а его сыновья занимаются их покраской. Этой деятельностью Абдувохид в основном занимается у себя дома, но так как в зимний период у них дефицит электричества, он временно арендует помещение в цехе и работает там. Для расширения производства, Абдувохид нуждается в кредите. Он хочет приобрести модернизированный электронный сварочный аппарат и надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Abduvohid is a welder who lives in the city of Khujand in the B. Gafurov district. He is 43 years old and married, with two adult children, ages 18 and 22. Abduvohid's wife is a homemaker, and his sons work with him. 

Two years ago Abduvohid started his own business manufacturing iron doors and gratings. He makes the products himself, and his sons paint them. Abduvohid mostly runs his business out of his home. However, because there are electricity shortages in winter where he lives, he sometimes rents space at a manufacturing shop and works there.

Abduvohid is in need of a loan to expand his production. He wants to acquire a modern electric welder and is hoping for your support.

loans.use: to purchase an electric welding machine for manufacturing iron doors and windows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase plastering kits for his construction company

loans.name: Moises Serpas

texts.es:
Moises de 30 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, ya que sus padres vivian en una pobreza que les impedia darle esa ayuda sus hijos, sumando a esto que la escuela mas cercanas estaba a una distancia de aproximadamente cinco kilometros, lo que dificultaba mas la situacion. Ahora esta casado, no tiene hijos, su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar.

Moises a los 10 años de edad, ya trabajaba junto con su padre en la siembra de maiz y frijol. Asi fue como aprendio este oficio. Ya a los 14 años de edad, sembraba solo su propia terreno de maiz y frijol. Desde entonces se a dedicado a trabajar en la agricultura, ademas trabaja como jornalero en una finca cafetalera de 6:00 A.M a 11:00 A.M. El lugar donde cultiva esta a una distancia de 2.5 kilometros y el recorrido lo hace montando en su yegua todos los dias. Su esposa tambien le ayuda a realizar las labores agricolas de todo el proceso de produccion.

El prestamo sera utilizado para comprar ganado de repasto, el cual es engordado en todo el transcurso del año, para finalmente venderlo y generar ingresos para su familia, de esta forma ayuda a que los ingresos no dependa solo de la agricultura. 

Moises tiene el sueño de poder vivir en algun tiempo en lo propio, y a la vez tener su casa, para el momento en que lleguen sus hijos y crear su familia, y poder tener las condiciones adecuadas para que no les falte nada. Ademas les gustaria tener una vaca lechera y poder  tener mas animales. Pero es necesario que siga esforzandose mucho mas para conseguir estos sueños, y con la ayuda del creditos hace un poco mas facil su sueño.
texts.en: Moises, who is 30 years old, did not have the opportunity to study in school.  His parents were living in poverty that prevented them from being able to help their children in this aspect.  To make matters worse, the closest school was approximately 5 kilometers away, which made the situation more difficult.  Now Moises is married.  He does not have children.  His wife dedicates her time to taking care of the house and domestic responsibilities.  At 10 years old, Moises was already working at his father's side in the cultivation of corn and beans.  That was how he came to learn this trade.  At 14 years old, he was already developing his own plot of corn and bean crops.  Since then, he was dedicated to working in agriculture.  Also, he works as a laborer on a coffee plantation from 6:00am to 11:00am.  The place where he grows his crops is 2.5 kilometers away and he makes the trip by horse each day.  His wife also helps him with his agricultural work involved in the process of production.  The loan will be used to buy livestock for pasture, which is developed throughout the course of the year in order to finally sell it and generate income for his family.  As such, this will help so that their income is not solely dependent on agriculture.  Moises dreams of being able to live in the present, of having his own house, for when the time comes where he has his own children and builds his family, and being in the right circumstances so that they are never lacking anything.  Also, he would like to have a dairy cow and more animals.  It is important that Moises continue putting in all his effort in order to achieve these dreams.  With the help of these loans, accomplishing his goals and dreams is a little more within reach.

loans.use: to buy more pasture cattle.

loans.name: Heriberta

texts.en: Heriberta lives in Totolapan with her husband Armando and their 3 children. They have been living in a two bedroom house for almost 35 years. Their children have grown and played in this house but, as they grow older, it is starting to feel smaller. Heriberta and Armando started building a bathroom so the family could have a proper space. Heriberta also wants to build a bedroom for her daughter Maritza, who is turning 21, as sleeping in the same room as her brothers has started to make her uncomfortable. Heriberta makes around $400 USD a month through direct catalog sales. She and her husband have no access to credit given she has no formal job and her income is low and variable. She has been saving for the last three months to build a new bedroom for Maritza and a bathroom for the family. She is now asking for this loan to pay for materials needed. The family will receive supervision visits from certified technicians to monitor the quality and progress of the construction. The new room will give the children their own space, and the bathroom will provide a healthier life and more privacy for the family. Heriberta is aware that her kids are growing up and need their own space, and she wants to make sure they all stay together and have a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy materials to finish building the bathroom and a new room

loans.name: Berny

texts.en:
This is Berny, 38, resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is single and she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.
 
Berny offers massage services. She offers different kinds of whole body massages. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week. To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy supplies for her business.

Berny hopes to have more customers and dreams to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
Jose de 70 años de edad  por la situacion económicos no tuvo más que estudiar hasta primer  grado, era el mayor de una familia de tres hermanos, y tenía que ayudarle a sus padres a trabajar ya que sus familia era muy pobre. Está separado porque en su juventud tenia el problemas con el alcohol y devido a eso se desimtegro de su famila, vive solo pagando ese error.

Jose actualmente se dedica a sembrar maíz y frijol desempeña este trabajo desde que era niño, ya que su padre le enseñó este trabajo, pues en aquel tiempo no tenían otra forma de sobrevivir mas que la agricultura, además de trabajar en la agricultura, renta  14000 metros cuadrado de tierra las cuales ha comprado con su esfuerzo pero devido a su avanzada edad no puede trabajar mucho, se levanta desde las 4:00 AM y tiene que trasladarse al campo donde tiene la milpa, hace un recorrido de unos 2 kilómetros a pie, hora de salida no tiene pues hasta que termina de hacer lo que tiene programado, regresa a su casa y  empieza a hacer los que haceres de la casa ya que vive solo.  

El utilizará el dinero del préstamo para sembrar 7000 metros cuadrado de maíz, ya que en esta fecha empiezan a movilizarse para trabajar en este año.Por el momento tiene 5 sacos de frijol los cuales no los ha vendido por que esta muy barato y esta esperando a que suba el precio. 

Jose en el futuro tiene la visión de tener una mejor casa de la que ahora tiene, poder hacer un muro alrededor de su casa ya que la delincuencia esta muy dura por donde el vive poder tener los fondos necesarios para poner algunos empleados y seguir trabajando en la agricultura, está seguro que el crédito es un compromiso pero también sabe que solo así puede lograr sus sueños, y poder obtendrá una mejor situación económica y una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en:
Jose is 70 years old. Because of his economic situation he didn't study past Grade 1. He was the oldest of 3 siblings and had to help his parents work as his family was very poor.  He is separated because in his youth he had problems with alcohol and due to this his family fell apart. He lives alone paying for this error.

Jose today grows corn and beans. He has done this work since he was a child. His father taught him as at that time there was no other way to survive outside of agriculture. He rents 14,000 square meters of land which he has bought with his efforts. But at his age he can't work much. He gets up at 4 am and has to walk to his land where he grows his corn, 2 kilometers by foot. He has no set closing time as he stays until he has done what he had planned. He then goes home and does the housework as he lives alone. 

Jose will use the money from the loan to plant 7000 square meters of corn as this is the time to get things started for the year. Right now he has five sacks of beans that he has not sold as the prices are too low and he is waiting for the prices to climb. 

Jose in the future has the idea of having a better house than what he now has. He would like to build a wall around his house as crime is high in the area where he lives. He would like to have the money to hire a couple of employees so he can continue to work in agriculture. He knows that the loan is an obligation but he also knows that this is the only way to achieve his dreams and improve his financial situation and have a better living standard.

loans.use: to plant 7000 square meters of corn.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia previously accessed an 30,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase recyclable materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan. She will be incorporating the loan on her current revolving fund used to buy scrap and recyclable materials. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lilia dreams to be more successful in business and hopes that her family will have a good future. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for scrap and recyclable materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Remelita

texts.en:
Remelita is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more merchandise products for her direct selling business. Her loan helped not just in her business but also in the education of her children. Her income from business is assisting her family's everyday expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their needs.
 
She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from this business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Remelita hopes to have more customers and dreams that her children will finish their education. She hopes that her business will continue to grow and expand. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. She also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Vilma Idalia

texts.es:
Vilma es una joven de 23 años de edad, que estudio hasta bachillerato secretariado, es casada su esposo se dedica a los trabajos de carpintería que tienen en su vivienda,  actualmente ellos no tienen hijos, viven en la casa de su mamá junto a una hermana más  y que son las únicas personas que dependen de ellos.


Vilma, actualmente se dedica a los oficios domésticos en su hogar, se siente orgullosa de desempeñar esta actividad  en su familia y también ella siempre recibe el apoyo de su esposo en los trabajos que ella desarrolla. Mientras su esposo sale al trabajo.

El préstamo lo utilizará, para comprar útiles y uniformes escolares de su hermana, que ya pronto inicio a estudiar en la escuela. El préstamo le ayudara a satisfacer una necesidad de ayudar a su hermana, para que siga estudiando y se pueda superar y en un futuro le pueda ayudar económicamente a su familia.

Vilma desea seguir estudiando en la universidad, sacar una  carrera universitaria, tener su propia casa con su esposo aparte de su familia y tener sus propios hijos y que sus hijos sean personas de bien que estudien mucho para que sean buenas personas en la sociedad.
texts.en:
Vilma is a 23 year old woman who has completed her secondary studies in a secretary program. She is married. Her husband works as a carpenter from a shop they have in their home. They have no children. They live in the house of her mother together with another sister who is dependent on them. Vilma works doing the housework in their home. She is proud to do this for her family and her husband always helps her with these duties when he isn't off to work. 

She will use the loan to buy school materials and  a school uniform for her sister as she will soon start school. The loan will help to satisfy the need to help her sister to continue studying and get ahead. In the future her sister can help the family financially. 

Vilma wants to continue to study at university, get a degree and have her own house with her husband, separate from the rest of her family. She wants to have her own children and that her children become good people who study a lot in order to become useful parts of society.

loans.use: to buy a school uniform and materials for her sister.

loans.name: Batchimeg

texts.en:
Mrs. Batchimeg is 25 years old and lives with her husband and son in Kherlen, the easternmost town of Mongolia. She has been working as a bank teller since 2009. Her husband is a full time employee who assists in the day-to-day work at a private firm.

She is requesting a loan of 800,000 MNT to buy a television. Watching holiday programs on a new television will greatly enhance the amusement of White Moon, a national holiday.

loans.use: to buy a television.

loans.name: Jelly

texts.en:
Jelly is a 63-year-old resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is a widow with children. She and her children manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Jelly operates a variety store, which is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP-5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by obtaining supplies at wholesale prices and then selling them by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Jelly dreams that her business will continue to flourish and she hopes to have a good future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. Here she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, toiletries, and beverages.

loans.name: Pasac Group

texts.es:
Lucía (segunda de derecha a izquierda en la  fotografía) es una señora de 41 años de edad, casada, tiene tres hijos, vive junto a ellos en Nahualá, Sololá.
Ella se dedica a la producción y venta de banano, lo cual lo realiza en la comunidad donde vive; esta actividad la aprendió de su familia, quienes se dedican a lo mismo desde muchos años atrás. Esta labor le generan a ella los ingresos necesarios que le permiten darle lo necesario a sus hijos. Ella comenta que le gusta esta actividad porque es honesta y la ayuda a sentirse útil a su comunidad. Tiene más de 10 años de experiencia en esta actividad.
Ella decidió organizar un grupo con el objetivo de ayudarse mutuamente con su compañeras y asi mejorar sus niveles de vida. Utilizará el préstamo para la compra de insumos (fertilizante y pago de mano de obra) para mantenimiento de las  plantaciones de banano.
Lucía sueña con incrementar la extensión de sus plantaciones de banano y asi incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Lucía (second from the right in the photograph), is a married lady who is 41 years old. She has three children who live with her in Nahualá, Sololá. 

Her work is the production and sale of bananas, which she carries out in the community where she lives. She learned this occupation from her family, who has been engaged in it for many years. 

With this work, she generates the income that is necessary to provide for the needs of her children. She says that she likes this occupation because it is honest; and it helps her to feel useful to her community. She has more than 10 years’ experience in this occupation.

She decided to organize a group with her friends for the purpose of mutual support, in order to improve their standard of living.
 
She will use the loan for the purchase of supplies such as fertilizer, and for the payment of workers, in order to maintain the banana plants.

Lucía dreams of increasing the area where she cultivates her banana plants, and thus increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as fertilizer, and to pay workers, in order to maintain the banana plants.

loans.name: Gulsevar

texts.ru: Гулсеваре 21 года. Она замужем. Ее муж находиться в Российской Федерации на заработках. Она с ребенком живет на юго-западной части Таджикистана на районе Шахритус. Шахритус славится своим приятным климатом и неповторимой природой. Такой климат прекрасно способствует для деятельностей животноводства и растениеводства, но Гулсевара не стала заниматься сельскохозяйственной деятельности и работает в сфере торговли. Гулсевар занимается торговлей одежды на рынке. Она занимается торговлей около 8 лет. Сейчас она решила расширить свою деятельность и привести больше товара. Но для нового товара у нее не хватает денег, и она решила обратиться за кредитом. Помогите ей.
texts.en: Gulsevar is 21 years old and married.  Her husband is currently working in Russia.  She lives with her child in the Shahrituz district of Tajikistan, located in the southwestern part of the country.  The Shahrituz region is famous for its unique wildlife and mild climate, which is particularly conducive to such activities as animal husbandry and crop farming.  Gulsevar, however, chose to work in retail.  She sells clothes as a market vendor and has been involved in this activity for almost eight years.  At the moment, she would like to expand her activity and bring in more merchandise.  But to do so, she needs money, and this is why she is taking a loan.  Thank you for your help.

loans.use: to buy new merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Nubis

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar con Crédito a Nubis, para aumentar los ingresos de su negocio. Con su credikiva logró tener sus estantes con mucho inventario de mercancia variada y por esto aumentó sus ventas. Nubis se encuentra feliz porque su casa hoy es propia y su negocio está creciendo. En la actualidad está aplicando a un crédito mediante el cual, comprará merancia ajustada a la temporada , como utiles escolares y articulos educativos, ella espera tener éxito, pues cada compra la hace en el marco de las exigencias de cada época. Nubis envia el siguiente mensaje a los finaciadores de Kiva: " Gracias por darme la oportunidad de crecer en mi negocio, gracias a esto mis hijas han salido adelante y solamente son gracias para ustedes.
texts.en: Thank you for supporting Nubis with a loan to increase the income from her business. With the Kiva loan, she was able to have shelves with more inventory of a variety of merchandise, and because of this she increased her sales. Nubis is happy because her house is now her own and her business is growing. Now she is applying for a loan through with she will buy merchandise appropriate for the season, such as school supplies and educational articles. She expects to have success, since each purchase supplies her with the needs of each season. Nubis sends the following message to the Kiva lenders: "Thank you for giving me the opportunity to grow in my business. Thanks to this, my daughters have made progress, and it is only thanks to you."

loans.use: to stock her store for the coming season.

loans.name: José Jaime

texts.es:
José de 58 años de edad por sus escazos recursos económicos no pudo estudiar mas que hasta tercer grado, era el mayor de los cinco hermanos y tenía que ayudarle a sus padres a trabajar, ya que sus familia era muy pobre. Está separado de su esposa por que le fue infiel vive solo ya que sus hijos ya son mayores todos  casados.


José actualmente se dedica a sembrar maíz y maizillo se dedica desde que era niño ya que su padre le enseñó este trabajo, pues en aquel tiempo no tenían otra forma de sobrevivir mas que la agricultura.  Él trabaja 56,000 metros cuadrados de tierra las cuales se las dejo su padre al fallecer, se levanta desde las 4:00 AM y tiene que trasladarse al campo donde tiene la milpa, hace un recorrido de unos 3 kilómetros a pie, hora de salida no tiene pues hasta que termina de hacer lo que tiene programado en ese día regresa a su casa y  empieza a hacer los que haceres de la casa ya que vive solo.  


Él invertira el dinero del préstamo para sembrar  7000 metros cuadrados de maíz, y  para pagar algunas deudas, ya por el momento tiene 35 sacos de maiz los cuales no a podido venderlos por que esta muy barato y esta esperando a que suba el precio. 

José piensa mejorar su casa en un futuro de la que ahora tiene, y poder tener un camion para trasladar el maiz  y asi no tener que pagar por el traslado, poder trabajar mas cantida de terreno trabaja, está seguro que el crédito es un compromiso, pero también sabe que solo así puede lograr sus sueños, será un mayor esfuerzo pero con la ayuda de Dios  obtendrá una mejor situación económica.
texts.en:
José is 58 years old. Because of scarce economic resources, he could not study past the third grade. He was the oldest of five siblings and had to help his parents work because his family was very poor. He is separated from his wife because of infidelity, and lives alone because his children are all grown up and married.

José currently plants corn and sorghum. He has had this job since his father taught him as a child; at that time they had no way to survive other than farming. He works 56,000 square meters of land which his father left him after his death. He wakes up at 4:00am and makes the 3-mile journey on foot to the corn field. He does not have a departure time for until he finishes doing what he has scheduled that day, he returns home and starts doing the household chores since he lives alone.

He will invest the money from the loan to plant 7,000 square meters of corn and pay off some debts. Currently he has 35 bags of corn which he has not been able to sell because the price is very low and he is waiting for it to go up.

José plans to improve his current home in the future, have a truck so he won't have to pay for transporting corn, and do more field work. He is sure that the loan is a commitment, but he also knows that it is the only way he can achieve his dreams. It will be a major effort, but with God's help, he will have a better economic situation.

loans.use: to plant 7,000 square meters of corn and to pay off some debts.

loans.name: Jordi Christian

texts.en: Jordi is a young man of 20 years. He works as a farmer in the neighboring fields and makes a living harvesting for other farmers. Jordi is an only child and feels very grateful to his parents that have worked their whole life to give him what they can. Jordi believes it is his responsibility to contribute to the needs of the house and so has been saving for the last months to build a complete bathroom in the house since they've never had one. Jordi is requesting this loan to pay for the materials needed for construction. Jordi has no access to credit with other organizations because he has an informal job that does not pay much and his cash flows are irregular. He will build this addition to their home, and will receive supervision visits from certified technicians to monitor the quality and progress of the construction. The new, closed bathroom will give their parents some privacy and a better life. He sees this as the most appropriate way to give thanks to what his parents have given him during all these years and contribute with his work and savings to the house.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a bathroom

loans.name: Komron

texts.ru: Комрону 18 лет. Он студент 1 курса Таджикского Государственного Университета Политики и Бизнеса по специальности Бухгалтер и аудит. Он очень трудолюбивый и успешный студент. В свободное время он увлекается спортом и компьютерными играми. Его отец и мать занимаются скотоводством. Доход его родителей не позволяет оплатить за его учебу в университете. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебы. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Komron is 18 years old.  He is a 1st year student of the Tajikistan State Politics and Business University majoring in accounting and audit.  He is a very hardworking and successful student.  He is enjoys sports and computer games in his free time.  His father and mother are involved in animal husbandry.  His parents' income does not allow to pay for his studies in the university.  He is requesting this loan to pay for his tuition.  He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.ru: Мавчуда 40-летняя замужняя женщина родом из района Бохтар. Она мать троих сыновей. Ее муж в настоящее время вдали от семьи на заработках. Мавчуда как все сельские женщины занимается растениеводством и животноводством. Она занимается этим на протяжении 5 лет. Мавчуда обратилась за кредитом, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота, поскольку в ее скотном дворе осталось всего две коровы. Она в основном занимается выращиванием молочной и мясной породы коров. Этот кредит Мавчуде очень важен для развития ее бизнеса животноводства.
texts.en: Mavjuda is a 40 year-old woman from the Bohtar district.  She is a mother of three sons.  Her husband is presently away from the family for work.  Mavjuda, just like all country women, is involved in agriculture and animal husbandry.  She has been involved in animal husbandry for 5 years.  Mavjuda requested this loan to increase livestock headcount because she only has two cows left in her livestock yard.  She primarily raises dairy and beef breeds of cattle.  This loan is very important for Mavjuda for developing her animal husbandry business.

loans.use: to buy cattle in order to develop her business and increase livestock headcount

loans.name: Burul

texts.ru: Бурул 49 лет, вдова, после смерти супруга одна воспитывает 3 детей, старший из них - студент, остальные двое-школьники. У Бурул - высшее образование, работает в сельском управлении, в качестве управляющей, но зарплаты не хватает на обеспечение всей семьи всем необходимым и  в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Бурул занимается животноводством, стартовав 22 года назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Бурул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь, 14 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 17,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Бурул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку лошади для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Бурул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en: Burul is 49 years old, a widow and raising 3 children, the oldest of whom is a college student and the rest are school students, alone after her husband's death. Burul has a higher education and works a supervisor at the village government, but the salary is not enough to provide the whole family with all of the necessities. To provide a secondary income for her family, Burul is involved in animal husbandry, having started 22 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, today her business contains 4 dairy cows, 1 horse and 14 sheep. The monthly income amounts to 17,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Burul requested a loan from the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy a horse in order to increase livestock headcount. Burul plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities and saving money for her children's future education.

loans.use: to buy a horse

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en: Silvia lives with her husband and one of their sons. Silvia works selling cosmetics and shoes through direct catalog shopping. She supports the family with her income and feels proud about it. Enrique has worked all his life as a farmer in the neighboring fields. However, with his age and his health condition, he has been forced to reduce his working hours and this is why Silvia stepped up to support the family. Silvia is grateful to Enrique for all the years of hard work and now wants to show him her appreciation by building a closed kitchen to their house. The house they live in is the result of hard work and saving for more than 10 years. Given that her work and that of her husband is not a formal job and they have no way of proving income, they do not have access to credit from other institutions. Silvia has been saving for the last three months to build the kitchen. She now needs this loan to finish paying for the construction materials and complete a dream house she and Enrique can grow old in. They will receive supervision visits from certified technicians to monitor the quality and progress of the construction, and the new construction will give the whole family a more comfortable life. Silvia is excited to contribute with something like this that will change their lives thanks to her hard work and effort.

loans.use: to finish building her kitchen and living room

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda and her husband Juan Antonio live in Totolapan, Morelos. They bought this piece of land almost 20 years ago and have been building their house little by little. They have not yet been able to complete it because they did not realize that a two story house would be much more expensive than a single story house. They also have been making some investments to their tortilla business along with their major business partner to make it bigger and more profitable. Rosalinda and Juan Antonio have two teenage daughters. They currently live in two of the finished rooms of the house but wish to complete the construction so they can have more space and the girls can have their old bedroom. The idea is to have the tortilla business in the front room of the bottom floor and the rest of the house to live in. Rosalinda and Juan Antonio make around $1,000 USD a month. Given that their business is an informal one  and that they do not have a steady income, they do not have access to credit from other institutions. Rosalinda has been saving for the last three months to complete the bathroom and 2 rooms of the house. Rosalinda needs this loan to finish paying for the construction materials. She and her husband will receive supervision visits from certified technicians to monitor the quality and progress of the construction. This new addition will give everyone in the family the space they need, and as a result will make it easier for her daughters. Rosalinda is also excited to move the business to this new location that will attract more costumers. Rosalinda and Juan Antonio are aware that dedication and hard work is what will give their family a better life.

loans.use: to finish building her house

loans.name: Harry's Group

texts.fr:
Le Banc villageois est créé le 20 Mai 2003 à l'occasion de son inauguration. Ce groupement a un long parcours dans le système et compte en son sein des femmes très dynamiques. Elles  vivent  toutes dans le même quartier et partage des liens forts de solidarité et d’entre aide.  C’est dans cette lancé qu’elles viennent d’entamer leur vingt énième  cycle dans le programme. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce, la transformation de produits agricoles et l’aviculture. 

Madame Harry (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée),  est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe, c’est aussi la présidente du groupement. Veuve de son état, elle prend en charge 07 de ses enfants 4 garçons et 03 filles. Elle s’active dans l’aviculture, pour ce faire elle est aidée par ses garçons dans la gestion du poulailler. La vente de sujet est faite après au moins 45 jours d’élevage.

Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 200 sujets à 150 000 F CFA, de l’aliment pour 80 000 F CFA, pour la revente à maturation 3 500 F CFA le sujet.

 Avec des bénéfices, elle compte améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille : soins de santé, suivi scolaire et habillement.
texts.en:
The "banc villageois" was inaugurated on 20 May 2003, and this group of very dynamic women has a long history of working with the organisation.  The women all live in the same neighbourhood and are strongly linked by their history of mutual help.  This will be their twentieth group loan.  The group members are all small traders, agricultural product processors or raise poultry.

Harry (sitting on the far right of the photo, with her hand raised) is the main client and president of this group.  She is a widow, and is responsible for seven of her children, four boys and three girls.  She raises poultry, and is helped in her work by her sons.  The birds are sold when they are forty-five days old.  

Harry will use her loan to buy 200 birds for 150,000 francs CFA and poultry feed for 80,000 francs CFA.  She will then sell the mature birds for 3,500 francs CFA each.  With her earnings she will be able to improve the living conditions of her family and provide for their health, school and clothing costs.

loans.use: to buy 200 birds for 150,000 francs CFA and poultry feed for 80 000 francs CFA.

loans.name: Maimouna's Group

texts.fr:
Le Banc villageois est créé le 20 Mai 2003 à l'occasion de son inauguration. Ce groupement a un long parcours dans le système et compte en son sein des femmes très dynamiques. Elles  vivent  toutes dans le même quartier et partage des liens forts de solidarité et d’entre aide.  C’est dans cette lancé qu’elles viennent d’entamer leur vingt énième  cycle dans le programme. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce, la transformation de produits agricoles et l’aviculture. 

Madame Maïmouna  (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. C’est une femme très dynamique et participe de manière très active aux activités du groupement. Elle est  mariée  et mère de 03 enfants dont 01 fille et 02  garçons. Elle est vendeuse de pâte d’arachide, qu’elle achète auprès de femmes productrices pour la revente dans les autres régions du pays principalement au centre et dans la capitale. 

Son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter une vingtaine de seaux de 20 kg à 8 500 F CFA l’unité pour la revente au moins à 14 000 F CFA.

 Les bénéfices, elle les utilisera pour assister son mari dans les charges concernant la dépense quotidienne, le suivi scolaire des enfants et le reste pour accroître son épargne.
texts.en:
The "banc villageois" was inaugurated on 20 May 2003, and this group of very dynamic women has a long history of working with the organisation.  The women all live in the same neighbourhood and are closely linked due to their mutual support for one another.  This will be the group's twentieth loan with the field partner.  The women are all small traders, agricultural product processors or raise poultry.

Maïmouna (sitting on the far right of the photo, with her hand raised) is the main client of the group.  She is a very dynamic woman who works closely with all the activities of the group.  She is married and has three children, one girl and two boys.  She sells peanut paste, which she buys from women producers, and sells in various other regions of the country, especially the centre and the capital city.  

Maïmouna will use this loan to buy around twenty, 20kg buckets of peanut paste for 8,500 francs CFA each.  She will resell them for at least 14,000 francs CFA each.  Her earnings will be used to help her husband with the day-to-day expenses of their family, pay for the schooling of their children and increase their savings.

loans.use: to buy 20, 20kg buckets of peanut paste for resale.

loans.name: Enkhchimeg

texts.en: Mrs. Enkhchimeg, 25 years old, lives with her husband and daughter in Kherlen, the easternmost town in Mongolia. She and her husband have been working as engineers at a power station since 2009. The house they live in has deteriorated over the years, so she is requesting a loan of 1,600,000 MNT to buy building and insulation materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam to renovate her house. After renovation, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and fewer pollutants are released.

loans.use: to renovate her house

loans.name: Rustam

texts.en:
Rustam is a freshman in the Journalism and Mass Communications program and this is his story:

Last year I studied the preparatory “New Generation Academy” program at AUCA. I had heard a lot of nice feedback about this University and last year I had a chance to check it out myself. I loved the way of teaching, being involved in the abundance of different competitions and concerts, the international atmosphere among the students and staff, the modern lab and cafeterias. My goal is to extent last year for four more years and get a BA degree at AUCA.

One of the people who influenced me while choosing my future University is my cousin. She successfully graduated from AUCA and now she works in an elite company. She mastered two foreign languages, met a lot of international friends and went to many countries on different continents. Her achievements and my assurance give me hope to realize my dream.

I already have part-time work but it is not enough to cover the whole sum of my tuition. I hope to get a Kiva loan and study at one of the best and the most respectable universities in Central Asia.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees

loans.name: Semen

texts.en:
Semen is a freshman in the Software Engineering program at AUCA and this is his story:

The field of study that I chose is Software Engineering. This profession really suits my personality, abilities and goals. I am really interested in the Information Technologies area. I know programs such as Delphi (Turbo Pascal), FL Studio, 3Ds Max, am familiar with the computer language С++ and so forth. I often create cartoons in Flash animation program. Lately, I have been busy making a short film in Adobe After Effects. I have good cognition skills and a test on the internet showed that my IQ is 145.

One of my goals is to secure my knowledge and to fill in the knowledge gaps missed in computer technologies. Besides becoming a good specialist in this field, I could raise the level of animators and cinematographs in Kyrgyzstan. This would enrich the country and move it towards development and improvement. As many talented people will be in Kyrgyzstan, how much better and attractive it would be for other countries, which might lead to development.

I really want to enter American University of Central Asia because this is the only University in our country I have been dreaming of almost my whole life. The reason for that is that this University includes the best and most proficient teachers who provide the necessary information and knowledge, which leads any graduate towards his/her goals and helps them to achieve it and improve the surroundings. Not the least important fact is that the whole university is like a huge family, where everyone cares about each other. I suppose that it is absolutely not easy to study at AUCA, but I am ready to step on the first rung of a ladder of education and move higher, improve my skills, get new ones and participate in American University's life.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees at the university

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en:
Sumaira is a 31-year-old lady who is living with her spouse, two daughters and a son in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband is a turner by profession and manufactures spare parts for vehicles. He has been operating a lathe machine for many years and can easily renew or manufacture spare parts for various vehicles. His lathe machine is out of order and some of his tools have worn out and need to be replaced due to continuous use. He has spent all of his savings to buy cast iron to manufacture spare parts and does not have money to fix the lathe machine.

Therefore, Sumaira requested a loan for her husband so that he can repair the lathe machine. She is relaxed now because she hopes that her husband can easily operate his lathe machine again. She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair a lathe machine and to buy new tools.

loans.name: Shumkar

texts.en:
Shumkar is a freshman in the Sociology Program at AUCA and this is his story:

Not everyone understands why I want to be a sociologist and why I am interested in it. Sociology addresses the most challenging issues of our time. It is a rapidly expanding field whose potential is increasingly tapped by those who craft policies and create programs. Sociologists understand social inequality, patterns of behavior, forces for social change and resistance, and the workings of social systems. It is an exciting discipline with expanding opportunities for a wide range of career paths. Some examples are magazine editor, contract and grants administrator, attorney, personnel manager, probation officer, career counselor, marketing director, and political consultant.

Therefore, I have chosen to study sociology at AUCA. As I am also interested in business, I want to learn how business works through the study of organizations, economic processes, human relations and institutions. AUCA sociology courses cover a wide range of material, and teach analytical skills and flexibility of mind to allow you to see your world in new ways. By itself, it is a broad major for the intellectually curious, and works well as a double major with other narrower degree programs.

Thanks to a Kiva loan, I will be able to get such an education in AUCA and I really hope for the loan.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees

loans.name: Chantal

texts.fr: Chantal est une femme de 47 ans mariée, mère de famille. Elle commerçante et vend du poissons à la braise en soirée et des beignets en matinée depuis 11 ans dans un quartier de la capitale.Son savoir faire dans ce domaine et les prix pratiqués lui ont permis d'acquerir et fidéliser une clientèle qui s'accroît au jour le jour.Ce qui l'amène à vouloir ce crédit parce que son capital ne lui permet plus de satisfaire pleinement sa clientèle.Grâce à lui,elle pourra augmenter son stock en achetant (2 sacs de farine, 2 palettes de poisson, un bidon d'huile et le bois de chauffage) .Les bénéfices que lui apportera ce crédit seront en partie reinvesti dans son activité et le reste sera économisé pour la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Chantal, age 47, is married and the mother of a family. She's a merchant who's been selling grilled fish in the evening and doughnuts in the morning in a neighborhood of the capital for the last 11 years.

Her know-how in this field and her pricing strategy enabled her to gain a loyal clientele, which is growing every day. This brings her to seek this loan because her working capital doesn't allow her to fully satisfy her customers.

Thanks to this loan, she will be able to bolster her stock by buying 2 sacks of flour, 2 trays of fish, 1 can of oil, and firewood. The profits generated thanks to this loan will be in part reinvested in her business, and in part saved for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of flour, 2 trays of fish, 1 can of oil, and firewood

loans.name: Rose Nyambod

texts.fr: Rose est une femme de 38 ans mariée, mère de 3 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 7 et 11 ans. Tous vont encore à l'école Elle commerçante et vend d des beignets en matinée depuis 04 ans dans un quartier de la capitale. Son savoir faire dans ce domaine et les prix pratiqués lui ont permis d’acquérir et fidéliser une clientèle qui s'accroît au jour le jour. Ce qui l'amène à vouloir ce crédit parce que son capital ne lui permet plus de satisfaire pleinement sa clientèle. Grâce à lui,elle pourra augmenter son stock en achetant ( 1 sac de farine, un bidon d'huile de 20 litres et quelques ingrédients) .Les bénéfices que lui apportera ce crédit seront en partie réinvesti dans son activité et le reste sera économisé pour la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Rose, age 28, is married and the mother of three children, whose ages range from 7 to 10 years old. They all go to school. Rose is a merchant who's been selling doughnuts in the morning in a neighborhood of the capital for the last four years.

Her know-how in this field and her pricing strategy enabled her to gain a loyal clientele which is growing every day. This brings her to seek this loan because her capital doesn't allow her to fully satisfy her clientele.

Thanks to this loan, she will be able to increase her stock by buying 1 sack of flour, 1 20-liter can of oil, and several ingredients. The profits that this loan will bring will be in part reinvested in her business, and in part saved for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy 1 bag of flour, 1 20-liter can of oil, and several ingredients

loans.name: Soungalo

texts.fr:
Mr SOUNGALO est né vers 1975 à SADIOLA cercle de KOUTIALA région de  Sikasso (3ème région administrative de la république du MALI. Il vit à  LOBOUGOULA avec ses deux femmes et quatre enfants.
Il mène les activités d’achat et de vente de céréales il y'a plus de six  ans en plus il fait la vente d’essence puis gère une boutique. Son expérience dans ce domaine, lui a valu une bonne réputation et reçoit des commandes de divers clients. Ainsi pour avoir les ressources nécessaires afin de satisfaire ces clients.Il décida de collaborer avec l’Institution de Micro Finance Soro Yiriwaso, il est à son cinquième prêt, les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.  
Ce prêt lui permettra de faire l’achat d’environ 35 sacs de 50 kg de céréales. Il s’approvisionne à Lobougoula et N’kouroula  ainsi que dans les villages environnants tel que Lobougoula. 
 Les céréales achetés sont stockées dans son magasin à Lobougoula pendant une bonne période. Il les revend à Lobougoula au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 75 000 francs CFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer le prêt et son intérêt et investir le reste dans son activité. 
Il ambitionne construire un bâtiment (maison) à Sikasso.
texts.en:
Soungalo was born around 1975 in Sadiola, which lies in the area of Koutiala in the Sikasso region (the Republic of Mali's third administrative region). He lives in Lobougoula with his two wives and four children.

He has been buying and selling cereals for more than six years and he also sells gas and manages a shop. His experience in this field has earned him a good reputation and he gets orders from a variety of customers. Thus, in order to have the necessary resources to satisfy his customer demand, he decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, and he is now on his fifth loan. The previous loans were all repaid in full.

This loan will enable him to buy around 35 50kg sacks of cereals. He gets his supplies in Lobougoula and N'Kouroula, as well as in surrounding villages. 

The cereals he buys are stocked in his shop in Lobougoula for a good while. He resells them in Lobougoula for cash and on credit to a customer base made up of men and women. He expects to make an average monthly profit of 75,000 FCFA, which will allow him to repay the loan and the interest on it; the rest will be invested in his business.

His ambition is to construct a building (house) in Sikasso.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Renacer De Ipal Group

texts.es:
La socia Salome pertenece al banco comunal RENACIENTES DE IPAL, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Vilcabamba, provincia de La Convencion, departamento de Cusco.
La socia tiene 80 años de edad es viuda, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la agricultura, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia vende su mercadería a sus clientes que le solictan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma salir adelante.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para su chacra.
Los demás socios se dedican a la  venta de verduras, alimentos y bebidas, servicios agropecuarios, cultivo de frutas y verduras, crianza de animales menores.
La socia que sale en la foto adjunta pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por  motivos de trabajo.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Salome belongs to the communal bank RENACIENTES DE IPAL, which is located in the district of Vilcamba, province of La Convencion, department of Cusco.

She is 80 years old, a widow, and alternates her daily activities with her work in agriculture.  She has been in business for years and things have gone well for her because of the hard work she does.  Salome is responsible and persevering, and sells her goods to customers who request it.  Her aim is to continue working to get ahead.

The borrower is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers for her cropland.

The other members are invoved in sales of vegetables, food and drink;  agricultural services; fruit and vegetable cultivation; and raising small animals.

The member shown in the small photograph asked for permission to arrive late at the meeting because of work.

Salome is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her cropland.

loans.name: La Main Dans La Main Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kamanda est une  brave commerçante, vice-présidente et membre d’un collectif d’affaires « La main dans la main », entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 32 ans, veuve et mère de 3 enfants qui tous étudient. La cliente est une vendeuse d’habits (femmes et enfants) et sociétaire d’un magasin. Elle installe ses marchandises dans un magasin dans le centre ville. Elle commença ses affaires avec l’assistance de sa grande sœur après la mort de son mari. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 4 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 20 pièces d’habits femmes et 30 pièces pour enfants.  Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite accroitre son crédit, scolariser, et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des hommes et femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant ce moment critique post conflits à l’Est du pays.
texts.en: The customer, Kamanda, is a courageous trader, as well as being vice-president and member of "La main dans la main" ("Hand in Hand") business group. She is a dynamic entrepreneur who is 32 years old, a widow and mother to three children, who are all at school. The customer sells clothes (for women and children) and is a member/shareholder of a shop. She lays out her goods in the shop which is in the centre of town. She began her business with the help of her big sister after her husband's death. Later on, she got a loan from IMF Hekima. She has been carrying out this business for four years. This new loan will be used to buy 20 pieces of clothing for women and 30 for children. In the future she would like to increase her loan, and be able to educate and feed her children. Finally, she is extremely thankful to Hekima for rendering autonomous male and female entrepreneurs who do not have access to banks, particularly during this critical time after the conflicts in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy 20 pieces of women's clothing and 30 pieces for children.

loans.name: Jerico Group

texts.fr: La cliente Ntumba est une commerçante depuis 13 ans et membre d’un collectif d’affaires « Jerico ». Senior entrepreneur, âgée de 36 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants, qui tous étudient. Elle est vendeuse souliers usagés. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter 80 paires de souliers. Son conjoint est un fonctionnaire de l’administration publique. Elle avait débuté avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite construire ne maison scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour avoir bien choisi sa cible, en apportant un soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs exclues du système bancaire classique, tout en leur accordant des crédits sans garantie matérielle, surtout, pendant, la période post conflit dans la région de l’Est Pays.
texts.en: The customer, Ntumba, has been a trader for the past 13 years and is a member of the Jerico business group. She is an experienced entrepreneur, who is 36 years old, married and mother to six children, all of whom are studying. She sells used shoes and is requesting a loan from Hekima to expand her business. She is going to buy 80 pairs of shoes. Her husband is a civil servant. She began her business with funds given to her by her husband. In the future she would like to build a house, as well as to educate and feed her children. She is extremely thankful to Hekima for having chosen its objective well, by supporting female entrepreneurs who do not have access to classic banks and granting loans without any material guarantee, particularly during this period after the conflict in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy 80 pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Sarankhuu

texts.en: Sarankhuu is 40 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as an accountant for eight years. Her husband makes glass products and supplies them to local markets. She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy fiberglass, foam, gypsum, cements and planks to renovate her apartment so that it will no longer lose heat through the windows and walls. Sarankhuu is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to renovate her family's apartment

loans.name: Samuel Antonio

texts.es:
Samuel se 25 años de edad, es un joven con gran iniciativa a la hora de realizar su trabajo, pudo estudiar segundo grado, al no tener los medios para seguir estudian, no le quedo otra opción que aprender un oficio del cual pudiera subsistir. Esta casado y su esposa realiza los quehaceres del hogar, ademas de tener crianza de gallina de traspatio y ayudarle en la tejera.

Él trabaja en una tejera, este es un negocio propio, tiene gran experiencia en la actividad, anteriormente se dedicaba a cultivar la tierra , pero al no ser tan rentable esta labor, decidió orientarse mas a la venta de teja. Su padre fue quien le enseño la técnica de elaboración y es el quien le ayuda en el proceso. El cantón donde vive Samuel, los pobladores tienen la elaboración de teja como actividad principal y luego sigue la agricultura. Trabajan de lunes a sábado de 7:00am a 4:00pm. 

El préstamo lo necesita para la compra de materiales para la elaboración de teja( tierra blanca, leña, barro y zacate), ya que esta es la época donde hay mayor demanda y necesita invertir mas para aprovechar la oportunidad de percibir mejores ingresos.
Su sueño es poder tener su propia casa y lo planea lograr ampliando su negocio, priorizando gastos para ir ahorrando y en un corto plazo hacer realidad el sueño de sus esposa y el.
texts.en:
Samuel, 25, is a young man with a lot of initiative when it comes to working.  He studied through second grade but could not continue due to a lack of resources so he had to learn a trade in order to support himself.  He is married and his wife is a homemaker, but also raises chickens in the backyard and helps with his tile activity.

He has his own tile making business and much experience in this activity.  He used to be a farmer and cultivate the land but it was not very profitable so he decided to sell tiles.  His father was the one who taught him the manufacturing technique and he also helps in the process.  The local people in the canton where Samuel lives are mainly involved in tile production as their main activity, followed by agriculture.  They work Monday through Saturday from 7:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m.

Samuel needs a loan to buy materials to make tiles (white dirt, firewood, clay and straw) since it is the season with the highest demand and he needs to invest more in order to earn more income.

His dream is to have his own house and expand his business, prioritizing expenses so he can save and, in the short-term, realize his dream for his wife and himself.

loans.use: To buy materials to make tiles such as white dirt, firewood, clay and straw.

loans.name: Maurice

texts.fr: Maurice est un jeune homme commerçant dans un marché de la place depuis 06 ans où il vend la friperie es vêtements des jeunes, hommes et des dames (en fonction des saisons et des ballots). à cause de la petitesse de son capital, il est obligé d’aller au déballage chaque week-end pour acheter en détail les vêtements qu'il expose dans son comptoir. Cela ne rapporte pas vraiment d'où l'importance de crédit pour son activité parce qu'il lui permettra d'acheter un ballot mixte. il économisera le bénéfice que lui apportera ce crédit pour ouvrir une boutique de vêtements.
texts.en: Maurice is a young man who has been working in a local market for the past six years selling second-hand clothing for young people, men and women (according to the season and the bundles of clothes he acquires). Because he has little capital he is obliged to go to jumble sales every weekend to buy on a retail basis the clothes which he displays on his stall. This does not really make him much money, hence the importance of this loan for his business, because it will allow him to buy a mixed bundle of clothing. He will save the profit which he makes as a result of the loan so he can open a clothes' shop.

loans.use: to buy a bundle of mixed clothing.

loans.name: Gustavo Alberto

texts.es: Gustavo de 36 años, es un humilde padre de familia con 4 hijos, 3 de ellos en edad escolar a los que mantiene gracias a su negocio de venta de frutas y verduras, al que desea invertir con este primer crédito que solicita para intentar aumentar el volumen de productos que le beneficiara obteniendo mejores ingresos con las ventas, comprara papaya, piña, sandillas, nancite mango, manzana,  grocea, caña, coyolito.
texts.en: Gustavo, 36, is a humble father of four children, three of whom are school age.  He supports them with his fruit and vegetable business; and he wants to use the first loan he is requesting to buy products so he can earn more income.  He will buy papaya, pineapple, watermelon, mango, apple, red currant, cane and black berry

loans.use: To buy papaya, pineapple, watermelon, mango, apple, red currant, cane and black berry.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.fr: Joseph est un  homme de 45 ans père de famille. Il est  commerçant dans un marché de la place depuis 09 ans où il vend la friperie es vêtements des jeunes, hommes et des dames (en fonction des saisons et des ballots). à cause de la petitesse de son capital, il est obligé d’aller au déballage chaque week-end pour acheter en détail les vêtements qu'il expose dans son comptoir. Cela ne rapporte pas vraiment d'où l'importance de crédit pour son activité parce qu'il lui permettra d'acheter un ballot mixte. il économisera le bénéfice que lui apportera ce crédit pour ouvrir une boutique de vêtements.
texts.en: Joseph is a 45 year old father. He has been selling used clothing for young people, men and women (according to the season and to the bundles he acquires) in a local market for the past nine years. Because he has little capital, he is obliged to go to jumble sales every weekend to buy on a retail basis the clothes which he displays on his stall. This does not really bring him much money, hence the importance of this loan for his business, since it will enable him to buy a mixed bundle. He will save the profit he makes as a result of this loan to open a clothes' shop.

loans.use: to buy a bundle of mixed clothing.

loans.name: Albert

texts.fr: Albert est un homme de 40 ans père 8 enfants dont l'age varie entre 03 et 14 ans. Cinq de ses enfants vont à l'école. il est commerçant dans un marché de la place depuis 03 ans où il vend la friperie chaussure des jeunes, hommes et des dames (en fonction des saisons et des ballots). à cause de la petitesse de son capital, il est obligé d’aller au déballage chaque week-end pour acheter en détail les chaussures qu'il expose dans son comptoir. Cela ne rapporte pas vraiment d'où l'importance de crédit pour son activité parce qu'il lui permettra d'acheter un ballot mixte. il économisera le bénéfice que lui apportera ce crédit pour ouvrir une boutique.
texts.en: Albert is a 40-year-old father of eight children whose ages range from two to 13 years old. Five of his children go to school. For the past three years, he has been a trader in a local market where he sells second-hand shoes for young people, men and women (according to the season and bales available). Because he has little capital, he is forced to go to jumble sales every weekend to buy shoes at retail prices, which he then displays on his stall. This does not really earn him much money so it is important for him to get a loan for his business so he is able to get a large bundle of mixed shoes. He will save the profit he makes as a result of the loan to open a shop.

loans.use: to buy a bale of shoes

loans.name: Justin Bertrand

texts.fr: Bertrand est un homme de 32 ans célibataire et mère de 3 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 04 et 10 ans. il est commerçant et fait scier du bois qu'il revend lui même dans un dépôt de la place depuis 8 ans. C'est grâce à cette activité qu'il subvient aux besoins de sa famille. Il sollicite ce crédit pour s'acheter une tronçonneuse qui lui permettra d'aller plus vite dans ses commande. ceci augmentera non seulement ses ventes mais aussi sa marge bénéficiaire. bénéfice qui sera en partie réinvesti dans son activité pour l'agrandir et le reste l'aidera pour sa famille.
texts.en: Bertrand is a 32-year old bachelor, who is father to three children, ranging from four to ten years old. He is a trader and has been chopping wood and reselling it himself in a local yard for the past eight years. Thanks to this business he is able to provide for his family's needs. He is requesting this loan so that he can buy a chainsaw which will enable him to fulfil his orders more quickly. This will not only increase his sales but also his profit, which will be partly reinvested in his business so that he can expand it and partly to support his family.

loans.use: to buy a chainsaw.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 34-year-old married woman who lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children.

For many years, her husband has been successfully running a business selling milk in his locality. Over time, he has become well-known in the area for providing good quality milk. He also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of profit. He has a good client list and makes enough money to provide for his family. His business is doing well enough for him to lead a decent life. 

For the growth of the business, he wants to buy more milk to sell and for the production of cheese, butter, etc. But he does not have enough cash in hand to buy more milk. Therefore, Shazia has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy more milk. 

Shazia hopes for an increase in production, which ultimately will help to generate more cash. She thanks Kiva lenders and Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan for this honorable support.

loans.use: To buy milk in bulk for selling and producing yogurt, butter and cheese to sell at the shop.

loans.name: Mamtaz

texts.en:
Mamtaz is a 36-year-old married woman. She is a mother of two daughters and two sons. 

Mamtaz has been knitting embroidery by hand at home for many years to support her family. For the sake of her children's growth and to meet household expenses, she started doing embroidery at home. A supplier comes to her home and provides all the raw materials for knitting embroidery. She completes her tasks along with her daughters over wooden frames. 

Mamtaz wants to sell knitted embroidery directly in the market so that she can generate more profit for her family. She has become an expert in her art and wants to buy raw materials on her own so that she can sell her handmade embroidery for greater profits.

Therefore, Mamtaz has requested a loan to buy raw materials so she can knit more embroidery dresses to sell and generate more income. She hopes to get a boost in her earnings through increased sales. She wishes to utilize a portion of the revenue to provide a quality education for her children.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her embroidery work.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is 49 years old and lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of six children. She is a very hard-working and honest lady. Her daughter has been running a small beauty parlor at home for many years. Now she has become very skilled in makeover services and needs to find more customers for her services. Smamim wants to open a parlor in a nearby market for her daughter so she can easily find more customers and generate a larger profit. Her daughter is in need of plastic furniture and some expensive beauty products as well.

Shamim has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her daughter. With this, she will buy furniture and cosmetics products such as facial cream, hair coloring, scissors and combs for the salon. Shamim is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy furniture and cosmetic products for a newly-created beauty salon.

loans.name: María Esperanza

texts.es:
María de 35 años de edad, es una madre soltera, sola ha tenido que sostener a sus hijos, logró estudiar hasta tercer grado, dejo el estudio por la situación de pobreza que vivía su familia, teniendo que incorporarse a las actividades productivas a temprana edad (agricultura y comercio), formo un hogar, tuvo tres hijos, pero surgieron problemas y se separaron con su compañero de vida. Así le ha tocado criar, sola a sus hijos.Se dedica a la venta de tortillas, en su casa tiene una plancha para hacer tortillas de maíz, vende en la mañana, medio día y tarde/noche.

Ya tiene la clientela porque su tortillería es bastante conocida por las personas del centro.  Además de la tortillería, genera ingresos por medio de planchar ropa a vecinos. Estos oficios los aprendió gracias a su madre, y que durante estos años le han servido para que no le falte el sustento a su familia.

El préstamo lo utilizara en la compra de maíz, que es su materia prima para la elaboración de tortillas, con ello quiere aprovechar que es la época en que hay abundancia de granos básicos por que los productores están en este momento recolectando su cosecha y por ello  hay precios bajos. Es una oportunidad de invertir, pero que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente.

Su sueño es ver crecer sus hijos y que no les falte nada, ella luchara para que puedan estudiar y brindarles las condiciones dignas para hacer de ellos personas de bien y productivas.
texts.en:
María is 35 years old. She is a single mother and had to raise her children on her own. She went to school until third grade, but then had do leave school because her family lived in poverty and she had to help with productive activities at an early age (agriculture and trade). She set up her own household and had three children but she and her partner had problems and separated. Therefore she had to raise her three children on her own. She sells tortillas and has a griddle to make corn tortillas. She sells them in the morning, midday and afternoon/evening.

She already has a customer base because her tortilla stall is very well known to the people in the area. In addition to the tortilla stall, she generates income by ironing clothes for her neighbors. She learnt these tasks thanks to her mother and they have served her well to provide for her family over the last few years. 

She will use the loan to buy corn, which is her main ingredient for making tortillas. By this she will be able to make use of the fact that at this time of the year there is plenty of grain because the farmers are currently collecting their harvest and therefore the prices are low. This is an opportunity for her to invest, but she does not have enough money.

Her dream is to see her children grow up and that they do not lack anything. She strives for them to be able to go to school and to provide them with decent living conditions to help them become good and productive individuals.

loans.use: to buy corn and make use of the low prices.

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es: Ana Isabel, tiene la edad  de 52 años, está casada,  vive con su esposo y sus hijos los cuales su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle en el momento de la siembra y así que tenga una buena geminación, y semilla de maíz y frijol de buena calidad que se adapte bien a las condiciones del suelo y fertilidad del mismo, además pagar mano de obra en la preparación del terreno y la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Ana Isabel is 52 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and children, who are her main priority. With the loan, she intends on buying fertilizer and other products to apply when she is planting so that there will be good germination. Also, she will buy corn and been seeds of good quality that adapts well to soil conditions and fertility. She will also pay for labor costs to prepare the land and apply the products as well as to help out once the crops grow. This way, she can ensure good work. What she intends to do is take advantage of the good weather and soil conditions the area has for cultivation as well as put into practice her several years' experience managing basic grains. In addition, she will also be able to buy the best quality products so that her crops will have good development and growth and have a good harvest so that in the short term she will have important production. With the income from the harvest she hopes to get, she wants to pay for the well being and education of her family and meet some family goals and keep investing more in her crops. This is the first loan that she has received from FUDECOSUR. She hasn't had other loans before from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered her the loan with better terms and a much lower rate of interest.

loans.use: to plant beans.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat is a 38-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

She has requested a loan for her husband. Her husband owns a spare parts shop in which he sells motor bike spare parts such as silencers, fuel tanks, foot rests, wheels, tyres, tubes etc. Her husband also supplies spare parts to other shopkeepers. The spare parts shop is his only source of income. He has estimated his future expenses and realized that he needs to grow his business in order to cope with the needs that lie ahead. 

Therefore, Nusrat has requested a Kiva loan to help her husband, so he can buy additional motorbike spare parts. She hopes that her husband will succeed in his future planning and that this loan will prove beneficial to his business.

loans.use: To buy motor bike spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to consolidate a debt.

loans.name: Irma Antonia

texts.es:
Irma de 33 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer año de bachillerato, ella es soltera y no tiene hijos vive junto a su papá y su mamá  en su casa y también con un sobrino de 16 años y que está estudiando bachillerato.  Actualmente, ella es ordenanza en la unidad de salud desde hace 2 años, sus padres y su sobrino son las únicas personas que dependen de ella.


Ella trabaja solo los días de semana  los sábados y domingos pues comenta que así lo establece su contrato,  Irma comenta que es una oportunidad que le dieron, de poder trabajar en la institución, antes del trabajo se dedicaba a los oficios domésticos en su vivienda y para llegar al lugar de su trabajo le queda bien cerca a unos 100mts de su vivienda en el cual se va caminado para su trabajo el horario que tiene es de 6 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde.
