Desea tener la oportunidad de ingresar  al instituto Campo Alto para realizar la meta como profesional  ante la sociedad, sabe que tendrá muchas oportunidades de trabajo y facilidades de apoyo para la familia.
Tiene como objetivo estudiar  para realizarse como una mujer  estudiada, tiene en claro lo que quiere y desea ser, por eso le gustaría  tener la oportunidad de estudiar y crecer como persona  y cumplir la meta.
Esta es la oportunidad que ella ha estado esperando, estudiar en un buen instituto donde pueda crecer como persona y profesionalmente, donde reciba la mejor enseñanza y profesionalismo en el campo de la salud oral. 
Ella se sentiría gratamente agradecida que le brindaran el apoyo para acceder  al convenio kiva que le están brindando para que ella pueda acceder a las instalaciones del instituto Campo Alto.
texts.en:
Brenda is a responsible, punctual, and collaborative person. She wishes to have the opportunity to join the Campo Alto institute to achieve her goal of becoming a professional in society. She knows that she will have many opportunities for work and the ability to support her family. Her objective is to study to become an educated woman. It is very clear what she wants and who she wants to be, and because of this, she would like to have the opportunity to study, to grow as a person, and to achieve her goals. 

This is the opportunity that Brenda has been waiting for: to study in a good institute where she can grow as a person and professionally, where she can receive better instruction and learn professionalism in the field of oral health. 

Brenda would feel truly grateful to receive this support through Kiva so that she can access the facilities of the Campo Alto institute.

loans.use: To pay for enrolling in a semester of school

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Ayat

texts.en: Ayat is a 20 year-old-lady who lives in a sector in Jordan called Mafraq with her parents and 5 siblings. Ayat is studying for a bachelor's, majoring in Education Sciences. She is in her second year and is planning to work in her study field after graduation. She will start her work life in order to help her family financially as they are currently facing a financial crisis, which is not helping them pay her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is 22 years old. He is living in a rented house in a sector in Jordan called Wihdat with his family, consisting of 5 siblings and his parents. He is studying for a bachelor's, majoring in Accounting. He is in his second year and is planning to find a job that suits his study field after graduation in order to start supporting his family financially as they are facing a financial crisis, which is not helping them to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Rozina

texts.en:
Rozina is a 25-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a chef by profession, providing services of cooking food at marriage ceremonies, parties and funfair programs. He cooks delicious Pakistani food such as biryani, qorma, roast chicken & fish, and for sweet dishes he prepares firni and kheer. He is a very famous chef in his town and most of the people like to order cooked food for their ceremonies from him. 

Sometimes he has to cook many dishes at a time, and at those times he faces a problem of a shortage of cauldrons. He wants to keep more than four to five cauldrons for cooking different dishes, but he does not have enough cash in hand to buy more cauldrons. 

Therefore, Rozina requested a loan from Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy new cauldrons, spices and firewood for cooking food. She is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan for this honorable favor.

loans.use: To buy cauldrons, firewood and spices for providing chef services for ceremonies.

loans.name: Santos Evenor

texts.es:
Santos es un hombre de 35 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado,  está soltero y vive junto a su mamá y un hijo el cual está estudiando en la escuela de la comunidad.

Él se dedica a trabajar como albañil,  aprendió este oficio ya que su familia es muy humilde y de escasos recursos,  él abandono sus estudios para ayudar económicamente en su hogar y sacar a sus hermanos menores adelante con sus estudios, aparte de esto él se dedica a la agricultura esto lo aprendió de su padre que fue su principal instructor en este rubro así como el de la albañilería.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, a CREDICAMPO, es para ampliar una granja de pollos, con la cual obtiene un ingreso extra para su familia ya que mientras él trabaja en la agricultura y como albañil la mamá de él, se encarga del cuidado de las aves de esta manera también le ayuda a generar un ahorro en mano de obra,  así como en el cuido oportuno de los animales. 

En el futuro desea,  tener una granja mas grande que le genere mas rentabilidad para que sus ingresos sean mayores, que su familia y en especial su madre pueda pasar descansando sus últimos días ya que es de una edad avanzada y él no ve justo que ella haya trabajado tanto cuando era joven para darle su educación y él ahora que puede,  quiere verla a ella en su casa descansando y él recompensarle todo ese esfuerzo a ella.
texts.en:
Santos is a 35 year old man with a 9th grade education.  He is single and lives with his mother and a son who goes to the local school.  He works as a mason, a trade that he learned because his family was very humble and of few resources.  He left school in order to help his family financially, and support his younger siblings in their studies.  In addition to this, he also works in agriculture, which he learned from his father who was not only his teacher in this field but also in masonry.

The loan that he is requesting from Credicampo will be used to expand a chicken farm that he uses to gain additional income for his family.  While he works in agriculture and as a mason, his mother takes care of the chickens, allowing him to save in labor while still properly caring for his animals.  

In the future, he wishes to have a bigger farm that will be more profitable, so that his earnings are greater.  He also wishes that his family, and especially his mother, will be able to relax in their last days as she is of an advanced age and he thinks it is unfair that she worked so hard when she was young to afford him an education, and now that he can, he wants to see her at home relaxing and pay her back for all of her effort.

loans.use: expand a chicken farm.

loans.name: Tehran

texts.en:
Tehran is a 55-year-old refugee. He is married, with three sons, and he lives with his family in an IDP settlement. His wife is a housekeeper. 

Tehran has worked as a farmer for 20 years and he has good skills in this field. He raises fruit trees and he sells the fruit at a local bazaar. His monthly income is AZN 120. 

Tehran raises fruit trees because people have high demand for fresh fruits, especially refugees living in IDP settlements. It’s cheaper for them to buy food from the private gardens of farmers, such as Tehran. They like to eat fresh fruits or to prepare delicious fruit pies for dessert.

Tehran applied for an AZN 1,500 loan in order to buy new varieties of fruit trees, to increase his income. He wants to provide his children with bright and happy futures. This loan is Tehran's third one and he has a positive client history.

loans.use: to buy new varieties of fruit trees.

loans.name: Amon

texts.en:
Amon is 30 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is married and has two children, with one of them currently in school. For the past four years, Amon has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells grocery and daily-use items. 

To help expand the business, Amon has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy items to sell like posho (cornmeal), sugar, beans, and bread, and will help Amon to generate greater profits and improve his welfare. Amon hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like posho (cornmeal), sugar, beans, and bread

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 40 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has five children, with four of them currently in school. For the past 3 years, Lucia has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells groceries, daily-use and household items. 

To help expand the business, Lucia has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more items to sell, and will help Lucia to generate greater profits and increase her standard of living. Lucia hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business.

loans.use: buy more household items like basins, bread, cooking oil, curry powder and others

loans.name: Diana Ruth

texts.en:
Diana Ruth is 41 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala North region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children who are currently in school. For the past 9 years, she has been working hard to manage her bar and restaurant, which sells drinks and food. 

To help expand her business, Diana Ruth has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy drinks and food items, and will help her to generate greater profits and growth in the business. She hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business.

loans.use: buy drinks and food items.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 35 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala North region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 7 years, Catherine has been working hard to manage her salon business, which deals in hair salon services. 

To help expand her business, Catherine has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy hair products and a hair dryer, and will help her to generate greater profits and growth in her business. She hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy hair products and a hair dryer.

loans.name: Al-Wahd Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Wahd, and consists of six women who live in Aden, Yemen. They have requested a group loan, and they will hold each other accountable for the loan repayment.

Manjy is the leader of this group. She is a 36-year-old married woman with a child. She is a very active woman, but she is uneducated and from a poor family.

Manjy is a happy woman who treats everyone well because of her opportunities to get ahead. She, like many people, has had good times and bad ones and has gotten ahead despite whatever stands in her way. She is worried about her house, so she applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to buy construction supplies to remodel the inside of the house and thus make it more comfortable for her family. With great strength and dedication, she has become a better person.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to remodel the inside of the house.

loans.name: Mannaseh

texts.en:
Mannaseh lives in Ogongo, a small town in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay County is located at the south-western tip of Kenya, and its northern end is dominated by Lake Victoria, the largest lake in the Southern Hemisphere. Lake Victoria extends into three East African countries, allowing cross-border flows of goods and people, and a market day in a lakeside town in Homa Bay county often boasts traders from Uganda, Tanzania and Kenya, all of whom arrive in boats to ply their wares. Although the semi-arid nature of much of Homa Bay county means that poverty rates are quite high, many people in the region place a strong cultural emphasis on education, and as a result school attendance figures around Homa Bay are above the national average.

Mannaseh is married and has eight children. He is a lay leader in church while his wife is a retired community worker in adult education. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for forty years now and they are currently growing vegetables, groundnuts, maize and green grams in their farm. Mannaseh is looking forward to beekeeping because it does not require much effort like other farming enterprises and at the same time it will earn him some income.

This is Mannaseh's first loan with Honey Care and he intends to use the proceeds from his beehives to pay his children’s school fees and provide for his family’s basic needs. Mannaseh's hope for the future is to expand his beekeeping project and produce more honey.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and run two Fresh Life Toilets.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 48 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala North region of Uganda. She is married and has 5 children who are all currently in school. For the past 10 years, Christine has been working hard to manage her poultry and animal husbandry business, which deals in eggs, birds and other products. 

To help expand her business, Christine has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy feeds and more poultry, and will help Christine to generate greater profits and growth in her business. She hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business.

loans.use: buy feeds and more poultry.

loans.name: Shahida's Group

texts.en:
Shahida is 56-year-old lady living with her spouse and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She wants to make some savings so that she could provide better living facilities to her children, but it seems impossible in the absence of a profitable source of income.

Her son has been driving a moto-rickshaw for several years but his income is not sufficient to feed his entire family. He has to maintain the rickshaw’s body but he does not have a sufficient amount of money to fix the problem. 

Therefore, Shahida requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so her son would be able to maintain the moto-rickshaw’s body. She hopes that she would be able to make enough savings until it is time to marry her son.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of the moto-rickshaw body.

loans.name: Fatina

texts.en: Fatina is a 21-year-old lady who lives in an area of Jordan called Mafraq with her parents and five siblings. Fatina is studying for a Bachelors’ majoring in Special Education. She is in her third  year and is planning to work in her study field after graduation to start her work life in order to help her family financially as they are currently facing a financial crisis which is not helping them pay her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is 21 years old. He is living in a rented house in an area of Jordan called Mafraq with his family consisting of his seven siblings and his parents. He is studying for a Diploma majoring in Space Engineering. He is in his second year and is planning to find a job that suits his study field after graduation in order to start supporting his family financially as they are facing a financial crisis which is not helping them to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more coal, rice, oil, plantain, chips and other items for her business.

loans.name: Lubna

texts.en:
Lubna is a 34-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of three daughters. Her husband is responsible to the entire family. 

Lubna has been running a beauty salon for five years and contributes her income with her husband to fulfill the needs of her family. She has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. She has to purchase different kinds of cosmetics and other items (e.g., hair brushes, face wash and creams) to earn maximum profit, but due to insufficient financial means she has been unable to do so. This loan will help her to purchase these items for her business and also enable her to save for her family's needs in future.

Lubna is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different types of cosmetics and other items for her business.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 30 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki, in the Fortportal region of Uganda. He is married and has two children, one of whom is in school. For the past five years, James has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells rice, sugar, posho and bread. 

To help expand the business, James has requested a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. He will use the loan to buy more rice, sugar, posho, bread and other items, which will help him to generate greater profits and improve his standard of living. James hopes that in the future he will be able to open up another business.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, posho, bread and other items

loans.name: Najah

texts.en: Najah was born in 1993. She is a single lady living in a sector of Jordan called Dairalla with her three brothers and her parents. Najah is trying her best to support her family financially by running her business of raising goats and selling their products. She started her business three years ago and has found it to be profitable. Now she is planning to expand her business by buying a larger quantity of goats. That would raise her productivity and income but she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: To buy more goats for her business

loans.name: Farzana's Group

texts.en:
Farzana is 39 years old and the mother of seven children. Her husband owns a shop in which he has installed a few compression molding machines. He takes orders for manufacturing plastic bottles, toys, small bicycle wheels and plastic accessories. He appoints laborers over the molding machines for daily wages. For manufacturing different plastic accessories he needs different categories and qualities of raw materials. 

This time he has taken a much larger contract than earlier, but he does not have enough money to buy good quality plastic's crushing raw material to continue his manufacturing. Therefore, Farzana requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy the raw materials for the molding machines. 

She has to look after a huge family, taking care of each of her kids, their school fees, their diet and their health. For these purposes she has need of a huge income, and her husband is the only person who is responsible for bearing the household expenses. Farzana is very happy after taking this loan and thanks Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy plastic's crushing raw material for manufacturing plastic accessories.

loans.name: Fareeda

texts.en: Farida is borrowing from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan. She is the mother of  a daughter and two sons and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing tailoring services for 12 years. Her husband wants to purchase different types of cloth, needles and thread for his business but due to financial constraints is unable to. This loan will help her husband to purchase these items. And it will also help increase profits which will enable her to save for her family's needs. Farida is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy pieces of cloth, ribbons, needles and thread for her husband's tailoring business.

loans.name: Mushviq

texts.en:
Mushviq is 37 years old, married, and has a daughter and two sons. They are refugees and have lived in an IDP settlement for a long time. Mushviq is a gardener who raises fruit trees (apples, pears, etc.) and sells the fruit at the local bazaar. This is the family's main source of income, and he gets about 130AZN monthly. He gets a little additional earnings from raising hens and working as a laborer in his free time.

People living in IDP settlements have a high demand for fresh foods. They prepare different kinds of fruit juice and jams. They like eating jam with bread and tea in the morning, or for eating with tea when they have guests. 

The area of this settlement is very rainy and cold and it’s hard for Mushviq to keep his trees warm. That’s why he applied for a 1,000 AZN loan in order to buy new fertilizers and to build a small greenhouse for his trees. He wants to increase his income and provide his children with a good education. This is his third loan and he has a positive client history.

loans.use: to buy new fertilizers and build a small greenhouse for his trees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice and oil for her business.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen has been making savings for many days to buy a new auto rickshaw for her son, but at the time of purchasing, the amount of her savings was not enough. Therefore, she requested a loan for her son so he can buy a new rickshaw with the added contribution of her savings. After receiving the loan, she will successfully buy the new rickshaw.

Nasreen is a 51-year-old woman, living with her seven children and her spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She hopes that after purchasing the rickshaw, her son can easily generate sufficient income to care for his children. She is very happy after taking this loan, and she thanks Kiva and their field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a new rickshaw for her son.

loans.name: Andres Felipe

texts.es:
Esta historia habla de andres un joven estudiante en Auxiliar de enfermería y además finalizando los estudios básicos de tan solo 16 años.   
Que vive con la hermana menor y la mama, ella una mujer que se esfuerza por educar y sacar adelante a los hijos, una mujer que a pesar de todo los retos hace  lo posible por pasarlos,  ellos viven en una casa humilde donde pagan arriendo y la situación económica un poco baja,  lo cual aveces les impide poder comprar muchas cosas deseadas, pero sin importar la madre  hace lo posible por darles lo que puede 
Andrés al darse cuenta del esfuerzo que hace la mama por darles lo mejor, toma una decisión la cual es ingresar a estudiar lo que a la mama le parece maravilloso, ya que por la situación económica aveces para ella  seria lo mejor,  ya le faltan unos pocos meses para salir de bachiller, este técnico  ayudaría para poder pagar los estudios superiores como medico,  este es el gran sueño de andres, ser un excelente medico cirujano, el decidió empezar como  un auxiliar de enfermería que es lo que a escogido para estudiar, con lo cual esta muy contento ya que al terminar este técnico podrá ayudar a la madre y poderse pagar los estudios, Pero desafortunada andres y la familia han estado en una situación en la cual tiene que tomar una  decisión definitiva la cual seria muy triste tanto para el como para la mama, ya que esta seria que el dejara de estudiar el técnico como enfermero ya que la economía esta un poco disminuida. 
Así que ha pensado la opción de acercarse a kiva una institución en la cual podrá tener un gran apoyo  con el cual podrá continuar  los estudios y poder cumplir los sueños y poder se lo que siempre ha querido.
texts.en: This story tells of Andres, a young student and nursing assistant who is finalizing his basic studies at only 16 years old. He lives with his younger sister and mother, a woman who strives to educate and lift up her children - a woman who, despite all obstacles, has made it possible for her children to achieve their goals. She lives in a humble house where they pay rent and experience a low economic situation. This prevents his family from being able to purchase desirable things; but regardless, Andres' mother does whatever she can to give her children what they need. Andres, once he realized what his mother has done to improve their lives, made the decision to begin studying, which his mother thinks is wonderful. Given their economic situation, according to her, this would be best. He has only a few months until graduating from high school, and this degree will help him be able to pay for higher education, perhaps to become a doctor. This is Andres' biggest dream, to be an excellent medical surgeon. He decided to start as a nursing assistant, which is what he chose to study. He is very happy with this, and once he completes this degree, he will be able to help his mother and pay for his own studies. But unfortunately, Andres and his family have been in a situation where he must make a definitive decision, which would be just as sad for him as it would be for his mother. Andres might have to stop pursuing his nursing degree due to the degrading economy, so he thought of the option to search for an institution through Kiva that might help him continue his studies, achieve his dreams, and become who he has always wanted to be.

loans.use: To pay for a semester of school

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase feed for her animals

loans.name: Maisa

texts.en: Maisa is a 21-year-old lady who lives in a sector in Jordan called Mafraq with her parents and 5 siblings. Her father is a retired man. Maisa is studying for her Bachelor's degree, majoring in Political Science. She is in her 3rd year and is planning to start her work life in her study field after graduation in order to help her family financially, as they are currently facing a financial crisis which is not helping them pay her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is 20 years old. He is living in a sector of Jordan called Zarqa with his family, consisting of 2 siblings and his parents. He is studying for a Bachelor's degree, majoring in Security Management. He is in his 3rd year and is planning to find a job that suits his study field after graduation in order to start supporting his family financially, as they are facing a financial crisis which is not helping them to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Petro

texts.en:
Petro is seeking your financial help to buy a dairy cow and a calf. 

Petro is 37 and married, and has two children, 6 and 4. In addition to this, he has to look after his brother, who was born paralyzed. 

They live in a village with beautiful scenery inside a national park; nice restaurants are built along the Shkumbini River and the national road not far from their village. 

Fifteen years ago, Petro chose to pursue livestock as the only means of income. Since then, he has been selling raw milk to a nearby dairy farm. Here is what he stated during the interview: “I find it easy and manageable (to do) this type of activity while I look after my brother.”

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow with a calf.

loans.name: Hamida's Group

texts.en:
Hamida is a 55-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of six children. Her son is a rickshaw driver by profession and provides transportation services in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
 
For a long time, he has wanted to replace his old rickshaw's body. He is unable to attract passengers due to the ugly-looking vehicle and cannot generate any amount of income. He wants to buy a new rickshaw body as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of availability of funds, he finds it difficult to cover the cost. 

Therefore, Hamida has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her son cover the cost of the new rickshaw body. This will help him to continue his business. She is very thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a new rickshaw body.

loans.name: Yazan

texts.en: Yazan is 24 years old. He is living in a sector of Jordan called Mafraq with his family of five siblings and his parents. He is studying for a bachelor's degree in accounting. He is in his fifth year and is planning to find a job that suits his study field after graduation in order to start supporting his family financially. The family is facing financial difficulties and is unable to pay his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Zarbali

texts.en: Zarbali is 56 years old, married, and has three children. His family lives at Baku region. His elder son is 25 years old and helps Zarbali with his work. His elder daughter is studying a second course of musical college. His little son is studying a first course of University.  Zarbali is an electrician. A while ago his apparatus was broken, and he has not been able to work.  He has applied to Komak Company for a loan in amount of 1,800 AZN. With this loan he wants to repair the apparatus and will be able to continue his work.  Zarbali is thankful to the Kiva organization for the aid. He wants to recruit an assistant in the future.

loans.use: to repair his apparatus.

loans.name: Wedad

texts.en: Wedad is 20 years old and lives in a sector of Jordan called Mafraq with her parents and two siblings. Her father is retired and one of her brothers is in the military. Wedad is studying for a bachelor's degree in class teaching. She is in her third year and is planning to work in her study field after graduation to help her family financially. The family is currently facing financial difficulties so they are unable to pay her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her semester and registration fees.

loans.name: Ra'fat

texts.en: Ra'fat is 36 years old. He is living in a sector of Jordan called Baqaa with his wife and two daughters. He is studying for a bachelor's degree in plant production and protection. He is in his second year and is planning to find a job that suits his study field after graduation  to start supporting his family financially. Unfortunately, he doesn't have enough money to pay his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for the rest of his semester fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more flour and baking materials

loans.name: Naboth

texts.en:
Naboth lives in Ogongo, a small town in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay County is located in southwestern Kenya, close to both the Tanzanian border and Lake Victoria, Africa's largest lake. 

Despite the proximity to the lake, water infrastructure in Homa Bay remains quite undeveloped, and inconsistent rains and occasional droughts make life difficult for farmers in the area. Nonetheless, farmers have adapted to these challenges, particularly by diversifying their crops to include cassava, sunflower, sorghum, bananas, groundnuts and millet, as well as drought-resistant varieties of papaya and mangoes. Although beekeeping has not traditionally been practiced in the region, many individuals have expressed interest in keeping bees and are knowledgeable about their pollination benefits.

Naboth is married and has nine children. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for forty years now, and they are currently growing maize, millet and groundnuts and keeping goats, cattle, sheep and poultry. Naboth is excited about beekeeping, as it will earn him extra income and provide his family with honey for food.

This is Naboth’s first loan with Honey Care. He intends to use the proceeds from his beehives to support orphans and expand his beekeeping projects. Naboth’s hopes for the future are to increase his livestock numbers and to improve his farm products.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith lives in Ogongo, a small town in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay County is located in southwestern Kenya, and borders onto Lake Victoria, the second-largest lake in the world. Populations are dense close to the lake, where many individuals make their living from fishing, and a few work in the small, but slowly growing tourism industry. A popular tourist attraction in Homa Bay County is Ruma National Park, a game reserve that is home to the rare roan antelope, a shy species distantly related to the reticulated giraffe. Most people in Homa Bay make their living from farming, and the rolling hills of the area are dotted with fields and fruit tree plantations.

Judith is married and has six children. She is a teacher by profession, while her husband is an education officer. Both she and her husband are farmers. They have been farming for twenty years now, and they are currently growing maize, sweet potatoes, sorghum and beans. Judith is excited about beekeeping, as it will earn her some income and provide her with honey for food.

This is Judith’s first loan with Honey Care. She intends to use the proceeds from her beehives to pay school fees for her grandchildren. Judith’s hope for the future is to make profit and expand her beekeeping project.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Rovshan

texts.en:
Rovshan is 30 years old, married, and his wife is a housekeeper. He earns money selling fruit (apples, bananas, oranges, quince, persimmon, feyhoa, lemons, grapes, figs, etc.) and greens at a local bazaar. His monthly income is 300 AZN.

Azerbaijan people like fruit very much. Their demand for fruit is high because they know that fruit is useful for health. For example, if someone catches cold or cough he drinks hot milk with a dried fig to recover. Beside that, they prepare different kinds of fruit pies, juices, and cakes for daily dessert or holidays.

Rovshan applied for 1500 AZN loan to expand his small business. He wants to order vegetables from suppliers in addition to fruit and build his own little grocery in future. 

This is his third loan and he has a positive client history.

loans.use: to order vegetables from suppliers

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is married, with three children. She is 45 years old and she lives in the Philippines.

Conchita is a farmer and she grows pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years. She requested a loan to buy more heads of pigs for her hog-raising.

Conchita has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for three years. In the future, she hopes to have a bigger space for her piggery.

loans.use: to buy more heads of pigs for hog-raising.

loans.name: Dúo Fe De Lo Alto Group

texts.es:
DÚO FE DE LO ALTO
Doña Telma Elizabeth quien es la líder del grupo, nos cuenta que tiene 57 años de edad y tiene 1 hija viviendo con ella, es viuda y es dueña de un comedor ubicado en San Juan Sacatepéquez, solicita este crédito porque quiere mejorar sus servicio y sus instalaciones de su negocio que lo tiene hace 15 años, para atender mejor a su clientela que día a día la buscan, ya que ella atiende a los pilotos y ayudantes de las camionetas de San Juan Sacatepéquez, y tiene que dar desayunos y almuerzos y refacciones todos los días, por eso quiere que fape le brinde su apoyo,esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mercaderia para la elaboracion de almuerzos para para la venta.
texts.en: Ms. Telma Elizabeth is a leader of the group "DÚO FE DE LO ALTO", and tells us that she is 57 years old, has one daughter living with her, and is a widow. She is the owner of a food stall located in San Juan Sacatepéquez, and is asking for this loan because she wants to improve her services and the her business establishment, which she has had for 15 years. She wants to provide better customer service for her clients that seek her out daily. She serves drivers and their helpers of the vans of San Juan Sacatepéquez, and provides breakfast, lunch, and snacks every day. She wants to thank the FAPE community for its support, and is asking for this loan to purchase goods for the production of lunches for sale.

loans.use: To purchase goods for the production of lunches for sale.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 23 years old. He lives in a sector in Jordan called Irbid with his mother and two sisters. His father is deceased. 

Mohammad is studying for his Bachelor's degree majoring in children's education. He is in his second year. Mohammad is planning to find a job that suits his field of study after graduation in order to start supporting his family financially. After his father's death, they are facing a financial crisis, which does not allow the family to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, Mohammad has requested a loan, which he will use to pay his semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar was born in 1976. He is married and lives in a sector in Jordan called Salt with his wife, who works at a medicine company. 

Omar has been running his project of computer sales for four years; this is his only source of income. 

Omar needs to expand his project in order to raise his profit. 

He is now seeking a loan to buy a larger quantity of computers.

loans.use: To buy more computers to sell

loans.name: Elija

texts.en:
Elija lives in Ogongo, a small town in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay County is located at the southwestern tip of Kenya, and its northern end is dominated by Lake Victoria, the largest lake in the Southern Hemisphere. Lake Victoria extends into three east African countries, allowing cross-border flows of goods and people, and a market day in a lakeside town in Homa Bay county often boasts traders from Ugandan, Tanzania and Kenya, all of whom arrive in boats to ply their wares. 

Although the semi-arid nature of much of Homa Bay County means that poverty rates are quite high, many people in the region hold a strong cultural emphasis on education, and as a result, school attendance figures around Homa Bay are above the national average.

Elija is married and has ten children. His wife is a voluntary community worker, while he is a retired police officer. Both he and his wife have been farming for thirty years now, and they are currently growing maize, millet, and beans and tending to a small forest on their land. Elijah is looking forward to beekeeping, as it will earn him extra income and provide him with honey for food and medicinal use.

This is Elija’s first loan with Honey Care. He intends to use the proceeds from his beehives to invest in his farm. Elija’s hope for the future is "to grow a wealthy family."

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Fabricio Omar

texts.es:
Fabricio de 21 años de edad, es bachiller soltero, se dedica al comercio y trabaja la agricultura, vivió junto a su mamá, su padre no está en la casa con ellos se ha ido a trabajar a otro lugar; él tiene dos hermanos, ellos estudian en la escuela local. Su mamá y sus hermanos dependen de él, su negocio de venta de ropa usada le a ayuda a proveer a su mamá  y a sus hermanos lo que ellos necesitan en una parte, con el negocio y la agricultura, algunas veces le toca que transportarse unos cinco kilómetros para llegar a sus destinos,  donde tiene el negocio de venta de ropa usada.

El crédito que esta solicitando, es para comprar más ropa usada.  Le ayudara a aumentar el negocio, así obtendrá mayores ganancias y tendrá una mejor manera de viva para él y su familia ya que necesita aumentar el negocio.

Su sueño de siempre es convertirse en un profesional, además de tener su negocio él quiere optar por un trabajo en una buena empresa, ver a sus hermanos en una buena posición y que logren ser profesionales para que tengan un buen empleo y que su mamá viva mejor
texts.en:
Fabricio is 21 years old, single, and works in agriculture and commerce. He lives with his mother, and his father does not live at home with them because he left to work elsewhere. He has two siblings, and they study in a local school. His mother and his siblings depend on him. His used clothing store helps him provide for his mother and siblings, through both the store and agriculture. Sometimes, he needs to be transported 5 kilometers to get to his used clothing store. 

The loan Fabricio is asking for is to buy more used clothing. It will help him improve his business by obtaining higher profits. Through this, he will have a better way of life for him and his family.

His long-time dream is to become a professional. In addition to having his store, he wants to go work for a good company, see his siblings obtain a good position, and achieve professional status so that the can have gainful employment and help their mother live better.

loans.use: to buy more used clothing.

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  femmes du groupe Djiguiya sont mariées dans des familles polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 31 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes  dans le village de Banankoroniwere dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce de mil, et la restauration. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2eme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Mamou 1 ère à gauche,  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 3 sacs de mil pour faire face à la demande clientèle. Elle revend toujours au comptant à la maison et au marché du village à une clientèle mixte. Madame Mamou  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15 000FCFA avec ce prêt. Ce bénéfice sera utilisé pour  la prise en charge d’une partie de la famille et aider aussi son mari.
texts.en:
The four members of the Djiguiya group are married women who live in polygamous families. They average 31 years of age and four children each. They all live in the village of Banankoroniwere, in the region of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another as neighbors, through ties of kinship, and through the income-generating activities they conduct in the village. As a group, they sell millet and provide restaurant services. 

To bolster their working capital, the members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance organization. This is their 2nd group loan. Mrs. Mamou, 1st from the left, plans to use her loan to buy 3 sacks of millet to meet customer demand. She sells for cash only, to a mixed clientele, from her home and at the village market.  

With this loan, Mrs. Mamou expects to earn an average monthly profit of 15,000 FCFA. She will use this profit to handle part of the household expenses and to assist her husband.

loans.use: to buy millet for resale.

loans.name: Carlos Agustin

texts.es:
Carlos, es soltera, tiene 1 hijo vive con sus padres en el Cantón Chimbo Provincia Bolívar.
Carlos es empleado privado en la Corporación La Favorita. Solicita el crédito para la compra de electrodomésticos.  Las  compras lo realizan en el Cantón Chimbo semanalmente. Con el apoyo del crédito podrá comprar sus bienes. Su desafío es las enfermedades. Su sueño seguir trabajando para cubrir toda sus deudas.  En el tiempo libre  le gusta  jugar futbol.
texts.en: Carlos is single, has one child, and lives with his parents in Chimbo county of the Bolivar province. Carlos is a private employee of the corporation "La Favorita." He is asking for this loan to purchase home electronics. He will make these purchases in Chimbo county exclusively. With the loan support, he can buy their goods. His challenge is sickness. His dream is to continue working to cover all his debts. In his free time, Carlos likes to play soccer.

loans.use: To buy a television.

loans.name: Thana'

texts.en: Thana was born in 1955. She is a widow who lives in a rented house in a part of Jordan called Wihdat. Her two sons are married. Thana has earned a living by sewing clothes for the last six years and has successfully met her needs and paid her bills. She started her project using one sewing machine and sewing a small quantity of clothes. Now she needs to buy more fabric to make more clothes and raise her productivity and sales. She doesn't have enough money to do this on her own, which is why she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy new thread and better quality fabric.

loans.name: Abood Group

texts.en: This group is called Abood Group. It consists of four ladies who live in Sana`a, Yemen.  Nour, 24, is the mother of two children. She lives with her family in Sana`a, Yemen.  She has been selling perfume, incense, and clothes to provide for her family. To help her continue with her business operations, she has applied for a loan of 50,000 YER. She will use her portion of the group's loan to buy more perfume, incense, clothes, and other materials for her business. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.

loans.use: to buy more perfume, incense, clothes, and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Lama

texts.en: Lama is 21 years old, single, and lives in Jenin with her family in a small, simple house. Her father is a worker who earns a low wage. Lama is a student in a local university where she studies finance. She is very smart and would like to finish her studies and find a job to help her family to pay its expenses. She is requesting a loan in U.S. dollars from FATEN to buy a new laptop that she will use for her school work. This will allow her to do her homework and read articles online.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop to use at school.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice is a 22-year-old female, married, with no children. This is her second loan of KES 40,000. She was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by the VisionFund Kenya field officer. 

Loice has a grocery business. Her business is located in Miwani. She has been in this business for three years and she earns a monthly income of KES 10,500. 

Loice is planning to use the loan to buy vegetables and fruits to sell to her customers. She will use the profit to expand the business. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Roxana Beatriz

texts.es:
Roxana de 28 años de edad,es una joven con muchas ganas de superarse, a pesar de la situación de desempleo que hay en el país,  no se ha quedado con los brazos cruzados, ella estudio hasta educación media(bachillerato), pero no contó con los recursos suficientes y tuvo que detener sus estudios, pero que desea retomar para seguir formándose y tener mejores oportunidades de trabajo. Esta casada y su esposo es peluquero. Tienen dos hijos, los cuales estudian en este momento.

Trabaja vendiendo artículos de belleza por catalogo, pasa casa por casa y también recibe pedidos de clientes recurrentes, tiene 5 años de dedicarse a este negocio y dice que no queda mucha ganancia, pero que al final no hay muchas opciones de empleo y esta actividad mas los ingresos de su esposo en la peluquería, les ayudan a apaciguar la situación.

La venta la realiza todos los días, esta la realiza después de medio día, porque en la mañana tiene que mandar a sus hijos a la escuela y realizar los quehaceres del hogar.

Necesita el préstamo para aprovechar la oportunidad que se le ha presentado, le venden mercadería para el negocio a un bajo costo, pero no cuenta con este dinero y si se tarda mas tiempo puede que lo compre otra persona y pierda la oportunidad que hoy tiene. Por eso se ha decidido a realizar el préstamo que posteriormente ira cancelando de lo que le generen las ventas.
Su principal sueño es continuar sus estudios, pero tiene claro que para poder cubrir con los costos, tiene que esforzarse mucho trabajando arduamente y ahorrar.  Pero esta decidida  y lo quiere lograr a corto plazo.
texts.en:
Roxana is 28 years old, and young with much ambition to grow, despite the unemployment situation in her country. She has not crossed her arms and decided to quit, though; instead, she is studying middle education (Bachelor's degree). Though she did not possess sufficient resources to continue her studies, she wishes to return to continue educating herself and have better opportunities for work. She is married, and her husband is a hairdresser. She has two children who are currently in school. 

She works as a saleswoman for beauty products through a catalog. She goes from house to house and receives orders from repeat clients. She has worked in this business for 5 years and says there isn't much to be earned through this work. In the end, though, there are not many opportunities for employment, and this job pays more than what her husband makes in the hair salon. These wages help them manage their situation. 

She sells beauty products every day after 12 PM, because in the morning she has to send her children to school and take care of the household chores. 

Roxana needs this loan to take advantage of the opportunity that has been presented to her. She sells merchandise for the business at a low cost, but doesn't count on this money, because if it takes too long, it could be that another person purchases it and the opportunity she just had is now lost. This is why she decided to take out this loan, which previously was impeding her opportunity to generate sales. 

Her main dream is to continue her studies, but it is clear that to be able to cover costs, she has to work hard and save. But it is decided what she wants to accomplish in the near future.

loans.use: To buy merchandise (beauty products) to invest in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more sheep for her family's farm.

loans.name: Asmaa

texts.en:
Asmaa is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published on-line, so her husband appears in the photo.  
Asmaa is a 37-year-old married woman from Jabalia city. She is a mother of two sons, and two daughters. For the past three years, Asmaa and her husband opened a small farm where they raise sheep. It is a good project and earns a good income, but still needs some development. 
Asmaa took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her and her husband to buy more sheep for their farm. By taking this loan, Asmaa and her husband will be able to develop their farm, and also the family income.

loans.use: to help her and her husband to buy more sheep for their farm.

loans.name: Maysa

texts.en:
Maysa is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published on-line, so her husband appears in the photo.  
Maysa is a 32-year-old married woman from Jabalia city. She is a mother of one son and two daughters. For the past two years, Maysa and her husband opened a small farm where they raise chicken. They sell its meat and eggs in the local market. It is a good project and earns a good income, but still needs some development. 
Maysa took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her and her husband to buy more chickens for their farm. By taking this loan, Maysa and her husband will be able to develop their farm, and also the family income.

loans.use: to help her and her husband to buy more chicken for their farm.

loans.name: Jameela

texts.en:
Born in 1970, Jameela is a married mother of six living in a sector of Jordan called Southern Ghour. Jameela started her mini market 10 years ago when her husband, a blacksmith, was facing financial difficulties. 

Now her mini market is out of food products, so she is requesting this loan to purchase a greater variety of them in order to increase her profits. This will help to improve their living conditions and provide her children with the best education possible.

loans.use: To buy food products for her mini market

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a 49-year-old female, with four children aged 17,16,10, and 9 years whom she supports. This is her third loan of Ksh. 40,000. She was introduced to Vision Fund Kenya by a Vision Fund officer. She sells milk. Her business is located in Miwani, she has been in this business for four years and she earns a monthly income of Ksh. 9000. She’s planning to use the loan to purchase more milk to supply to her customers. She will use the profit to expand the business. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more milk to supply to her customers.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 60 years old, single, and lives in Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She works hard to sustain herself and pay everyday expenses by running a food stall where she sells fish balls. In the Philippines, fish balls are commonly sold on the street, where they are served skewered and can be dipped in different kinds of sauce. They are somewhat flat in shape and are often made with the meat of a cuttlefish. Her other products include squid balls and quail eggs, and her regular customers are neighbors and nearby residents. She earns a minimum of PHP 200 in sales every day.

To help her continue running her business, she is requesting a PHP 13,000 loan to buy more ingredients. Lucia hopes to continuously expand her business and dreams of having a better life. She meets up with co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from her religion.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study religion, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Kuzrat

texts.ru:
Его зовут Кузрат. Ему 34 года. Кузрат ответственный муж, отец двоих детей, пастух и честный мужчина, работающий во благо своей семьи близких. Жена Кузрата работает учительницей в школе. Кузрат занимается животноводством. Один из причин выбора такой профессии является то, что природа и климат района Шахритуса, где он родом благоприятен для здорового развития животных. Курзат работает в сфере животноводства не так давно, но уже знает все тонкости этой деятельности.
  Курзат решил расширить поголовья скотов, потому что расшириться его бизнес и в том числе его доход. Но для приобретения скотов не обходимы средства. У Кузрата не хватает денег, поэтому он обратился за кредитом с надеждой на то, что ему помогут. Помогите ему.
texts.en: His name is Kuzrat.  He is 34 years old.  Kuzrat is a responsible husband, father of two children, shepherd and honest man, working for the good of his family.  Kuzrat's wife works as a teacher at a school.  Kuzrat is involved in animal husbandry.  One of the reasons for choosing this profession is the fact that the nature and climate of the Shahrituz district, where he is from, is favorable for a healthy animal development.  Kuzrat has been working in the animal husbandry not for long, but already knows all of the nuances of this business.  Kuzrat decided to increase his livestock headcount because expanding his business means increasing his income.  But he needs money to buy livestock.  Kuzrat does not have enough money and this is why he requested this loan with the hope that he will be helped.  Help him.

loans.use: to increase livestock headcount

loans.name: Taytacha Señor De Ccoyllority De Yungaqui Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “TAYTACHA SEÑOR DE CCOYLLORITY DE YUNGAQUI”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Anta perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nancy ella es conviviente y tiene 35 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta y crianza de animales y también la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva papa y maíz y también la socia cría los cuyes y gallinas los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuyes y gallinas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y alimentos para los cuyes y gallinas.

Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo en sus diferentes negocios porque no asistieron el dia de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de ganaderia, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de agricultura.




La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank, “TAYTACHA SEÑOR DE CCOYLLORITY DE YUNGAQUI.” This bank is located in the Anta conton, Anta province, administrative division of Cusco. 

The member, Ms. Nancy, is 35 and married with three children. She works in her business of sales and raising animals. She also has a plot of land where she grows potatoes, and corn. She used to raise guinea pigs and hens. She made them grow up and fatten, and sold them in various markets. Through this small business, she improved the lives of her children, and her dream is to have a location where she can sell her guinea pigs and hens. She is asking for a loan to purchase guinea pigs, hens, and feed for the guinea pigs and hens.

The members that are located in the group photo were taken in different businesses because they didn't attend the meeting day, having asked for permission due to work obligations. The other members work in the sale of animals, the livestock business, the grocery business, and the agriculture business. 

Ms. Nancy thanks those who are a part of this dream and promises to make her loan payments by the established deadline.

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs, hens, and feed for the guinea pigs and hens.

loans.name: Rabab

texts.en:
Rabab was born in 1973. She is married and a mother of four, living in a sector of Jordan called Karak, with her retired husband. 

After Rabab noticed the financial crisis her husband was facing, she decided to start running her own mini-market where, for the last two years, she has sold food products. 

Now, her mini-market is out of food products. So, she needs to restock it with new food products and to add variety, in order to expand her business and earn better profits, to improve their living conditions and to provide her children with the best education. But, she doesn't have enough money to do so. Because of this, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more food products for her mini-market.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is a 40-year-old lady; she is passing her life with her husband, three daughters and two sons.

She is taking a loan for her daughter because her daughter is very expert in the art of embroidery. She is very expert in her profession and stitches very fine bridal dresses. 

Due to demand they are facing a shortage of material and are unable to stitch fine embroidery. Therefore, Rubina has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so she can reduce the shortage of embroidery raw material. Through this amount she will buy stocks of threads, fancy cloths, precious stones, sequins, and pearls of various colors. 

Rubina is very thankful to Kiva and the field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy raw material for embroidery.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La socia continua dedicándose al negocio de elaboración de productos lácteos como quesos, yogurt y manjares, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, la socia vende en las diferentes ferias su mercadería a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta  forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche,azucar entre otros.

La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The borrower continues to work in the production of dairy products such as cheese, yogurt, and fudge. For quite a while the borrower has worked in this business and it's been doing well thanks to the daily effort she puts into it. She sells her merchandise at various fairs where the customers ask for her, and she wishes to continue doing this work so she can keep on supporting her family. The borrower requests this loan to purchase milk and sugar, among other things. She is grateful for the loan and is committed to making good on her payments.

loans.use: To purchase milk, sugar, among other things

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more plantains and charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Reeta's Group

texts.en: Reeta, aged 40, is a responsible mother, and living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. This is her fifth loan with BRAC.  She is an old member, and she is taking this loan according to the needs of her family. She belongs to a poor family, and it is very difficult for her to fulfill all the household expenses with poor earnings. In fact, her husband is a hawker by profession, and sells different kinds of hair oils using his bicycle.  He sells avocado oil, castor oil, coconut oil, olive oil, rosemary oil, safflower oil etc. He calls loudly to the consumers and is famous for offering all these hair oils to protect hair from falling out. He wants to buy a large quantity of hair oil to sell to expand his business, and to overcome the poverty.  Therefore, Reeta requested a loan for her husband, so that he can buy more quantities of hair oils.  Reeta is very impressed with this honorable support. She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy various hair oils for selling.

loans.name: Balqis Group

texts.en: Balqis Group consists four women from Al-Hodeida governorate, Yemen. They are requesting a loan of 150,000 YER, which they will use to buy clothes to sell. Amal is 26 years old, single, and the leader of the group. She started her work three years ago as a door-to-door clothing seller when her dad became disabled and unable to cover all his family's expenses. So, she decided to assist her dad to cover their family's expenses. Recently, she decided she would like to expand her business. She has applied for a loan in order to buy clothes for her business. The extra profit will help to start her up for the next season, which in return will help to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy clothes for her business.

loans.name: Ulviya

texts.en:
Ulviya is 37 years old. She is divorced and has 3 children. She and her family are IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from their native land of Agdam city, Azerbaijan. Now she lives with family in the country's Abseron region. One of her daughters goes to seventh grade, another goes to fifth grade, and her son goes to ninth grade. 

Ulviya sells cosmetic and cleaning products like shampoo, perfume, pomade, lipstick, etc. in own home. This is how she provides for her family. She is a  hardworking woman, and works a lot in order to care for her children. 

Today Ulviya wants to increase her business. To do that, she needs 2200 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to buy more products. She's thankful for Kiva's aid. In the future, Ulviya wants to rent a store so she can increase her business.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, perfume, and other personal products.

loans.name: Aziz

texts.en:
Aziz is a 24-year-old married man from Qalqilia city. He lives with his wife in a small, simple house. For the past year, Aziz and his wife have had a small farm where they raise sheep. It is a good project and provides a good income but still needs some development. 

Aziz took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him and his wife to buy more sheep for their farm. By taking this loan, Aziz and his wife will be able to develop their farm and also the family income. Aziz appears in the photo.

loans.use: to  help him and his wife to buy more sheep for their farm.

loans.name: Mohannad

texts.en:
Mohannad is a 21-year-old married man from Qalqilia city. He lives with his wife in a small, simple house. For the past three years, Mohannad and his wife have had a small farm where they raise sheep. It is a good project and provides a good income but still needs some development. 

Mohannad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him and his wife to buy more sheep for their farm. By taking this loan, Mohannad and his wife will be able to develop their farm and also the family income. Mohannad appears in the photo.

loans.use: and his wife to buy more sheep for their farm.

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is a 69-year-old female, is married, and has three grandchildren (aged 17, 13, and 12 years old), whom she supports. This is her fourth loan of 10,000 KES after having been introduced to VisionFund Kenya by an officer from the organization. 

Kadzo's business, located in Malindia, Kenya, is to make makuti - woven thatches for roofing made of leaves. She has done the work for three years and earns 6500 KES per month. She plans to use the loan to purchase more makuti for her business, and will use the profit to expand the business. Kadzo hopes and dreams to expand her business and educate her grandchildren.

loans.use: To purchase more makuti (thatched roofing) for her business.

loans.name: Shohrat

texts.en:
Shohrat is a 37-year-old married pensioner and has a daughter and a son. His wife is a housekeeper. He has worked in a small market selling daily products (bread, butter, milk, salt, sugar, sweets, etc.) for 15 years. His monthly income is 130 AZN.

People's demand for daily products is very high. They buy bread, milk, and water daily. They buy other products (salt, flour, sugar, and milk) to prepare daily foods and dishes. Daily products are the kinds of products used in a daily life and that’s why many shelves of the market get empty by the end of the day.

The assortment of Shohrat’s market isn’t varied enough for the region that he works in. He applied for 1500 AZN in order to expand his assortment and supply more products for his market. He is planning to increase the income of his business and repair his old house.

loans.use: to expand his assortment and supply more products for his market

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, onion, salt, etc.

loans.name: Famil

texts.en: Famil, 54 years old, is married and has two children. Famil is from Fuzuli city and now lives in the Baku region. His wife is a housewife. His elder son is married and his daughter is studying at a music college. He has been in the tailoring business for a long time. Famil sews suits, pants, shirts, jackets and other menswear. Today he has applied for a loan of 1,900 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). With this loan, he wants to buy different materials, which are necessary in his work. This is his second loan. Famil says thanks to the Kiva organization for the aid. In the future, he wants to recruit an assistant.

loans.use: to buy different fabrics

loans.name: Nazim

texts.en:
Nazim is 53 years old and married with a daughter and two sons. He is a seller of household appliances (refrigerators, mixers, blenders, irons, etc.) in an equipment shop at local bazaar. His monthly income is 350 AZN and he gets additional earnings from farming at his free time.

People use such household appliances in their daily life and that’s why there is high demand in this area. This is a kind of area where products wear out very fast and costs are expensive. So people try to buy good appliances with long guarantee.

Nazim tries to sell high-quality products for his clients because he doesn’t want to lose them. He applied for a 1,300 AZN loan to order new quality appliances from suppliers and expand his assortment. He wants to increase his income and cover his family’s demands.

loans.use: to order new quality appliances from suppliers and expand his assortment

loans.name: Arco Iris Group

texts.es: El grupo “ARCO IRIS” está conformado por socios ganaderos y comerciantes minoristas. Roberta tiene 53 años es viuda con 03 hijos independientes. Ella se dedica a la crianza de vacas caballos desde muy joven actividad que aprendió con sus padres. Y a la vez venda queso leche que obtiene de la crianza de sus vacas. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de alimentos para sus vacas y caballos. El grupo agradece por el préstamo brindado. Celinda es la persona sentada del lado izquierdo viste polo rojo.
texts.en: The “Arco Iris” group is made up of farmers and wholesale traders. Roberta is 53, and is a widow with 3 independent children. She raises cows and horses, something she learned at an early age from her parents. She also sells cheese and milk that she gets from her cows. She will invest her loan in buying feed for her cows and horses. The whole group is grateful for the loan. Roberta is the person who is seated on the left of the photo, wearing a red polo shirt.

loans.use: to buy feed for her cows and horses.

loans.name: Lucy Adriana

texts.es:
Ella es Adriana, trabaja en una empresa de mercadeo en la cual se desempeña en apoyo administrativo y revisión de material integrándolo en 4 bases de datos distintas, realizar gestión de mercadeo en el cual se realizan actividades de estudios Cualitativos y Cuantitativos, critica o revisión de material evaluando la secuencia de la encuesta y el diligencia miento de la misma, ella realiza muchas actividades en el trabajo que tiene que ver directamente con la parte de mercadeo y ventas.
El interés específico en estudiar Mercadeo Y Ventas es poder ampliar el conocimiento y perfeccionar el trabajo actual, poder aspirar a lograr un cargo superior al que en este momento se encuentra y aprender  más en profundidad todo lo relacionado con mercadeo y ventas. Ya que esta carrera el proyecto a futuro para distintos campos de acción, representa una oportunidad de crecimiento personal,  para poder terminar esta cerrera se le facilitaría bastante el descuento que tiene kiva ya que se podría beneficiar en el ahorro de algunos gastos que ella tiene para que pueda lograr terminar la carrera y tener una mejor capacidad laboral.
texts.en:
Adriana works in a marketing company where she provides administrative support by reviewing material and entering it into four different databases. She manages marketing tasks, such as conducting qualitative and quantitative studies, editing and revising evaluating the sequence of survey material, and she performs her duties diligently. She performs many tasks at work that directly contribute to  marketing and sales for the organization. 

Her specific interest in studying marketing and sales lies in broadening her understanding and perfecting her current work. She aspires to work in a higher position than she currently holds and to learn more in-depth information about marketing and sales. Since this career will give her projects in the future in different areas of action, it represents an opportunity for personal growth. She will be able to reach her desired career through a loan from Kiva, and will be able to benefit from saving on certain costs that she has, in order to be capable of finishing her career and having a greater working capacity.

loans.use: To pay tuition for a semester

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is 34 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala North region of Uganda. She is married and has two children with one of them currently in school. For the past six years, Rehema has been working hard to manage her poultry farm, selling eggs and chicken. 

To help expand her business, Rehema has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more chickens for egg production and will help Rehema to generate greater profits and improve her standard of living. Rehema hopes that in the future, she will be able to become a leading producer. 




"

loans.use: buy more chickens for egg production

loans.name: Maddy

texts.en:
Maddy is 42 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala North region of Uganda. She is married and has two children with one of them currently in school. For the past four years, Maddy has been working hard to manage her grocery shop, selling bread, milk, sugar, posho, rice, and beans. 

To help expand her business, Maddy has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more bread, milk, sugar, posho, rice and beans, and will help Maddy to generate greater profits and improve her standard of living. Maddy hopes that in the future, she will be able to become a leading shopkeeper. 




"

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: José Alberto

texts.es:
José de 25 años, es un joven muy eficiente ya que quiere poner su propio negocio y no solo depender de su empleo. Actualmente, vive con su mamá y 2 hermanos quienes estudian. José tiene 12 años de trabajar en la ferretería, negocio familiar y 4 años de trabajar reparando computadoras, oficio que lo aprendió de sus amigos. Ademas, estuvo de empleado en una empresa que se dedicaba a la venta de camisas estampadas. 
Con el crédito se le estará ayudando al cliente, para que pueda invertir en productos como: blusas, camisas, pantalones y hacerles el proceso de estampado ya que tiene la experiencia y ademas tiene buena ubicación. 
Quiere poner su propio negocio y ser independiente.
texts.en: José is 25 years old and is a productive young man considering that he wants to start his own business and not depend soley on his job. Currently, he lives with his mom and two siblings who go to school. José has 12 years of work in the hardware store, a family business, and 4 years of work repairing computers which he learned from his friends. In addition, he was employed by a business that works in the sale of graphic shirts. With the help of the loan, the client will be able to invest in products like blouses, shirts, and pants and then print graphics on them because he already has the experience. In addition he has a good location. He wants to start his own business and be independent.

loans.use: to invest in the sales of printed clothes.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is 44 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past 10 years, Benard has been working hard to manage his phone accessories business, selling all types of phones. 

To help expand the business, Benard has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more phones to expand his business and will help Benard to generate greater profits and increase his daily sales. Benard hopes that in the future, he will be able to have more houses to rent. 




"

loans.use: to buy more phones to sell

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en:
Robinah is 37 years old and lives in the town of Tororo in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has five children who are all currently in school. For the past two years, Robinah has been working hard to manage her mobile money business, which deals in money transactions. 

To help expand the business, Robinah has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to add cash to the business and will help Robinah to generate greater profits and pay fees for her family. Robinah hopes that in the future, she will be able to educate her children.

loans.use: to have cash available to process mobile money transactions

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 50-years-old and lives in the town of Tororo in the Mbale region of Uganda.  She is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past 15 years, Ruth has been working hard to manage her bar, which sells food, beer and sodas. 

To help expand the business, Ruth has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase beers, sodas and food items and will help Ruth to generate greater profits and help her educate her children. Ruth hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business.

loans.use: purchase beers, sodas and food items

loans.name: Nabil

texts.en:
Nabil is 46 years old and married, with one son. His wife is a housekeeper. He is a farmer and he does animal husbandry. He raises cows, selling their meat and milk. He has worked in this field for 26 years, has good skills, and his monthly income is AZN 120.

Azerbaijan people prepare different delicious dishes from cow meat, such as dushbere, qutab, kifte, etc. They drink milk, not only in the morning, because it’s tasty and very useful for health. They also use milk to prepare different cakes and cookies.

Nabil wants to expand his small business because his income isn’t enough to cover his family’s demands. He applied for an AZN 2,000 loan in order to improve the condition of his animal husbandry business. This is Nabil's third loan and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to improve the condition of his animal husbandry business.

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en:
Elchin is 37-years-old and married with two sons and three daughters. His wife is a housekeeper. He sells mobile telephones in a shop and has gained good skills working in this field for 17 years. His monthly income is 100 AZN. He gets additional money from his pension. 

Demands in such techniques as mobile telephones have increased nowadays. All people use them in their daily life. They make calls in urgent cases or send messages of important information when they need to. They can call someone who is far away. 

There are many new models of mobile telephones that people would like to buy. And Elchin applied for a 1,400 AZN loan in order to buy more new models to expand the assortment at his shop. He hopes that one day his income will increase and he will be able to provide his big family a good life.

loans.use: to buy more new models of mobile phones to expand the assortment at his shop.

loans.name: Lidieth

texts.es: Lidieth, tiene la edad  de 37 años, está casada,  vive con su esposo y sus hijos los cuales su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle en el momento de la siembra y así que tenga una buena geminación lo más uniforme posible para que el rendimiento de la cosecha sea adecuado, y semilla de maíz y frijol de buena calidad que se adapte bien a las condiciones del suelo y fertilidad del mismo, además pagar mano de obra en la preparación del terreno y la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante.
